author: {'steamid': '76561198114221912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1472273445}
review:
Strider Hiryu is back in action, not alone though, he's got his gang of animal pals, now upgraded to plasma beings instead of plain old robots. And guess what? His sword is still his trusty sidekick.

Now, let's talk gameplay. This ain't your grandpa's arcade game. No siree! This one's got depth, like a philosophical debate in a bar. Hiryu's moveset got a makeover too. We're talking Marvel vs Capcom moves making a cameo. You can juggle enemies, parry projectiles, and all that jazz. Dodging attacks is the name of the game here, no blocking nonsense.

Sure, the PC port ain't perfect. You might experience some lag and screen tearing, but don't let that ruin the party. Overall, if you dig action platformers or you're a Strider fanatic, this reboot is like a fine wine – gets better with every sip.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982100596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1708886932}
review:
A very flashy and fun little metroidvania.  

Pros
-Controls are tight and movement and combat feel good and responsive.
-Fun (but not terrible challenging) bosses.
-Flashy and stylish characters and attacks.
-Unlockable challenge runs

Cons
-A bit too easy on Normal difficulty (especially compared to other 2d ninja games like The Messenger and Cyber Shadows)
-Bland environments (lots of grey industrial stuff makes the areas all blend together)
-low enemy variety
-A tiny bit buggy (if you watch speedruns though you will see how broken the game really is)

Overall
Not the best or worst at anything it does, but solid and very stylish.  If you are a fan of metrodvanias or ninja games pick it up (hopefully on sale).  Otherwise check out the Messenger and Cyber Shadows first then circle back to this one.

review:
Era mediocre até a reta final, onde dropei por ter um pico retardado na dificuldade, quando todos os problemas dele se agravam mais ainda.
Você não tem I-frames depois de tomar um golpe que te atordoa, então caso um boss use um golpe que te derrube, facilmente tu vai tomar stunlock e perder toda a vida ou morrer. Outro problema que vem disso é a hitbox dos bosses e mobs comuns, a hitbox não é só a parte do corpo do inimigo com o qual ele ataca, é a MERDA DO CORPO TODO, ou seja, tu escapou do golpe mas relou na cabeça do boss? Ficou de xereca. Isso sem contar quando você fica preso entre 2 mobs e fica tomando dano sem poder fazer nada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119248951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1707565519}
review:
いわゆる「メトロイドヴァニア系」としてリブートされたストライダー飛竜。
ざっくり言うとそんな感じ。探索要素はほとんどないけど。

序盤はやることが少なくてかったるいのですが、武器（サイファー）の属性、
オプション、飛び道具（クナイ）が揃ってきたあたりから一気に面白みが増します。
広いマップを右往左往するのが苦にならず、手も頭も忙しいゲームが好きな人向け。

タイトルはオリジナルのアーケードゲームと同じですが、基本的には別ゲー。
オマージュはふんだんに取り入れられていますが、良くも悪くも別物感が強いので、
かつてのアーケード版を懐かしむ用途には向いてない気がします。

ちなみに、Ryzenの内蔵GPUだと頻繁にクラッシュするので買ってしばらく放置していましたが、
グラボ買ってひさびさに起動してみたら安定して遊べるようになりました。

author: {'steamid': '76561199340571172', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1705520075}
review:
首先，游戏的操作非常简单直观，玩家可以通过简单的按键组合来进行各种动作，如跳跃、攻击、躲避等。这种简单的操作方式使得游戏容易上手，但又不失挑战性，让玩家可以在游戏中尽情施展自己的操作技巧。

其次，游戏的关卡设计非常精彩，每个关卡都充满了各种陷阱和敌人，玩家需要不断地思考和尝试，才能找到通关的方法。而且，游戏中还设置了一些隐藏的道具和秘密，让玩家可以尽情探索，增加了游戏的可玩性。

此外，游戏的音乐和音效也非常出色，配合着游戏的节奏和氛围，让玩家完全沉浸在游戏的世界中。而游戏的故事情节也非常吸引人，让玩家在不断的战斗和探索中，逐渐揭开游戏世界的神秘面纱。

总的来说，STRIDER™ / ストライダー飛竜® 是一款非常出色的动作冒险游戏，无论是画面、操作、关卡设计还是音乐，都让人感到非常满意。如果你是喜欢动作游戏的玩家，那么这款游戏绝对不容错过。

author: {'steamid': '76561198148561699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1705924540}
review:
Strider ist ein Action-Sidescroller mit Metroidvania Elementen. Strider steuert sich geschmeidig und es macht Spaß sich durch die Levels zu kämpfen. Es gibt viele Bosskämpfe, die aber nur Mittelmaß sind. Einige werden wiederverwendet. Im letzten Viertel des Spiels werden Gegner eingeführt, die einen einfrieren können, was nervend ist. Und das letzte Level Meio’s Tower ist ein so großer Sprung im Schwierigkeitsgrad und das auf die frustrierendste Art und Weise. Das Letzte Level ist vollgespickt mit den nervigsten Gegnern des Spiels.

Grafisch geht das Spiel in Ordnung. Solange nicht nah an die veralteten Charaktermodelle rangezoomt wird.

Die Story hat keinen Anfang und man wird mitten rein ohne Kontext geworfen.

Wenn man nicht alle Level absucht, ist das Spiel etwas kurz.

Strider macht über die größte Strecke Laune und ist kurzweilige Action-Unterhaltung.

review:
Not sure I would recommend it. I think it's a solid effort, but combat is not that interesting, you mostly mash the attack button and sometimes do a bit of dodging, but by the end of a playsession your hand will hurt from having to mash attack so constantly as you move through rooms. Control is never precise enough to avoid attacks, you kind of end up flying into them by tapping any direction, and there is no iFrame when you get hit so you can get stun locked by a barrage of projectiles. Some boss fights felt kind of unfair because of the need for precision but no ability to execute it.

I forced myself to finish this game after nearly a decade of owning it, but I don't think it lives up to other metroidvanias. If you want a great action platformer/metroidvania, try The Messenger instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164920596', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 1481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1481, 'last_played': 1650820921}
review:
Strider — одно из забытых сокровищ игровой индустрии. Аркадная игра, вышедшая еще в 1989 году, стала одним из первых хитов Capcom, собрала великолепную прессу, была портирована на 12 платформ, обзавелась сразу двумя независимыми сиквелами (американским и японским) и благополучно канула в Лету. В недалеком прошлом ее собирались вернуть к жизни разработчики Bionic Commando Rearmed, но проект отменили. К счастью, Capcom решили сделать вторую попытку и отдали проект студии Double Helix, авторам недавнего ремейка Killer Instinct.
Новая Strider — это фактически та же самая игра 24 лет от роду, только доработанная технологически и идейно. Действие разворачивается в не столь далеком будущем, где мир порабощен жестоким диктатором, который известен лишь как Гроссмейстер и заседает почему-то в Казахстане (стартовая локация игры — злодейская столица под названием Казахград). Главный герой — член ордена техно-ниндзя, которых окружающие называют страйдерами. Его миссия — проникнуть в логово негодяя и избавить от него Землю.
отя Strider была придумана еще во времена царя Гороха, в ней есть множество механик, которые выглядят свежо даже сегодня. Например, уровни здесь линейны, но линейность эта очень условная. На каждой карте есть множество расположенных в стороне от магистрального пути закоулков, в которых спрятаны апгрейды и бонусы. Это создает, хоть и немного ложное, но приятное ощущение свободы. Оно дополнительно усиливается благодаря возможности карабкаться практически по любым поверхностям при помощи специального крюка.
Сражения очень динамичны, многие драки происходят буквально на бегу. Фантастически приятно влететь в толпу роботизированных приспешников режима, не останавливаясь разрубить их на части и убежать дальше по своим делам.
Отдельного упоминания заслуживают боссы. Например, уже в конце первого уровня герою противостоит гигантский летающий червь, длинное тело которого становится непосредственно полем битвы, так что, глядя, как страйдер карабкается вверх по утыканной шипами металлической «шкуре» невольно вспоминаешь Shadow of the Colossus.
Единственный по-настоящему архаичный элемент Strider — это довольно скупо расставленные чекпойнты. Временами приходится заново пробегать чуть ли не половину уровня, чтобы добраться до места последней гибели. Хотя, учитывая, что в оригинальной версии игры и вовсе было ограниченное количество продолжений, а герой по умолчанию умирал от трех попаданий, можно считать, что современные игроки легко отделались.
В последнее время выходит немало ремейков и обновлений классических видеоигр. Strider, пожалуй, одна из самых успешных попыток скрестить классический хардкорный геймплей с современными концепциями игрового дизайна. Это увлекательная, быстрая и красивая игра, за которой приятно провести несколько часов. Если вы соскучились по концептуально простым, но интересным экшенам, Strider скорее всего принесет вам немало удовольствия.
ОЦЕНКА: ⭐⭐⭐⭐

author: {'steamid': '76561198079526631', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1704426724}
review: An overall just okay metroidvania title, both exploration and movement feel fun, most of the bosses are enjoyable to take down and the graphics work well for the most part. It doesnt have much unique to it you can't find in a similar title though, while also having some pretty obvious flaws. Primarily that the designers really thought the combat was gonna be fun and put way too many forced combat trials, when combat is mostly repetitive and frustrating. Especially in the middle sections of the game when strider hits like a limp noodle and enemies start getting way too much health creating slogs in a overall pretty short title. In the end the game was still enjoyable and its flaws are hardly just its own so i reccomend trying it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198948245017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1703719597}
review:
Really enjoyed this game. 

While the enviroments feel a bit bland, and Strider himself IS increadibly bland, the mechanics are really solid and with any other metroidvania when you get the upgrades to get rolling, you just never stop. 

Also the achievements are kinda easy, now scowering every bit of the map to find that collectable you missed in any metroidvania is always a chore but for example the speed run achievement is increadibly leneant, the ingame timer pauses whenever you pause and when you die and return to the check point you the timer goes back to when you got that check point, I got that achievement by accident in my first run cuz I didn't focus so much on collecting stuff and just tried to get used to the game. 

Also, the hard mode clear and normal mode clear achievements don't stack, so you need to do 2 separate runs if you want all of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134835709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1562, 'last_played': 1704570821}
review:
Jugabilidad frenética, pero sólida.
Una vez dominas todas las mecánicas, te sentirás como un demonio imparable, pero aun así, nunca llegará a ser fácil del todo, ni tampoco debes bajar la guardia por más fuerte que seas. 
Las peleas, ya sea con jefes o con enemigos comunes están bien logradas y tienen una dificultad justa.
Los diseños son geniales y la ambientación es de lo mejor que he visto,
La ciudad es HERMOSA, de los mejores escenarios que hay en videojuegos, aunque un poco desaprovechada si no te dedicas a explorarla. Si aprecias de escenarios bien hechos y pensar en las historias de los escenarios, disfrutarás mucho del mapa.
Los diálogos son feos y las cinemáticas no convencen para nada, pero tampoco hay muchas.

Si lo disfrutas poco a poco y lo competas al 100%, sin problema te puede entretener varios días y alrededor de 30 horas, . Es muy disfrutable.

review:
+ Good Graphics and great backgrounds/details
+ Played after the fix in Dec 2023 that address multi-core processors, Kudos for that! 

- No Fast Travel
- Miss-able Achievements that require a complete replay to get
- Controls that are not as good as they should be
- No indication of damage near the player or vibration of controller
- Areas of Precision Platforming
- Cannot by-pass *SOME* cut-scenes
- Two crashes 

A really mixed experience.  There were some cool parts.  But the game is frustrating a lot.  I got to the end, and I just didn't care enough to finish.  If you have ever played Shadow Complex Remastered, this game feel very much like it.

review:
Esta tercera entrega de Strider es como una combinación entre los dos juegos anteriores, los gráficos están bien para la época y hay cosas nuevas como poderes extra para la cypher (fuego, hielo, etc) los cuáles resultan bastante útiles contra distintos tipos de enemigos. Por último muchas gracias Capcom por haber parcheado el juego al fin!! No podía luchar la batalla final debido a que se me crasheaba todo, incluso jugando con la gráfica en lo más bajo el error persistía y me había resignado, pero ya se pudo!!
Espero que saquen un Strider 4, siguiendo la tradición de un juego nuevo cada 10 o 15 años, debería estar saliendo el próximo año o el 2029, lo estaré esperando eh > :c (?

author: {'steamid': '76561198074002166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1701531519}
review:
Purchased the game because it was suppose to have similar movement/controls to Metroid Dread, however I was hugely dissapointed. The combat is not satisfying at all. It feels like slicing through thin air when you kill enemies. Theres no weight to it at all. Its also very one-dimensional, like a nes/snes runner/hack n slash, whereas MD was multilayered and all buttons do somehting. The level design is also boring and one-dimensional. Nothing exciting or challenging.

Dont get fooled by the positive reviews if you are someone who is picky with your metroidvanias. If you've played hollow knight, ori 2 and metroid dread this one will be a huge step down. Its more like shovel knight but even less satisfying combat.

Do not recommend this one.

review:
RESEÑA EN ESPAÑOL (Castellano)
¡Buenas a todos! Pocas palabras tengo que decir de este juego, STRIDER, un plataformas de toda la vida en el que a medida que vamos avanzado, mejoramos a nuestro personaje.
La dificultad del mismo es bastante asequible así que no debería suponeros muchas dificultades.
Luce muy bien gráficamente y si te gusta completar todos los logros tendrás unas cuantas horas de juego que en mi caso han sido treinta y seis.
Recomendado cien por cien y para jugarlo en el Steam Deck es perfecto.
Muestra: https://youtu.be/mhLZllnF2bY

RESENYA EN LLENGUA VALENCIANA (N. d'El P.)
¡Bones a tots! Poques paraules tinc que dir d'este joc, STRIDER, un plataformes de tota la vida en el que a mida que anem alvançat, millorem al nostre personage.
La dificultat del mateix és prou assequible aixina que no deuria supondre-vos moltes dificultats.
Lluïx molt ben gràficament i si t'agrada completar tots els guanys tindràs unes quantes hores de joc que en el meu cas han segut trentassís.
Recomanat cent per cent i per a jugar-lo en el Steam Deck és perfecte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198391635639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1599572748}
review:
Strider – a reboot of the SEGA game from the nineties, with lightning fast action which requires equally fast reactions. This means I haven’t been able to finish it and I got super frustrated, just like with all the games of this type.
The graphics are stylized and very nice to look at. There is also a barely visible sort of vertical grid, which I guess is included to be reminiscent of the old console games and the screens they were played on. Other than that, the basic enemies all look similar, with a few exceptions, such as elite soldiers, bugs, and giant robots. 
The backgrounds in some levels are impressive, I have to say, and give the impression that you are playing a level in a much bigger world than the game really has. The sound is satisfying as well. Hits and slashes sound good, and so do the death screams of defeated enemies. The music is appropriately epic, but nothing too spectacular.
The gameplay is, like I’ve mentioned, quite fast, but the game introduces it in increments. When you begin, you can only jump and attack at close range. As the game progresses, you unlock the slide, double jump, dash, range attacks, and all the other moves which are the staple of action platformers.
In no part of the game do you feel bored, but there are a few major problems with the game that made me rage quit a few times. First, the game starts off too easy. It literally takes one hit to kill most enemies, which lulls you into a false state of safety. 
As you progress, however, this starts to change quite a bit. The enemies become more resilient, armored, and shielded, their weapons become overpowered (plasma rifles, I’m looking at you), their behavior becomes too annoying (those damn bugs!), and the game itself is pretty much impossible by the end, when you are in the elevator and the enemies just pile up on you. Perhaps this is just due to me being bad at these types of games, which is a possibility I’m not denying.
The boss fights, paradoxically, are almost not hard at all. Once you get the pattern down, they just become exercises in following their movement and avoiding the attacks. The animations are fun to look at, at least, and the bosses are all quite different, each with their own strengths and weaknesses, and sometimes even fun to fight. All, except for the Gravitron. That thing can go die with other annoying game bosses.
The story is ludicrous, but befitting a game that was created at a time when an Italian plumber jumping on mushrooms was an acceptable plot. The titular Strider is a typical manga ninja cyber assassin, who holds his sword behind his back when running. He has the task of eliminating Grandmaster Meio, the ruler of Kazakh, an evil country that is totally not Soviet Russia. You will fight, among others, a mad and eccentric scientist, four martial arts ladies with huge thighs, and a general who wears a fur hat on his bearded head, talks with a thick accent, and runs around on robot raptor legs. If that is not enough to entertain you, I don’t know what might.
One thing that this game succeeds is actually making you feel like a ninja. You’ll do a double jump and dash to grab hold of the underside of a platform with your daggers. Then you’ll jump up, slice the enemy in two, and slide into a ventilation shaft. On the other side, a flying machine will try to attack you, but not before you throw shurikens at it, and use your sword to deflect the laser from the turret. The game is full of moments like these.
All in all, Strider is a fun, albeit increasingly hard game, that verges on impossible for me. It had some really intense and interesting moments, and it had me screaming and cursing as well. If you like these kinds of games, and you excel under pressure, go play Strider, and be a ninja cyber assassin who saves the world from an evil Grandmaster and his lackeys.

review:
[h1]𝕋𝕙𝕖 𝕝𝕖𝕘𝕖𝕟𝕕𝕒𝕣𝕪 𝕊𝕥𝕣𝕚𝕕𝕖𝕣 𝕒𝕤𝕤𝕒𝕦𝕝𝕥𝕤 ℝ𝕦𝕤𝕤𝕚𝕒 𝕥𝕙𝕚𝕤 𝕥𝕚𝕞𝕖... 𝔸𝕗𝕥𝕖𝕣 𝕙𝕖 𝕨𝕒𝕤 𝕕𝕠𝕟𝕖, 𝕠𝕟𝕝𝕪 𝕒 𝕤𝕡𝕒𝕣𝕜 𝕠𝕗 𝕙𝕚𝕤 𝕗𝕝𝕠𝕒𝕥𝕚𝕟𝕘 𝕣𝕖𝕕 𝕤𝕔𝕒𝕣𝕗 𝕣𝕖𝕞𝕒𝕚𝕟𝕖𝕕![/h1]

If you've played any Capcom Vs game before, you'd know who Strider is... Adept of Ninjitsu, master of swords, vanquisher of evil AND foiler of masterminds.

Welcome to Khazakh, where Strider is sent to investigate some sort of dictatorship. What he finds, however, are plenty of soldiers to cut in half, as well as flying robots that Strider can parry and deflect their bullets into them, annahilating them instantly. Strider is kind of... ruthless like that.

Strider is an amazing, PERFECT platformer. There is absolutely nothing bad I can say about this game, other than how difficult they've made backtracking to find missed collectibles. Strider is very rapid, and his sword play is even quicker. After defeating certain cringe bosses, Strider uncovers his lost tools in the city of Khazakh, Eagle Option especially is very useful to get rid of mobs quickly and effortlessly. Strider can also climb unto walls and later, FLY! You've heard me, Strider can fly, so if you feel bored at first, I advise you to keep playing.

Strider is [b]9.5/10[/b] platformer goodness. Its quick action bossfights are very memorable, and you feel like you are in there saving the Russians in Khazakh, that have willingly given into oppression and become slaves... Sigh!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061481125', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1695010911}
review:
Pues está bien.

A pesar de que soy fan de la saga Strider Hiryu lo empecé con dudas porque no sabía lo que me iba a encontrar ya que hubo una época en la que Capcom no hizo las cosas como a mí me gustaban.

Pero al final ha resultado ser bueno, me he llevado una sorpresa muy positiva.
La historia de este juego es un reboot del Strider 2, reutiliza elementos, enemigos, mecánicas, etc. de este, pero todo adaptado al género metroidvania.

Un mapa con varias zonas muy diferenciadas, diferentes mejoras que vas consiguiendo, también coleccionables... y lo más importante: bosses finales épicos.

Como pega le pondría que una vez le pillas el tranquillo y consigues ciertas habilidades es bastante facilón. No es el mejor metroidvania que he jugado, ojo, pero aunque es sencillito cumple. Ha superado mis expectativas.

Esta ha sido mi reseña y al que no le guste que le den. 7/10

review: Que no se me mal entienda. No lo recomiendo porque sea un mal juego. Es un muy buen juego, muy frenético, con una respuesta en los mandos muy sublime tanto en los saltos como al atacar con el sable, al punto de que al golpear con el sable lo hace tal cual el ritmo de pulsado que hagas y eso me parece un gran acierto. Puede que haya faltado un poquito más de esfuerzo en los diseños de niveles y hecho en falta un avance rápido entre zonas, ya que la función de la pantera es de desbloquear zonas más que de un avance rápido como tal. Por último, la razón de por qué no lo puedo recomendar, es porque a pesar de que esta gráficamente bien optimizado, tiene un problema grave de recurrentes crasheos o cierres inesperados, lo cual me sucede curiosamente cuando utilizo el sable en alguna zonas, y esto no me sucede solo a mi, es cosa de revisar en la comunidad de steam. Al parecer, el problema puede que tenga que ver con los efectos de brillo del sable o el efecto que se produce al explotar los enemigos y al romper cosas, porque también me a sucedido al romper las cajas que dan vida y energía. A pesar de lo anterior, pude seguir avanzando al no golpear en las zonas especificas donde se producía el problema. Así que, tengan en cuenta ese gran inconveniente a la hora de hacer la compra. Espero puedan resolver el gran problema en algún momento.

author: {'steamid': '76561199515801102', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1690405851}
review:
Well, I'll start from the beginning. I first discovered Strider Hiryu in Marvel vs. Capcom for Playstation, and thought the character was really cool. The more I played as him, the more I felt I had to have more. From there, I got the NES and Genesis versions, and I really started to dive into the lore. After that I played an emulation of the arcade version, and then in December 2022 I bought the 2014 Strider, and I firmly believe that this is truly what Strider was always meant to be, without any constraints or limitations, just pure, heart-pounding action from start to finish, but still with an underlying story that is sparse enough so as not to interrupt the action, but present enough that you don't lose sight of the ultimate goal. 

     And there really is nothing quite like running at top speed on the first stage, just slashing non-stop and effortlessly blowing through any enemy foolish enough to stand in a Strider's way.

     In addition, the story is just vague enough that it can bring players together in discussions about different theories and fan fiction, but still present enough that you don't lose sight of the ultimate goal. There is even a slew of collectibles to add to the gameplay experience and challenge the player, especially in the Research Facility. Not only do they offer a challenge, but a reward; the Fallen Striders give Hiryu excellent changes in color palette to suit many different tastes, and the enemy and story intel expand upon the world and story of the game for those, like me, who want to know more about the amazing world that Capcom and Double Helix have created. 

     Another excellent aspect of Strider is all of the callbacks and easter eggs from the old games, and beyond their mere presence, that they actually tie in to the story of the game and make sense and are explained therein, rather than being just for the sake of nostalgia like so many other games of today.

  And, although this as gone on far too long already, I just end this review without talking about the gameplay. The pace and speed of the gameplay, combined with the sheer multitude and variety of enemies, the well crafted and inventive boss fights, and the mass of upgrades, abilities, and attacks available to Hiryu, this game makes for one of the best gaming experiences that I have ever had. The 2014 Strider will forever live in my heart as one of my favorite video games of all time. In fact, this game is the entire reason that I began PC gaming and am currently on Steam! So thanks Strider!

Well, if you actually made it through this whole thing, thanks for reading!
I'm gonna consider this my tribute to my favorite character of all time!
TAKE ME TO YOUR BOSS!

Oh, by the way, I'm a fan of Strider! Hahaha!

ROCK ON, everybody!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073444151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1899, 'last_played': 1689543428}
review:
First time I played this game was in 2.017 with my old laptop, it ran on 10 FPS tops. Now in 2.023 I finally did 100%, and here is my opinion about it:

Oh, if you have any issues booting the game, there are some tutorials here on Steam, hope they can help you on that.

Moving on, the gameplay is very fluid, everything works on the gamepad. The sound could be better, the voice acting is just ok, there are no memorable lines and the O.S.T. is barely audible, but I listened to it with more care and it is good, but again not memorable. Graphics are on the spot for a 2.014, you can see some parts were rushed.

And just one image for the collectibles? Come on, you could do better than that! Also, listening to the bosses talking without opening their mouth is just terrible. Last game I remember that I've seen that was on the PS2! Plus, it was also a Capcom game, called Shadow of Rome.

Final Score: Five Fallen Striders and One Pow, a well earned 6 out of 10.

Game on and have fun!

Just a reminder: Play the game and have your own opinion!

review:
Note: Big edit after the dotted line. I didn't want to take out what I said....but I wanted to update it after more play:

note 2: Another big dotted line. TL;DR If you can't be bothered to fix your game from crashing, you get an instant thumbs down:

Strider is always a special series to me. I first saw it in the arcade and it looked amazing. Then I tried the NES version when that came out. This is where my love for the series began...and I really mean love. Strider on NES is one of my favorite games on that system and probably the game I have beaten the most in my life. I had everything memorized, down to where every file would drop on the screen. It still is an amazing game.

Strider Returns was awful (but that really isn't part of the series anyway) and Strider 2 was good enough to get a couple playthroughs. That brings us to this one.

This Strider feels like if the arcade and NES versions were merged, with the more current technology. You can call it a Metroidvania if you want...but it still feels more stage like to me. Hiryu has more access to climb everywhere, and the levels can be pretty big. It checks all the boxes just right for what a Strider game should be: crazy cypher swinging action, interesting bosses, exploration, and climbing walls and ceilings. Everything is just right.

Sounds promising right? So why the thumbs down on a series I really love? Because it is missing something major.

Strider has no heart.

It really feels like the developers wanted to make it Strider, so they incorporated everything that needs to be into it properly...they just didn't put that love into it to make it good. The areas look nice but turn out to be boring. The enemies are traditional good, but uninteresting. Climbing everywhere becomes a chore. The map is functional, but is bare bones and a little confusing. The power ups are so-so. There is noting I can say is missing in the design, but it just not good design. I mean, it might as well be a Spiderman game....it would check all the right boxes for that too, but nothing convinces me it was designed to be strictly Strider.

Its a shame because I absolutely love the Strider series....but this? I'd rather go back and play the NES version for the 1,000th time. 

This Strider..the body is here in complete form. But it feels dead inside.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Here comes the edited section, and everything above couldn't be more wrong. The problem was that I didn't understand the game like I thought I did when writing this review.

Because of the adventure style, I was treating it too much like a hybrid of the arcade and NES version.  I wasn't focusing on exploring the areas like I should have. And I wasn't using my map. Not using my map was the big problem. I expected this to be a little more straight forward level-by-level. 

Its not. There is backtracking and searching around needed. It isn't really "Metroidvania", but it has aspects of those style of games. 

I do stand by the enemies being boring, but the combat gets pretty crazy. I also stand by the Spiderman comment, but it doesn't bother me as much as I get more into the exploring side.....not being in such a rush to get to "the next level" or so I thought.

This game has stepped up dramatically in my opinion once I knew what I was actually supposed to be doing.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Now for the third part:

I got to a section where I have to fight a boss. There is no way to save on the way, and it took me a good amount of time to get to the boss. Mid fight, dialogue came up and the game froze and then crashed. This is the 4th crash I have had, and the most annoying.

I loaded it up again, and started my path to the boss. Getting halfway (and through the harder parts to get to him), it froze and crashed again.

No sympathy: if you don't fix it, you don't deserve a recommendation. I think i will go back to the NES version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063035714', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 996, 'last_played': 1687599414}
review:
[b]NOTE: I'm changing my review to a negative one. They somehow, FINALLY, bothered fixing the CPU crash issue... only because they had the chance to do that while they were adding the Enigma DRM to the game.
Performance-tanking anti-mod bloatware.[/b]
Original review below.




[b]Strider[/b] is a 2014 reboot of the old... Strider games. Those slash-em-up platformers that debuted on the arcade, got ONE sequel and then dropped off the face of the planet (outside of the main guy appearing in MvC).
I KNOW Capcom has a... [i]reputation[/i] for doing edgy gritty reboots in this era that would get nowhere and just kinda suck in general. You might think this is one of those considering it never got followed up on.
[b]But no, it's actually pretty damn good.[/b]


It's a 2.5D Metroidvania. The original games were linear platformers, this one sorta expands the formula into a full-on open map that you explore as you get more abilities.
Your moveset is also a REALLY good expansion on both the original games and the protagonist's MvC appearances; you have directional slashes, that come out INSTANTLY and can be done as fast as you can mash the button (you can attack as lightspeed like a funny ninja).
You also have doublejumping, a slide kick, a stomp attack, a [b]launcher attack[/b] (!!!) that lets you [I]juggle enemies[/i] (this is not at all necessary to do, it's just for flair), 4 different elemental variants of your blade with different effects each, and an aimable dash that can be done in any direction and has special effects depending on your weapon.

Now, it might just be the Sonic PTSD kicking in, but I'm at a point where I'll go into 3D/2.5D games EXPECTING the controls to be floaty, stilted, jerky and delayed. It's like a staple of 3D at this point, main characters that are janky physics objects that lock up your controls for multiple frames while figuring out what to do.
[b]But I'm happy to say this game controls DAMN well for what it is.[/b] Your attacks and inputs are recognized INSTANTLY, and your movement is as tight as it gets. You can maneuver in mid-air to your heart's content like you would in a Megaman game, and your airdash (once you unlock it) gives you some CRAZY aerial mobility on top of that. It's [i]tight[/i].


...That said though, the combat is kind of... not balanced all that well?
Enemies can and will shoot bursts of bullets with no telegraphing, but you take VERY low damage from most things. Like the game doesn't EXPECT you to avoid attacks, so you'll be eating stray bullets a lot.
Weapons are also not really all that well balanced, with the fire and gravity swords really OUTCLASSING the other two by a long margin. Fire deals a ridiculous amount of damage per swing, and gravity extends your reach with boomerang projectiles (at the cost of slightly limiting your attack speed by 2 projectiles on screen at a time).
You compare this with two lower damage swords, one of which reflects projectiles (useful, but not needed since you take so little damage) with the other one freezing enemies (not so useful, still low damage, frozen enemies block your path).

Bosses are also kinda hard to make out on a first run, with weird attack patterns with little telegraphing that aren't very intuitive to figure out just LOOKING at them. You'll figure it out if you pay a bit of attention but again, it's rough on your first time.

Honestly my BIGGEST gripe with the game overall is the level design.
Or rather, not the level design ITSELF but [b]the lack of PROPER fast travel or warping[/b].
Almost every area has warp spots laid throughout that (once you have the right ability unlocked) take you to ANOTHER specific, fixed warp spot either in the same area or a different one.
It's COOL-looking, especially when you're warping between layers of a single area (it's 2.5D so you can move into the background and vice-versa) but it just makes going back for collectibles a bit more of a pain than it needs to be, ESPECIALLY with how huge the areas are.
It's not a problem if you like the gameplay and don't mind running back and forth, but it does make the game a bit longer than it really could've been if you go for 100%.



The graphics are [i]decent[/i] for what it is; it's not a very colorful game as the originals were, but the environments are varied enough and actually DO have different marked color schemes to make them easier to make out (the sewers having lots of greens, the temple browns, the factory blues, military areas being reddish, etc). They're old but they're more than serviceable for what they are.
Characters don't move their mouth when speaking though which makes cutscenes a bit funny to look at, but I can forgive that considering this game didn't really have that big of a budget to begin with.


The music's... [i]fine[/i], it serves its purpose during gameplay well, but there's not that many memorable memories here. I just finished [b]100%ing the game[/b] and I only remember about two or three melodies tops.


The story is... simple, honestly. The game jumps STRAIGHT into gameplay with not that much emphasis on cutscenes, and the story is simple enough that it doesn't need it. Stop the evil cultist dude that took over not-Russia. It's a retelling of the first game's plot which was an [i]arcade[/i] game, so there's your point of reference.
There's a lot of unlockable gallery extras that give you tidbits of information on each character and area though, which is actually pretty cool if you actually want to know more about these not-very-well-explained characters and locales.



Overall? Yeah, I like the game, minor gameplay design gripes aside. It's REALLY damn good for what it is, for the year it came out, and for the small budget it was given.
Maybe get it on a sale?

author: {'steamid': '76561198042044934', 'num_games_owned': 2133, 'num_reviews': 336, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1687393578}
review:
Strider is a [i](both literally and metaphorically)[/i] fast paced scrolling Metroidvania. While a very short game, it's a wonderful experience to play for a day or two, and it doesn't overstay it's welcome.

Strider's Graphics are good. Not great, just good. There are sweeping vistas to see, combined with stylized characters and anime effects. It also plays a lot with vibrant colors, and things ARE color coded which adds to the style. It certainly can feel a bit jumbled, but it all comes together to make the game look quite nice.

Audio is a bit of both. Voice Acting is not good, it's just plain old bad. Everything else is passable, if not quite good. Satisfying hits, joyous level up sounds, and good mechanical sounds from threats.

The story is just OK. It's very minimalist, with very little being explained to you and with most exposition coming from either rare cutscenes or in characters speaking to you while you're moving in the world. You're Hiryu, on a mission to kill Grand Master Meio. That's about as deep as it gets, but that doesn't have to be a bad thing. 

The gameplay is the big draw here though, with it being a tight, well built Metroidvania. I mentioned earlier that it's short, and it is. I am not great at Platformers or Metroidvanias, but even I was able to beat the game on Normal in under 4 hours. Now, I'd say that this is a GOOD thing. Because, everytime you gain a new ability or attack, you have a short while to experiment with it before getting the next one, without a massive amount of time spent just fighting for the sake of fighting instead of actually progressing. Movement is incredibly slick, with controls mostly working to perfection. It does have that issue where when you're holding down to try and pass through a floor, sometimes you'll slide instead of go down, but that's about the worst that comes out of the control scheme. 

The map, while a bit big, never feels like you don't know where you're going. Secrets can still be explored for, but the game also gives you a directional arrow on your map menu in case you want to move on. You will want to explore too, as being able to spam your cool abilities and being able to tank a lot of hits is locked behind getting Energy and Health upgrades, which are found while exploring.

Bosses are fun too. Never overly challenging, but none after the mid point are a cakewalk, and none are a cakewalk period if you're playing on Hard.

It's just a tight, short and fun Metroidvania that is certainly worth a few bucks. As of writing this it's on sale for $4.5 USD, and that is a bargain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061604773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1685391297}
review:
Infelizmente o jogo foi feito de maneira porca, os cenários são genéricos, os inimigos tem pouca variedade e são repetitivos. Há reciclagem em quase todos os chefes, você irá enfrentar a maioria pelo menos umas 2 vezes.
 Os gráficos são horríveis, principalmente a modelagem de alguns bosses, parecem bonecos do Free Fire, sem contar que mesmo com os gráficos no máximo as texturas ficam pixelizadas em alguns deles.
 O game design é tosco, há algumas salas que estão cheia de inimigos só pra fazer você levar dano e ter que matar os inimigos pra conseguir passar. Além de que os inimigos ao morrerem só dão um pouco de vida e energia, a gameplay se resume em pular o máximo de inimigos possíveis e chegar no objetivo.
 Algumas análises falam que o jogo crasha em pc's modernos, felizmente não tive nenhum problema.
 Esse jogo consegue ser inferior e mais feio do que o Strider 2 de ps1. Pra quem quer matar a nostalgia, recomendo baixar o emulador e jogar o clássico.

review:
Cool Kakashi looking guy chops and annihilates hordes of enemies in a urgent rush. But the game has an unimaginative Story yet its backed by an enjoyable combat and character movement experience. I only know this guy from Arcade games as a kid. I was hoping for it to be amazing, but it sadly isn't.

The biggest issue with the game is the lackadaisical story. There is no proper introduction to the world or the character Strider Hiryu, nor anything about the motivation of the character. The ending is even more underwhelming.

The collectables and the power upgrades feel very awkwardly placed. Distracting from the hurried experience of slicing through hordes of enemies. I hated how poor the travelling between maps/levels were set in place.  It was very tiring to go through the same route again and again just to see if you have missed a collectable or an upgrade for your weapon.
The combat is brilliant, i loved how varied yet simple the attacking options were. The character movements are also great, as everything feels fast paced and rushed. 

They could have made this soo much better, had the team had a credible script. The voice acting felt so generic, the main rarely spoke and when he did he sounded like a lost goof. Strider had potential to be a great game but was limited by too many of these short comings.
 
If you want to experience a different style of gameplay and enjoy rushed combat. You will enjoy this game. But if you like a well rounded experience with a good story/ motivation. You should give this game a pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015278183', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1626152063}
review:
Strider's glow up is simply amazing, and the fact this game isn't praised nearly as much as it should is tragic. Strider is mostly know from Marvel Vs. Capcom 2 despite having 2 other games he starred in. Strider 2014 though easily sets up such a memorable version of himself that honestly whenever I think about the character, the fast paced, metroidvania version is all I think about.

The game is all about hitting hard and fast, like a ninja, and using the environment and enemies projectiles against them. A large portion of this games is simply rushing through enemy mobs as you reflect all the bullets they throw at you while performing cool tricks and triangle jump your way to the next location. With the way Strider 2014 uses movement also helps cement it as one of the cooler games to see when performed at higher play as there's just a cool amount of slips and slices that you can do while mowing down enemies. Bosses are even given great care to just how fun and challenging they can be, and while they can be brief, they are high action, and always a fun change of pace.
Aesthetically, Strider 2014 is a direct contrast of what you'd normally think of a ninja fighting an evil organization would look like. Everything about this game is super high tech, and all the environments and music help reinforce just how foreign Strider is to it, and how well he adapts to it throughout the game, often using various upgrades he finds throughout, both powering him up and helping him move even faster.

Mostly Strider 2014 is a hidden gem that Capcom doesn't advertise nearly as much as it should, and if you are interested in some high octane Metroidvania fun, Strider is easily a great pick.

review:
"Esse jogo consegue manter a essência do clássico dos fliperamas com uma nova roupagem interessante. A jogabilidade é veloz e um pouco caótica, o que condiz com o personagem, um ninja, e homenageia os arcades onde a rapidez era essencial para avançar nos jogos. O jogo mantém o estilo sidescrolling dos originais, mas adiciona elementos de bullet hell e hack and slash, além de um grande mapa com idas e vindas que requerem habilidades adquiridas no percurso, resultando em um estilo "metrodivania" cru, simples, direto e preciso.

A jogabilidade é divertida e a duração do jogo é suficiente para não se tornar massante. O jogo é competente em tudo o que se propôs a fazer (não é brilhante, mas é competente). Dessa forma, eu classificaria o jogo com nota 7,5/10."

author: {'steamid': '76561198286632720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1706749452}
review:
最初に、このゲームの購入を検討されている方に。
このゲームは本レビューを書いている時点(2023年5月末)ではCPUのスレッド数合計が16を上回るマシンではそもそもアプリが起動しません。CPUコアで16、あるいはHyperThreading有効でCPU8コア、16スレッド構成まででないと駄目なのです。
このため、例えばRyzen Threadripper PROシリーズやXeonシリーズなどの多コアCPUを積んだマシンではUEFIなどで動作コア数/スレッド数を最大16までに制限する必要があります。
恐らくは開発環境に起因する問題であると推定しますが、昨今急速に搭載コア数を増やしつつあるPC市場を考慮するに、CAPCOMさんには早急な問題解決をお願いしたいと想います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198149062649', 'num_games_owned': 885, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1680092609}
review:
優點:
快節奏戰鬥

缺點:
不類銀河戰士惡魔城，他的關卡設計的太像線性關卡了，變成只是回去找加成而已

動畫中被打，有時候畫面轉去怪物的地方，然後我在原地被打根本看不到
不然就是敵人站在開關的位置，我要打他一定會打到開關就進動畫，不知道甚麼時候動畫才會結束導致出來就被尻

第四個武器屬性是個謎，我覺得就是來噁心玩家必須掏出來打那個盾兵
太黏牆壁，我是要打側邊的人，我不是要跳上牆壁；我是要打上面的人，我不是要在那邊練垂吊
不能順暢地移動真的超級痛苦，尤其你是主打快節奏的時候

畫面切換是個謎，常常打怪就在轉換畫面的位置，一直切來切去都快吐了
重力球會改變你input要案的方向，而且他是360度圓形的時候超級痛苦，根本弄不懂到底甚麼時候會改變成要我按哪邊
然後你猜怎麼著，last boss就是來噁心你把這兩坨屎放在一起真的是謝囉
打到後面越來越躁

author: {'steamid': '76561198255751236', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1292, 'last_played': 1690774054}
review:
Strider is great, a 7/10. Here's the good news first.

The Good News:

1. The Game is Good at Making You Feel like a Real Super Ninja
Combat is fast paced and feels almost completely within your control. Movement feels fluid and fun. The spammable basic slash attack very much makes you feel like an unstoppable super ninja right from the beginning of the game. Charge Strike also feels very satisfying to use. Charge Mode, your super ability, is pretty much just ultra-instinct which automatically makes it one of the best things in this game. You earn it through landing enough attacks while not getting hit too much. It sets the tone by letting you know true ninja skill is what will enable you victory in this game.

2. Game Progression is Balanced
The upgrades you attain throughout the game are set at reasonable distances from each other and never feel too difficult or out of the way to obtain. You'll find bosses and fun enemy encounters consistently placed in creative manners in all areas of the game.

3. Lots of Epic Moments
From activating your ultra instinct ability in critical clutch times, to taking down giant monsters and robots, to entire military bases and airships, the authenticity of these events don't fail to entertain.

4. The Game is (Mostly) Not Unfair
All aspects of combat are able to be mastered, meaning your fate is largely controlled by your skill level.


The Bad News:


1. Enemy Variety Gets Boring To Look At Fairly Quickly
You won't really be astonished visually by any of the enemies you encounter. There are basic foot soldiers, soldiers with shields, flying robots, big robots, and c r a b s (they don't look like crabs).

2. Character Models Don't Look Good
There are some moments in the campaign which let you see that characters are lacking sorely needed polished textures. Faces are disappointingly static and plain to look at.

3. Hiryu Can Take A Poopton Of Damage In A Very Short Amount Of Time
He has no invincibility frames at any point. Add this to the fact that Hiryu can be hitstunned means that he can take a massive amount damage in less than a second and there isn't a real way to stop this other than to move and deflect attacks fast enough. Hiryu also can get hitstunned while struck in mid-air, and will begin falling once he's hit. Any attack will also make him lose his grip while climbing. All these factors combined lead to many moments in the game that feel outright cheap and undeserved. These moments can be mitigated after getting Option A, however, which provides a momentary shield against projectiles.

4. Bosses are Either Too Weak or Too Cheap.
Most bosses can be defeated simply by spamming the melee attack and moving around, and it's not very hard to learn their attack patterns. Boss fights only get easier later once you realize you can combo the eagle and panther upgrades into your flurry of regular slash attacks. Bosses can be stunned if you inflict enough damage on them. You often won't know a boss had a certain attack until you stop wailing on them. The final boss is disappointingly easy to fight against, especially in his biblically accurate angel final form.

5. Hiryu's First Jump Has a Strange Quirk
When doing a single jump starting from forward moving momentum, he will jump forward normally, and you wouldn't suspect anything would be off about this jump until you try to turn backwards while in mid-air.  When switching to backwards movement in Hiryu's first jump, he will turn backwards instantly and retain the same speed as he was moving forward. This sounds minute in description, but it can throw off your rhythm in combat as he'll move in a direction at a speed you did not expect. It's not intuitive and can be hard to get used to. It's further strange that his first jump has this property considering neither his second jump nor his Plasma Catapult jump have this quirk.

6. Hiryu's Climbing also has Some Odd Quirks. 
To start climbing on a surface, you have to press the directional key matching the direction you have to grab it from (press up to grab ceiling, press left to grab left wall), and this remains true even when you don't want it to be. For example, if you are running in a straight direction to the left and reach a dropoff point and there's a wall down the dropoff point, Hiryu might not drop and start falling like you want him to but instead will grab that wall if you don't stop pressing the direction key that matches the surface's parallelism. Hiryu can also freeze enemies, which effectively turns them into blocks you can use for climbing. Moving into a mid-air frozen enemy to attack them often leads to accidentally gripping onto them. This can happen a fair amount in late game, where there are many enemies in enclosed spaces.

7. Story is Bad
It's a cliche hero-comes-in-to-save-the-world-from-big-evil-Hitler-guy-and-hero-wins kind of story. The weak narrative could've been mitigated by having the characters or character interactions be interesting, but not even these are here. The unlockable lore bits aren't very compelling to read either.

8. Voice Acting is Bad and Feels Forced
The dialogue for the English script is outright cringe once you hear the voice actors speak their lines. Hiryu has a bad Japanese accent, the Pooh sisters (yes, Pooh) sound terribly forced in their evil monologues, the insane scientist NPC goes laughably overboard in his "hehe I'm cwazy" speeches, General Mikiel and another side character have bad lazy Russian accents, the evil scientist Schlange (yes, Schlange) is the worst sounding of them all, and the final villain Grandmaster Meio is just... plain. You can tell these actors showed up for a paycheck and nothing else.

9. Exploration and Unlockables are Underwhelming.
The development team didn't really try much when it came to what is often the best part about games: exploration and being rewarded for said exploration. It can be fun to get new upgrades, but the same animation is used everytime you get one and it gets old. Upgrades and extras are placed in rather easily spotted and reachable areas. For extras, they simply recycled the concept art and character models that were created for the game, attached some lazily written lore to them and called it good enough. There are the Beacon Run and Survival challenge mode maps that can be unlocked too, but those don't provide much incentive in of by themselves to play.

10. Achievements are Odd
There is no achievement for finding all hidden unlockables, but there is one for finding all large health canisters. No achievements exist for meeting any conditions in the Beacon Run and Survival mode challenges. The achievement for beating General Mikiel tends to not unlock after defeating him the first time on Hard mode. On Xbox, the game can also bug out if you don't force quit it after sitting idle for a few hours, otherwise it'll somehow think you're not connected to Xbox Live, and therefore won't record any new achievements you should've gotten. Uncertain if this bug can happen beyond Xbox.



Bonus Fun Facts:

- The giant millipede bosses are actually several crab creatures combined together by attaching their mouths to each others' anuses. They did this willingly.

- The Brainwalker units are called so because they are controlled by actual brains. Civilian brains. Human brains. 

- The coolest sounds in the game (I personally believe) come from the mechanized dragon boss roars and the shield soldiers' voice line, "GO NO FURTHER!".

author: {'steamid': '76561198072445406', 'num_games_owned': 2184, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1679910440}
review:
Strider is one of the few games out there to make you actually feel like a ninja. If you are looking for a short 2d metroidvania this one is great.

Pros:

* You can reach anywhere thanks to vast moving capabilities available in your arsenal
* Snappy & responsive combat
* Great 2.5D visuals that still holds up well today
* Rewarding exploration

Cons: 

* Next to no customization
* Voice acting is so bad that it is good? (Can be a positive too)
* Huge jump in the difficulty at the end of the game

This is a reboot done right, unlike most stuff Capcom brings out these days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051978405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1679237984}
review:
At first I wanted to give this game a recommendation on the basis that it’s not broken. You can play it without hating it. But I ended up hating it. I’m not sure if games like these are supposed to have a good story but this one definitely doesn’t. It started off pretty standard but turned into nonsense and I started caring even less.

Combat was pretty cool at first but then I realized it was just mashing the attack button as fast as I could. Occasionally holding the attack button to hit enemies with shields. Over time it became mundane and boring. After the first mini boss the game decided that making a mini boss an normal enemy was okay. So I promptly restarted the game on easy difficulty. Thank god there is an easy mode.

I noticed that some checkpoints are not saved when you exit the game. Which is annoying. Jumping movement is a bit floaty and the character sometimes clings to a wall or a ledge when I just want to jump off of it. There are enemies that are annoying rather than difficult. 
Enemies respawn even if you didn’t leave the area.

Also I absolutely hated it when an enemy knocked me off of the top of a building and I had to climb back up. Or when I am trying to explore and go down the wall and accidentally touch a wire that shocks me and sends me tumbling down. One of my most hated things is that during a boss fight when they talk there will be a text block at the bottom that doesn’t let you see your character or the boss.

Visually it’s okay and the music sometimes is okay too. But definitely nothing special.
If you ask me why I played through the entirety of it is because I didn’t want to lower my average completion percentage.

It’s definitely a functioning game but ultimately it comes down to the question that Steam asked me: do you recommend this game. And the answer is NO.
Maybe if you’re a fan of the franchise.

review:
Edit 2/3/2024:  Looks like they actually fixed the CPU core problem!  The downside is it looks like they also added a shady DRM called Enigma as well.  Would avoid buying this game until it is removed.

Original review:

The game will not boot at all if your computer has more than eight cores.  You'll have to follow a guide to make it work, and even then, it's not foolproof as that person said they still got crashes here and there.  This is an instant negative review until it gets patched; if the game can't even start without user modding, there is a serious issue.

That being said, on with a review of sorts, I will update if the game changes my mind.

I've liked the gameplay so far, and the graphics are good if simple.  The story is nonexistent for the most part, but it's a fast and fun Metroidvania.  I would say to get this game at a heavy discount if you want to try it; there are issues now with the game not working, and it's only going to get worse over time.  

Make sure you're okay with doing slight modifications to your computer if you want to play this game.

Tldr; the game is good (early on anyways), butt cheeks PC port.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990036156', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 501, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1679782367}
review: I have mixed feelings about this game. On one hand the pacing is excellent and fun, but on the other hand the difficulty curve is completely random with the entire first half being too easy, then a few spikes of really hard difficulty interspaced by easy difficulty, then the game gets a normal difficulty for a while and then at the very end it becomes way too difficult. The world is indeed open but it is very poorly designed for backtracking purposes and compensates for this by telling the player where to do and giving the player a very linear progression. Then there is the issue of the game being incompatible with CPUs with more than 12 cores.

author: {'steamid': '76561199106949989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1489, 'last_played': 1690412480}
review:
>>The Good<< 

-Decent Metroidvania-esqe level design with some fun gimmicks

-Very tight controls. You won't be slipping off things and you stop on a dime

-Excellent mobility. Fast movement speed, wall/ceiling clinging and climbing and later upgrades such as double jumping and multi directional dashing 

-Very fast 8 directional attacks

-Strong powers and upgrades with different properties for progress or combating enemies. Shout outs to the ability to deflect shots back at enemies with timing. Super satisfying

-Bosses are quite enjoyable and decently varied

-Good music, some nice remixes from older Strider games

-Strider Hiryu is cool as shit 


>>The Bad<< 

-Story is paper thin basic. You are super cool ninja man on a mission to assassinate super big evil Emperor Mayo. That is pretty much it. Less of an issue if you go into this with a "Who cares I'm just here to slash and style on people" mentality but still worth mentioning 

-Awkward cutscenes zooming in close to poorly textures models with zero facial animations despite them talking 

-No fast travel to any zone. There are fast travel points that lead to very specific points within a zone or to another specific zone but for the most part you will be traveling long distances if you are backtracking for missed upgrades due to not having an upgrade to access it early on and especially if you plan to get 100% completion. Massive slog and time waster 

-Some powers are a little too strong making some bosses go by like nothing 

-The game despite feeling great to slash through countless enemies very fast it is a little braindead and you will be mashing the attack button very very often

-Two of the four Cypher upgrades are meh and you'll most likely only ever use them when you absolutely have to to progress or to break an enemy's shield that requires it to break it

-The game has a very bad habit of crashing for many players (myself included) way too often, becoming borderline impossible to complete the game. I am not sure exactly how or why this happens but there is a Steam thread post by user "X6205" with a possible fix that worked for me. 
Link here: https://steamcommunity.com/app/235210/discussions/0/2575445991822522940/#c2974023280301011959 


>>Conclusion<< 

Overall Strider 2014 is a very solid B-tier small game for those who want to feel like an overpowered ninja on speed while moving and looking stupid cool. Its a game that very much values "Rule of Cool" over anything else, mostly being carried by it but still remaining mechanically very solid. Worth a shot if that's what your looking for and especially if you've played and enjoyed Strider 2 back in the day. Takes a lot from that game and the original arcade game from 1989.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115315914', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1678753497}
review:
Positives

The world is big but not overwhelmingly so, it also rewards exploring by hiding upgrades, collectables and different costumes off the beaten path for you to find.

The gameplay is just fun, Hiryu moves at a rather fast pace and just slicing through the enemies and moving through the world is satisfying and and very fun.

The bosses offer a great challenge without being unfair, I needed a few tries at the later bosses of the game but never felt like I got unfairly killed (I played on hard mode)

Three different difficulties, making the game accessible for beginners and challenging for veterans.


Negatives

I found the music unmemorable.

Hiryu controls very floaty, making precision platforming a problem... Though luckily the game rarely requires that kind of platforming but I found this still noticeable.

Barely any variety in enemies.

On occasion the game has segments that feature anti-gravity, causing Hiryu to be required to walk on walls and the ceiling... Luckily this is not something that happens often, but the controls during these parts are very awkward and for me at least were the only part of the game that genuinely frustrated me.


Quick summery

The game took me about 5 hours to beat on hard mode, this is without going for 100% completion though so for people that wanted to they certainly could get a few more hours of playtime out of this this.

It generally is simply a fun metroidvania but not exactly an outstanding one, I will give it a 7/10 and definitely recommend it for fans of the genre.

review:
Se você, assim como eu, cresceu jogando os jogos do Strider na sua infância, então você definitivamente precisa experimentar o mais recente jogo do ninja Strider! O jogo é incrível e traz de volta todas as lembranças da minha infância.

A jogabilidade é rápida, intensa e desafiadora, e a trilha sonora é simplesmente incrível! Os gráficos são impressionantes e dão vida a esse mundo futurista e cheio de ação. O jogo oferece uma grande variedade de inimigos, chefes e armas, o que o torna extremamente divertido e emocionante de jogar.

Outra coisa que eu adorei neste jogo é a quantidade de conteúdo que ele oferece. Além da campanha principal, há uma série de missões secundárias que você pode realizar para ganhar pontos e desbloquear novas armas e habilidades.

No geral, eu recomendo fortemente o jogo Strider para qualquer fã de jogos de ação e aventura. Ele é divertido, desafiador e traz de volta as boas lembranças de jogar os jogos do Strider na minha infância. Não perca a oportunidade de experimentá-lo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120129580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1678180087}
review:
7時間ほどで1周クリア、アイテム取得率は7割程度

1作めストライダー飛竜は私がまだ生まれる前だったほど古いゲームなため、現代ではほとんど知名度がない今作シリーズですが・・・
20年以上経って発売された本作はスタイリッシュ系メトロイドヴァニアとしてなかなかに出来が良かったです。

・何と言っても戦闘が非常にスピーディで操作性が良い！
雑魚に接触ダメージもなくスライディングしながらも通常攻撃をブンブン出来るため、かなりスタイリッシュ＋スピーディに敵を狩って気持ちよく走れます（ただしラストステージは除く・・・）


・ミニマップによる次の目的地への誘導がわかりやすく、メトロイドヴァニアにありがちな
「次にどこに行ったらいいか分からず総当り」が起きないようになっているのも好印象。
・グラフィックも流石にカプコンらしく良い出来、ステージ構成や背景美術もかなり凝っていて 敵地に潜入している気分を味わえました。

強いて言えば最終マップに行くともう戻れなくなるのと、マップワープが一切無いため移動能力を一通り揃えたあとのアイテム探索が少々面倒な点、音声が英語のみ（日本語は字幕）で ナムカプの時のような鳥海さんのイケボが聞けないのが残念でした。

スチーム版もかなりマイナなようですが、2Dアクションやメトロイドヴァニアが好きな方にはぜひプレイして貰いたい一作です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198040669098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1688459166}
review:
Great game, good graphics, good sound.  So why do I fail to recommend it?

Because the company programmed it stupidly, and if you have more than 8 cores on your CPU, it will not even open.  I have older games made by small studios that work perfectly on my new Intel Core i9 13900K system and former AMD Ryzen 9 5900x, but not this game!  It just fails to open or do anything.  So I paid money for a game that fails to work, when all my other older games boot right up!

Yes, you can use Ryzen Master or Intel XTU to limit cores and it will work, but why should I have to do work or come up with workarounds to make a game function?   

The developer (Double Helix Games) takes your money, but obviously does not care about the product after you buy it and I am sure it would be an easy fix for them (all you have to do is limit your CPU to 8 cores and less and it will boot right up!)  

I will never purchase another product from them ever again, they are lazy developers and I should not have to "do my own work" to play a game and you should not, either!

author: {'steamid': '76561198203657675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1707164509}
review:
Cuando era un niño llegue a probar el Strider de la PS1, así que cuando vi este en Steam no pude resistirme, estamos ante un Arcade Plataformero donde jugamos con un Ninja futurista en toda regla, donde iremos dando saltos, corriendo, matando enemigos, descubriendo rutas secretas, mejorando habilidades y pasándonos fases donde encontraremos también jefes interesantes. 

No es un mal juego y tiene buen ritmo siempre y cuando lo juegues poco a poco y lo compagines con otros juegos, ya que si lo juegas del tirón se puede hacer repetitivo 

En definitiva, si lo ves en oferta compra lo y échate unas partiditas que para entretenerse da de sobra

author: {'steamid': '76561198063209122', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1696078207}
review:
Něco STRIDER jsem určitě hrál v Maringotkách za 2Kčs .

Prostě cyberpunková něcovánie - přiměřeně šílená přiměřeně těžká na základní obtížnost ( souboje s bosy většinou napoprvé ) častěji umřete na elektřinu vlak ap. 

vizuální a umělecké provedení 9/10 
hratelnost a boj 7/10 (boj je takový průměr ale nemám dohráno nenadchne neurazí  platforming a schopnosti 
mě opravdu baví ale animace by mohli být rozměnitější . )
Příběh - Je tam a určitě exitují lidé kteří odehráli 23 dílů na 7 konzolích a přesně ví o co jde mě je to jedno ;)

Steam deck  jediná výtka ( občas je to fatk malé ) ale jsem zase staršího data výroby .

author: {'steamid': '76561198027195003', 'num_games_owned': 5755, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1675306333}
review:
Back in the day, when I'd hit up the arcades, I always made a beeline straight to the Strider cabinet! There was just something about the cyberpunk/ninja setting, large character spites, bangin music and sound effects, audacious set pieces, and all around gravity-defying-wall-crawling-shing-shing-shing-uber-sword-slashing-badassness that delighted my adolescent brain! 

And thankfully this modern reimagining retains much of the spirit of those arcade action fever dreams. Silky smooth controls, tight combat, over-the-top bosses - all layered with a delicious foundation of Metroidvania special sauce - a peanut butter and chocolate combination if there ever was one!

My inner child just chugged a Jolt cola and is doing back flips off the walls!

review:
I think I'm on the 5th or 6th boss. It's just invulnerability phases and undodgable attacks. I'm sure I could try to memorise it's phases but I hate this kind of game design.

The first few bosses, and the gameplay in general has been pretty decent, but now the game is essentially cheating by changing the rules and becoming something else, all in the name of providing 'challenge'. It was a fun 3 hours. Not fun anymore, time to move on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166885149', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1676813748}
review:
虽然用类银河城串联起来，但地图区域间互联性不好，都是很长的线性关卡，绕半天才能到出入口，更接近街机出击飞龙关卡式设计的感觉。

推荐等打折入。高速移动、快速斩击、蓄力拔刀杀敌、反弹敌人子弹都很有感觉。建筑物边沿可以360度攀爬。小兵比较单一就是堆，十几场BOSS战还不错。

全技能全升级道具容易地图上会有提示，但服装和设定资料两种类型的物品在地图上无提示，最后百分之几的完成度比较难找到。

不支持XP和WIN7 32位系统。个人当年是因为本作进步到WIN7 64位的。

游戏本身不错，差评是因为以下残疾设定，提醒一下大家避坑。没官中这一条其实都可以忍。

1.无官中。2.键盘键位不能设置（可通过编辑文件更改，看最后），没手柄只能交叉指法。3.有且只有一个存档位不能切换，无新周目继承，开新游戏强制覆盖旧存档。4.最终区域有几个收集物进入就不能返回，通关后不能回到BOSS战前状态继续探索收集。然而不通关最终BOSS资料不解锁。

建议手动备份进入最终区域前的存档，并且不要点NEWGAME。要么放弃收集，要么挑战什么难度一开始就想好。

另外有十个关卡弱化敌人配置的纯跑酷时间竞速模式，五个关卡连续战斗的生存模式，都可以在线排名。偏偏没有BOSS RUSH模式。


改键办法，游戏目录下binds_pc。cfg，记事本打开编辑：
比如addbind 0 COMMAND_FORWARD 这行的KEY_UP改成KEY_W，下面的以此类推。注意先备份。

author: {'steamid': '76561198102043360', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1624300649}
review:
Strider es adictivo, siempre y cuando el juego no crashee, claro. No obstante, apetece jugarlo constantemente debido a la satisfacción de derrotar a tantos enemigos y de ir trepando y saltando por los tejados, pero no tiene nada más.

La narrativa del juego es prácticamente nula y, la poca que te cuenta, es ilegible ya que estás pendiente de enfrentar a la infinidad de enemigos que tienes delante. 

La curva de dificultad no existe, el juego es prácticamente igual, e incluso en algunos puntos repetitivo y exasperante, hasta que llegas al final del juego, cuya dificultad crece hasta niveles insospechados sin previo aviso ni nada. 

Un buen remake que te hace querer seguir jugando por lo divertido que es el gameplay, pero no aporta nada más.

Nota: 06/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020067542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1673081153}
review:
Grande gioco. In pratica, è un metroidvania 3d in stile tecno-giappo. Mappa gigante, un sacco di poteri nuovi che migliorano forza e movimenti, livelli vari. I nemici sono purtroppo sempre quei 3, ma tanto sono carne da macello fra un boss e l'altro, molto più interessanti. La storia è il solito "distruggi il cattivo", ma pazienza - meglio quello che qualche stupidaggine forzata moderna.
Davvero un bel gioco.

review:
Controlli responsivi, bel design, frenetico, ma non me la sento di consigliarlo dopo aver giocato a Metroidvania migliori usciti nello stesso periodo, ad es. Ori and The Blind Forest e Guacamelee.
La difficoltà è molto bassa in generale, ma ci sono dei picchi dovuti a stunlocking, e sono un po’ frustranti. Non mi fa impazzire il feedback dei colpi, non si ha l’impressione di fare danni ai nemici e alcuni di essi sono delle spugne. 
Verso la fine inizia a farsi interessante proponendo nemici da indebolire con specifici poteri, ma dura molto poco.
La trama non la commento nemmeno perché è molto risicata. 
Sicuramente è un ottimo remake / reboot dell’originale ma non avendoli mai giocati mi manca l’appiglio nostalgico.

author: {'steamid': '76561198978469993', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1660648450}
review:
游戏挺好，值得一块钱购买(py)，原价就算了。
  作为一款老平台游戏：它的操作手感在我玩过的游戏中可以排T1。
  地图很多，很大，甚至会迷路。小怪也很多，后期小怪元素变更，玩家也需要变更武器元素以达到有效攻击，但模型也都一样，就换了个色。也有跑酷因素在内，难度可以自己选择，简单的确实简单，难的确实难，很适合用手柄玩。另外网上可以搜到汉化补丁。
  总之就是一路杀杀杀，杀到最终boss前最好就是去收集血量加成和装备加成，收集完之后再来打，这样比较轻松而且也有成就可以拿。

review:
Artıları: 
Birkaç güç türü eklemişler misal alev,buz,cypher,düz saldırımız var bir de hepsinin farklı özellikleri var kunai ile komboları falan değişiyor her birinin çağrılarak yaptığı özel saldırı yaratığı farklı.
Bosslar zevkliydi kolay zaten çoğu.
Son boss asura's wrath tarzında güzeldi.
Metroidvania kısımları güzeldi,platform kısımları eğlenceliydi.
Boss tasarımları gayet güzeldi.
Oynanış süresi kısa böylece sıkma durumu oluşmuyor


Eksileri: 
Kontrol şeması değiştirilmiyor dosyalarda değişiklik yapmazsanız,oyunun çözünürlüğü değişmiyor tam ekran olsa da,grafiklerde oynama yapamıyorsun öyle bir ayar yok.
Müzikler o kadar akılda kalıcı değildi benim için( Kazakh theme dışında).
Son bölgenin hız,düşman ve counterlama oranı aşırı saçmaydı diğer bölgelere göre.Bir tık ter attırdı el göz koordinasyonumu fazlasıyla her şeyi her milisaniyesine kadar dodgelamaya zorlayarak.
Son olarak aklıma gelmişken,oyunlarda aynı bossu bir daha karşılaşma olsun diye diğer bossla beraber koyanların aklına tüküreyim.Atıyorum ilk bossu kestin 2. bossa geldin karşına 2.boss + seni bu sefer yeneceğim diyen 1. boss geliyor. İkisini de yenince bir süre sonra başka bossta yine karşına çıkıyorlar 3 vs 1 atıyorsun kazanırsan bir daha yok neyse ki.

Sonuç olarak benim için 7.5-8/10 bir oyun oldu Strider

review: God, I love this!   As a long time fan of Strider, this made me more happy than I can properly convey.. It made me really damn happy to see Strider Hiryu back in action - he deserved this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198810256976', 'num_games_owned': 804, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1453, 'last_played': 1669978206}
review:
[h1]香臭分明的冷饭[/h1]
第一次玩，我只坚持了10分钟就因为受不了割草的玩法而退出，中间坚持了下来游玩体验还不错，正当我准备回心转意给好评的时候，最后一章又给了我一巴掌。
游戏的流程不长，10h不到即为一周目，但地图深度很高，游戏的音乐还算不错，至少不难听。
[h1]类银河战士恶魔城的地图[/h1]
当我坚持玩下去的时候，我发现该作并不是没有可取之处，游戏的地图极其复杂多样，并且是互通的，看眼日期2014的游戏，fc版本的就更早了，游戏的地图设计我可以给他满分，堪称完美的多线互通恶魔城地图，地图的深度很高探索性丰富。
[h1]割草一般的打击感[/h1]
该作最想吐槽的便是奇葩的打击感，完全没有反馈的攻击，全程按住攻击键的移动过关，这是开局就把我劝退的地方，不敢想像一个恶魔城做成了个割草游戏，而且关于游戏战斗还有一个很特别的地方，就是角色受伤没有无敌，而游戏就是这样设计的，游戏的所有单一的攻击包括陷阱打主角其实都一点不痛，完全不伤血，但有的地方是一连串的攻击，主角的血量就会瞬间下降，而且你只要中了一下，就别想脱身了。
[h1]压死我最后一根稻草的最后一章[/h1]
在我看完他精美的地图设计，我已经准备给与好评了，但是最后一章塔让我改变了想法，游戏到了最后一章，难度飙升，同样是堆怪，前面堆得是拿枪的杂兵，最后一章是第一个boss，无限的子弹把人活活压制到死；如果说最讨厌的属性，那一定是敌人的冰冻，最后一章两个大冰冻机器人，一冻可就是一条命了，玩的实在是脑淤血到极致；最后是bug，游戏的最后一章中没有任何一个存档点，但角色死亡会在中间的记录点复活，但是在升降梯的关卡我遇到了bug，有一个怪物刷不出来没有击杀导致后面的怪物也不刷新，这就让你永远卡在那里，只能手动重来这一整章；第二个是最后boss战，进去直接黑屏，又是读档，又要回去打前面的脑淤血关卡，就因为这个，我不得不修改我的评价

[h1]总结[/h1]
总之，游戏的可玩性是在的，地图设计非常出色，但劝退的打击感和最后一章的恶心程度让我给了差评，游戏对待成就也比较友好，两个周目即可搞定，如果你打算感受一下精美的地图设计，并且可以承受压力，那不妨来试一下，但是如果你想来游戏里放松一下身心，为了不被脑淤血到和保护自己一直按攻击键的手，还是远离游戏比较好

review:
Windows11にて動作確認
まだ前半のステージ程度だが、ある程度は遊べる内容でゲーム自体は思っていたより面白い。
だが、他のユーザーのコメントにもある通り、兎に角クラッシュが頻発する始末。
デバッグをちゃんとやっていればこんなミスは出ない筈。

なお動作環境は以下の通り
Windows 11 Pro　６４bit
CPU Ryzen 7 5800 X
ビデオ：Radeon RX 6700 XT 
メモリ　DDR 4-1600 ８０GB

通常の戦闘や探索時ではほぼ落ちないが、特殊なボス戦闘で高確率でクラッシュすることを確認。
現状このゲームは、おすすめできない駄作。
上記のスペックからも確認できる通り、スペック自体の問題ではなくゲーム全般の問題の様子。
８年前のゲームな上、未だにこういったバグが残っている時点で、このタイトルの未来は明るくなること
は無さそう。（返品要請済み）

これから購入するユーザーは、クラッシュするトラブルと仲良く付き合える精神力の強いユーザーだけ
購入することをおすすめします。（面白い内容なだけに本当残念である）

author: {'steamid': '76561198102512276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1670779735}
review:
Un tuffo nel passato.

Questa piccola perla di gioco è stata una vera sorpresa: mi aspettavo semplicemente che lo stile fosse stato in qualche modo mutuato dal passato, ed invece le meccaniche sono state evolute e ben integrate. Mi spiego meglio: questo gioco non tradisce affatto lo Strider originale, e non è nemmeno un semplice tributo: lo potrei definire una specie di remastered, perché è come sarebbe potuto essere il gioco del passato se i suoi sviluppatori avessero avuto la tecnologia attuale. Le atmosfere ci sono tutte (un futuro distopico con pesanti influenze sovietiche) e le abilità nuove e vecchie di Strider Hiryu ben si integrano, ed anzi sono necessarie per esplorare l'ambiente in puro stile metroid-vania. E' infatti in questa nuova variante che il gioco viene riproposto, una formula secondo me azzeccata, con vari potenziamenti e power-up da ricercare, e ambienti da esplorare nuovamente via via che si acquisiscono nuove abilità. Da provare.
