author: {'steamid': '76561198021442265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1620258471}
review:
I'll recommend this on the basis of these two points:

[b]1. It's a budget title.[/b] There are a ton of nit-picky problems with the game. But you're only paying $5-15, depending on sale pricing. Bear that in mind when you see a lot of my comments about the bad stuff.

[b]2. It's a Strider title.[/b] You're in for a lot of flashy combat and acrobatics, but a MST3K-worthy plot. Based upon experience with the Arcade and NES versions in my youth, Strider lore largely amounts to "climb a wall, jump into an airborne cartwheel, land in a slide, and then cut a mechanical communist in half."

That is, it's generally a fun game, especially if Strider is nostalgic for you...but parts will definitely make your eye twitch.

[h1]The Good[/h1]
+Fast, flashy, acrobatic combat and movement, true to the original Strider arcade.
+Numerous throwbacks and mechanics to other Strider games.
+Relatively faithful to metroidvania mechanics.

[h1]YMMV[/h1]
~Early game is a little hard until you get some powerups.
~Easy to get stuck to walls when you don't want to.
~Powerups are all shown on map; only hidden items are unlockable art etc.
~Dialog and VA is pretty cheesy.
~Powerups vary from useless to overpowered.
~Endgame enemies are similar to many other sidescrollers: too much health, incredibly annoying attacks and no reward for defeating them. This leads you to just running past as much combat as possible.

[h1]The Bad[/h1]
-Camera is frequently uncooperative in terms of location and zoom.
-Enemies shoot you from offscreen.
-Enemy respawn in some areas is way too fast.
-Enemy dialog obscures a good chunk of the screen while playing.
-Hurtbox size on some environmental hazards is ridiculous.
-Backtracking is a time-consuming and frustrating experience.
-Map screen isn't user-friendly and has a scrolling bug.
-Headphone users beware of an occasional volume bug when changing areas.
-No health refill before final boss.
-Damaging effects in boss fights often blend in with background.
-Boss damage output can spike drastically.

author: {'steamid': '76561199040745593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1619002052}
review:
まだほんの触りしかやってないけど、なんとも微妙。
淡々としている。
中ボス前のカットイン、ステージボス前のムービー、自キャラ強化時のムービー、等々、
無難な演出は入っているけど、音響にインパクトがなく物足りない。
他のレビューでもあるように、今風の見た目で昔のゲームをやっているというのがピッタリ。
あと、言うほどメトロイドヴァニアではない気がする。
収集アイテムもコンセプトアートという名の貧相な画像と、説明になってない世界観の補足説明が得られるだけで、こんなもので喜ぶのは制作陣の中でもその部分に関わった人間ぐらいだと思う。

追記
エラー落ちが頻発するクセにセーブポイントが決まっているせいで、無駄な労力が多い。
ゲーム内容云々より根本部分でややクソゲー。
中盤に差し掛かっていると思われるけど、エラー落ちが頻発するのでそのままアンインストールしてライブラリから消した。

セール500円程度でも他に良作はたくさんあるので、このゲームに時間を割くのは無駄。

author: {'steamid': '76561198122107502', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1708141150}
review:
Só quem viveu a era e evolução dos consoles : Atari, Nintendo, Master System, Mega Drive etc.... vai querer de fato jogar esse game totalmente refeito para essa geração e as passadas. Meu primeiro contato com Strider foi no Master System, acredito que tinha 13 anos (1991). É muita emoção poder jogar novamente esse clássico, porém nada supera a magia de quando somos criança, pois as fases e os inimigos naquela época eram muito mais hard. 

Quem puder baixa emulador de Master System e o ROM e jogue Strider original, vcs vão ver como esse jogo novo foi totalmente fiel ao jogo antigo. 

Todo mundo que tem Steam precisa ter esse clássico dos jogos em 2D em sua biblioteca. 

Gente acompanhei toda evolução dos consoles e jogos eletrônicos, época em que as mães falavas "esse vídeo game vai estragar a TV" rsrsrssrsr.... Jogando Atari na TV Sharp preto em branco.

review:
Nettes kleines Metroidvania. Positiv sind Bewegungs- und Kampf System sowie die Bosse. 
Dieser Aspekt hebt das Spiel auch von anderen Vertretern des Genres ab. Der Soundtrack sticht wenig heraus, ebenso sind die Karte und die Upgrades wenig interessant. Grafisch kein Hingucker, die Charaktermodelle sind teilweise echt schrecklich. Durch normales Spielen hatte ich am Ende 9 von 10 Health Upgrades, erforschen war nicht nötig und sowieso wenig spannend.
Absolut negativ ist der letzte Boss, vor allem der Weg dort hin durch eine Aufzug Autoscroller Sequenz, bei der man mit frustrierenden Gegnern, die einen ständig einfrieren und stunlocken, bombardiert wird.

review: Strider, with its techno-Russians & general Japanese enthusiasm, is as mad as a box of particularly eccentric frogs. Technically a metroidvania, though not particularly inventive in that regard (though being able to scale almost any wall & ceiling from the get-go is exceptionally freeing), the real fun is in the acrobatic & frenetic combat, which you'll spend approximately 99% of your time doing. It's not massively challenging aside from the last hour or so, but given you're supposed to play the role of an unstoppable, unflappable ninja infiltrator with truly *massive* calves, the fantasy fits. A wonderful, easily-recommended time.

review: I was not suspecting a metroidvania having previously played Strider on the Genesis.  I am generally surprised by the number of negative reviews and dislikes of the game, I think for that reason.  I feel many people did not play far enough to really unlock the content of the game, since in it's past it was a strict action platformer and is now a very different genre.  The game was fun and difficult at times, but overall fair.  There is a lot of hidden areas and content to collect.  I think replayability varies with metroidvanias, so you may only play it once, but it was overall a fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056902770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1466626224}
review:
[b]“Who's this guy again?”[/b]
[i]-Anyone born after the 80s[/i]
[hr][/hr]

[b]Strider[/b], the most "By the Book" metroidvania ever made...

[h1]Downsides[/h1]
It's not bad, just not very inventive, the aesthetics are very bland at times and the glow effect are all over the place and feel very plastic-y, making it look like an early ps3 game.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Besides that... the rest is quite fun.

It’s an cation-y brawler with some platforming and puzzles mixed in, when you start to unlock the battle upgrades that let you through the sectioned off areas the moveset starts to have its own flow, and puzzles don't slow the rhythm it sets up as much as the start.

Another suggestion I have towards people who don't care about exploring 100% of the map: DON’T

Very few times the game asks you to backtrack to get in a door you unlocked with the new upgrade, but most of the times the rewards are just experience that’s going to be a drop in the ocean for the paint in the game you’re getting them at
[hr][/hr]

Still, I had fun overall, good gameplay and flow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079888394', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1615053508}
review:
Meh.

I'm a fan of Strider's design and aesthetic but this game doesn't really pack much of anything.  It's not a "bad game" but feels just passable.  Some of what holds it back:

-Analog control only.
You can't use the D-Pad to control Strider, which seems really odd for a game like this.  It feels unnatural and imprecise, which then leaves you never feeling like you're satisfied with your movements.  The game tries to compensate for this with lots of healing items spread out across the level, but then it feels like you're going through on 'God Mode' where it doesn't really matter how much damage you take.  If you try to go through it by actually skillfully dodging things, then you're back at square one with the analog control feeling like an inadequate input to do it through, like having to steer from the passenger seat.

-Impact seems absent
Much like Strider's movement, his hits also seem to lack impact.  The few times they do hold impact is because of slow-motion, which is not something you want to repeat often as it interrupts the flow.  But it definitely feels like something's missing.  I'm not sure if that's sound design, graphical design, or something else, but there's just a very light feel to everything, like nothing carries weight or substance.

-Somewhat bland
At the end, everything feels somewhat bland which is odd because Strider himself is unique and some of the level design touches are unique.  But when everything was put together, it comes off as rather meh.  I feel like it suffers from a case of quantity vs quality.  I would've rather a smaller game with fewer enemies if it meant you'd have a more impactful experience, rather than one that tried to do a lot and came off as unexceptional.

FWIW

author: {'steamid': '76561198030724867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1614556911}
review:
ストライダー飛竜１、２をリメイクしてメトロイドヴァニアにしたゲーム。
おすすめしないにしてるけど、BloodstainedやENDER LILIESやMidnight Castle Succubusみたいな傑作ではないというだけで、OriとかHOLLW NIGHTSとかの駄目なメトロイドヴァニアに比べれば普通に遊べる佳作。

良い点：
なつかしい飛竜１、２の世界観やキャラが再現されているのは個人的にけっこう嬉しい。
（特に飛竜２を再現したステージが多い）
壁や天井を自在に移動するかっこよさは健在。
飛竜はちゃんとかっこよくて安心。
プラズマカタパルトでの移動は爽快で、自由度があって楽しい。ヒットラーの復活のワイヤーアクションのような一つの発明だと思う。

悪い点：
自機の飛竜の攻撃力が低く、雑魚兵士もなかなか倒せない。
敵弾をほぼ回避できないが、かわりに体力回復がたくさん出るので、攻略は基本ゴリ押しになりアクションとしては大味。
自機の攻撃能力はパワーアップというより属性の追加しかないようなものなので、飛竜の攻撃方法は最後まで変わり映えせず、強くならない。
そのため、最後まで雑魚戦が楽勝にはならない。
（盾持ちの兵士が出てくるたびにサイファーの属性を切り替えて丁寧に溜め斬りを当てないといけない）
ステージは雰囲気はあるが、どういう地形なのか・どこが通れるのか見にくく、頻繁にマップを開いて確認するはめになる。
ボスでやられてリトライするとその都度ボス登場デモを見せられ、スキップもできないのでストレスが溜まる。
強制的に障害物競走を成功するまで何度もやらされるところがいくつかあるのもストレス。
全体マップが機能しておらず、各ステージマップの端がどのステージにつながっているのか知る方法がない。
自分でメモでもしておくしかない。
クリアするだけなら目的地の方向を教えてくれるので困らないが、メトロイドヴァニアの醍醐味である、移動手段が増えて前のステージのアイテムを回収しに戻ろうとした時に、非常に困る。
一番の問題点は、メトロイドヴァニアなのにワープポイントがないこと。
これは駄目でしょう。
ステージを戻って要素を回収するのが大変で、もう一度やろうという気にならない。
（クリアするだけなら必要ないが）
ヒョウ型オプションを使ったワープポイントが全ステージにあればよかったのに。

author: {'steamid': '76561198084344385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1312, 'last_played': 1613293813}
review:
Strider (рус. странник, бродяга.) – эдакий супер ниндзя с мечем на перевес сражающийся с кибернетическими врагами. Причем на этом противоречия не заканчиваются, так, казалось бы, если главный герой ниндзя, то он должен уметь действовать скрытно, но в игре ни о какой скрытности речи вообще не идет. 
Какое же впечатление оставляет игра после прохождения основной сюжетной компании? Я проходил игру на среднем уровне сложности, и она так и ощущалась, что сложнее уже не надо, а если по легче, то уже будет скучновато. Воспринимается все ровно, будто перед нами четко сбитый выверенный продукт. Игра относится к жанру метроидвания, но при этом она достаточно линейна и заблудиться в кибернетическом мире тебе не дадут, т.к. на карте тебе стрелочкой показывают направление движения до следующей локации. Схватки с противниками очень динамичны и если вы играете на геймпаде то управление кажется весьма отзывчивым и доставляет массу позитивных эмоций. Если по мере получения новых способностей проходить по карте и собирать ставшие доступными улучшения для сюрикенов здоровья и энергии, то битвы с боссами не доставляют особо больших трудностей.
Сюжет не самая сильная составляющая данной игры, хотя это не критично. Так же к минусам можно отнести однообразные локации, но они не приедаются.
Поэтому, как мне кажется, оценка 8 из 10 вполне справедлива для данной игры. Советую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027575716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1613205301}
review:
シリーズ初プレイ

攻撃が軽い感じというか重厚感？切った感じ？がしないのがイマイチ
雑に言うとザシュッとかというよりペチペチッみたいな印象

高低差があるマップのせいなのか縦横無尽という感じはしない
壁張り付きがある分それを使うマップ構成なのかなんか狭いなという印象のほうが強かった

導入が全くないから急に放り投げられてちょとポカーン
もっと進めればできることも増えるらしいけどできる範囲で探索してもライフアップとか設定資料とかばかり
正直世界観に入り込めてないのにシティだの居住区だのといわれても見た目すらそれっぽくない
どちらかというなら巨大軍事会社とか巨大工場とかって言われたほうがしっくりくる（レベルデザイン？が変な感じ）
敵の配置が雑に感じた（足場があればとりあえず雑魚がおいてある感じ）

自分はスピード感や爽快感を特に感じられなかったのでおすすめはしません
結局のところはなんか思ってたのと違うこれにつきます

review: The biggest problem this game has is its' visual design.  You will have a hard time keeping track of where you're going and where you want to go due to most areas being black or obscured.  Without the glowing lights you'd likely be lost forever.  The combat is too frantic at times to be satisfying and the soundtrack is largely mute compared to the sound effects even when you turn them down.  A rather shallow and disappointing game that they try to prop up by making it a Metroid-like game, but fumbles that aspect as well, especially for how shallow its' implementation is.

review:
2015年买的游戏，直到最近AGDQ2021看了NES版的速通，才想起来库里有这么个游戏……

优点：教科书一般的银河城，而且很贴心的把各种需要不同能力的门都给标出来了，升级物品在地图上也有很大的显示判定，基本上都不用特意的去探索，一周目在不看任何攻略的情况下，也能找齐除了外观以外的所有升级道具。

缺点：大地图的功能基本是摆设，交互的逻辑也很不太合理，关键除了两种需要能力对应的传送方式，没有通用的传送点。普通难度中后期难度偏低，基本所有BOSS都可以一轮莽过，不需要任何技巧。

review: [b]Wake the fuсk up, Strider. We have a [i]Город Казахов[/i] to burn.[/b] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vf5AoVsF2m8 [i][b]Аутентичный ремейк[/b][/i]. В плане, что играется абсолютно так же, как и в 1989: механики оригинальных игр были в точности перенесены на современный движок (достаточно сравнить геймплей Strider Arcade и имеющийся). И клюквенный компот в качестве сеттинга, как свежий, из банки, закатанной в конце 80-х. Небольшая продолжительность (<10ч для прохождения на 100%). Итого имеем не сильно затянутую играбельную "метроидванию" с классическими механиками. Уныло ли? 50/50, учитывая что сюжет/сеттинг/персонажи здесь не особо интересны в сравнении с другими платформерами с как минимум выдающейся стилистикой. У игры очень стремное начало, когда после 5-секундного ролика нас сразу бросают в бой (никакой экспозиции), и игра при этом оказывается куда более 2D, чем это кажется по скринам на странице в стиме. https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2315043138 [spoiler][b]Say sayonara pidоrаs![/b][/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198122365685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1615843612}
review:
I've only played this for an hour but 2 things are already really clear: the combat is addicting, weighty, slashy-crunchy-munchy-shooty fun. And the exploration is an absolute CHORE.

The problem with this game is that it can't decide if it's a Metroidvania or a direct, shoot-from-the-hip action platformer with linear levels. It tries to do both. So you'll have a blast with each encounter (killing dudes is FUN). But you'll never be happy with exploring the map. 

I keep not being able to decide if I should go left or right because one side is a secret with goodies and the other is a cutscene door slammed in your face that you can't return from. So I end up inching back and forth trying to figure out which side is optional so I can do it all. And since enemies respawn, it gets real tiring real fast.

Get rid of the cutscenes and just open up the maps more organically OR just make it a tough linear action game and either way, you'd have a fun plat-slasher. But both? They mix like shurikens and fruitcake.

I still recommend it on sale for $5 or less because it's mechanically very sound. But I've played better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198811914094', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1609377048}
review: Strider é um jogo de plataforma e de Hack'n Slash onde você controla o famoso ninja Strider. O jogo funciona como o Strider antigo (conforme você avança no game e vai matando os inimigos e chefes, você vai obtendo upgrades de ataque, de vida, de energia). Posso dizer que o jogo é muito bom e me prendeu bastante (possui bons gráficos, boa variedade de inimigos, boa jogabilidade, boa dificuldade, entre outros). Durante minha jogatina encontrei somente um problema e pesquisando nos fóruns encontrei várias pessoas relatando bugs (controles que não funcionam, jogo que não entra, tradução que não funciona, ''crashes'' durante o game, etc)... e no meu caso, o problema foi que de 20 em 20 minutos o game ''crashava'' do nada (e toda vez que isso acontecia eu tinha que iniciar o game novamente e começar do último save point)... isso frustava bastante... mas deu pra zerar e platinar o game sem maiores problemas. Voltando ao jogo (apesar da experiência que tive com ''crashes'') acho que vale a pena dar uma conferida no game sim (tanto pra quem já jogou o antigo ou pra quem nunca jogou). Pra não ser tão injusto, no geral... Nota 5.5/10. Recomendo!

review: Its a great game but the game crashes a lot, and given that checkpoints are kind of spread out here and there you are better off playing it on older hardware or on consoles. author: {'steamid': '76561198048351190', 'num_games_owned': 562, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1608790011}
review:
This is a fun game, but Capcom should be EMBARRASSED at the state they've left the PC version in while continuing to collect money for it. The game crashes about every 5 minutes no matter what remedy you attempt to use. Looking at the Steam forums, this has apparently been the status quo for at least 4 years.
So, no matter. You can suffer through the crashes and keep playing while relying on the checkpoint saves to have your back, right? No. They're nowhere to be found in the final area of the game, and after doing the same objective at least 10 times only for the game to crash before I can move on to the final boss, I've had it. I can only imagine if I actually made it to the boss, the game would crash when I was about to defeat him.
This is not okay. This game isn't some relic of the GFWL era. It's too new for this kind of unfixed error.

review:
It's decent if you manage to get it running (there's few glaringly major issues).

There's better metroidvanias out there tho, but this is one of the few where you play weird scifi ninja who scales walls and ceilings, which is not actually that unusual nowadays (was back with original Strider).

To get this running on modern computer:
- You need to disable HT/SMT or run in some legacy compatibility mode that reduces number of cores (8 cores is the magic number apparently? You can do this at least on AMD CPUs via Ryzen Master).
- You need to install the game on a HDD (yes, HDD, not SSD or anything else fancy) that is less than 1 TB in size.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 797, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1606235379}
review:
[h1] Information / Review English [/h1]

STRIDER ™ / ス ト ラ イ ダ ー 飛 竜 ® is an action adventure developed by Double Helix Games / Capcom.

[h1] Gameplay / Story [/h1]

Everywhere you can feel that the story of the original Strider dates back to the end of the Cold War. In a dystopian and technically advanced future, a dark Russian has usurped world power and rules from Kazakh City with an iron hand. In the role of the high-tech ninja Hiryu you have to try to find your way through the city to finally kill the "Grand Master". Even at the end of the 80s, no dog behind the stove was interested in this story.

Strider sticks to the mechanics that made his ancestor with his gambling hall roots an insider tip and serious challenger for Sega's similar shinobi more than 25 years ago: You run and climb. At the same time, the controls sometimes seem unnecessarily jerky when there are transitions between horizontal and vertical movement. You jump, you fight and split up the robotic opponents - just like before. The action scrolls smoothly in all directions, the attacks that come with two buttons and do without a block flow from the fingers. Dynamic and fast action instead of sneaking and slow assassination are on the program. However, I would suggest choosing expert level A. Because on all others you are at most challenged with the intermediate and final bosses to some extent. The standard enemies are no more than cannon fodder at the C and B levels. It was different back then: Strider was short, but intense and not easy to master. In contrast to the comparatively linear approach of its predecessor, Double Helix builds on a second element: level exploration.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ large, nested game world
+ atmospheric art design
+ demanding combat system
+ numerous allusions to the classic
+ good boss fights
+ a lot to discover
+ Achievements and trading cards

[h1] Contra [/h1]

- poor story
- Control during climbing not implemented well

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

STRIDER ™ / ス ト ラ イ ダ ー 飛 竜 ® offers you a successful new edition of the ninja action classic, which gives you hectic, dynamic battles with area research of the 2D Castlevanias.


[h1] Information / Review Deutsch [/h1]

STRIDER™ / ストライダー飛竜® ist ein Action-Abenteuer, welches von Double Helix Games/Capcom entwickelt wurde. 

[h1] Gameplay / Geschichte [/h1]

Dass die Geschichte des Ur-Strider aus der Endphase des Kalten Krieges stammt, ist überall zu spüren. In einer dystopischen und technisch fortgeschrittenen Zukunft hat ein finsterer Russe die Weltmacht an sich gerissen und regiert von Kasach City aus mit eiserner Hand. In der Rolle des Hightech-Ninjas Hiryu muss man versuchen, seinen Weg durch die Stadt zu finden, um schließlich den "Großmeister" zu töten. Diese Geschichte hat schon Ende der 80er Jahre keinen Hund hinter dem Ofen interessiert. 

Strider hält aber an den Mechaniken fest, die seinen Urahn mit seinen Spielhallen-Wurzeln vor mehr gut 25 Jahren zu einem Geheimtipp sowie ernsten Herausforderer für Segas ähnlich gelagertes Shinobi gemacht haben: Man läuft und klettert. Dabei wirkt die Steuerung bei Übergängen zwischen horizontaler und vertikaler Fortbewegung allerdings manchmal unnötig hakelig. Man springt, man kämpft und zerteilt die robotischen Gegner - genau wie früher. Das Geschehen scrollt flüssig in alle Richtungen,  die mit zwei Knöpfen auskommenden und auf einen Block verzichtenden Attacken fließen aus den Fingern. Dynamik und schnelle Action statt Schleichen und langsames Meucheln stehen auf dem Programm. Allerdings würde ich vorschlagen, den Experten-Schwierigkeitsgrad A zu wählen. Denn auf allen anderen wird man höchstens bei den Zwischen- und Endbossen einigermaßen gefordert. Die Standard-Gegner sind auf den C- und B-Stufen nicht mehr als Kanonenfutter. Das war damals anders: Strider war zwar kurz, aber intensiv und nicht einfach zu bewältigen. Im Gegensatz zum vergleichsweise linearen Ansatz des Vorgängers baut Double Helix aber noch auf ein zweites Element: Levelerforschung. 

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ große, verschachtelte Spielwelt
+ stimmungsvolles Artdesign
+ forderndes Kampfsystem
+ zahlreiche Anspielungen auf den Klassiker
+ gute Bosskämpfe
+ viel zu entdecken
+ Errungenschaften und Trading Cards

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- magere Geschichte
- Stuerung beim klettern nicht gut umgesetzt

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

STRIDER™ / ストライダー飛竜® bietet dir eine gelungene Neuauflage des Ninja-Action Klassikers, die dir hektisch-dynamische Kämpfe mit Gebietserforschung der 2D-Castlevanias vermitteln.

- Recensione -


Strider nasce come manga nel 1988. Dopo un anno viene prodotto il primo gioco di Strider (Platform 2D) disponibile solo per gli arcade, che vede Come protagonista Hiryu, uno Strider (un ninja). Nello stesso anno esce la stessa versione, ma per il NES. Dopo circa 10 anni viene prodotto Strider 2. Dopo 13 anni di attesa uscì il nuovo capitolo di Strider. Il gioco a prima vista può sembrare molto semplice e monotono, ma non è così. Questo gioco è stato veramente impressionante. Il gioco inizialmente è un po' legnoso, ma appena si incominciano a sbloccare le prime abilità di movimento ci si incomincia veramente a divertire. Il combattimento è veramente divertente dato che Hiryu può attaccare molto rapidamente e dispone di molte abilità che rendono il gameplay vario. La cosa che adoro di più di questo gioco è l'alta mobilità. Hiryu disporrà di diverse abilità con diversi effetti. Le abilità consumeranno la barra dell'energia, che si ricaricherà col tempo. La vita di Hiryu inizialmente sarà molto bassa, ma potrà essere aumentata tramite dei collezionabili. Stessa cosa per l'energia. La storia è abbastanza carina ma dato che si tratta di un gioco tratto da un manga (Che non ho letto) non l'ho capita del tutto. Anche avendo giocato a normale il gioco è abbastanza difficile, soprattutto l'ultimo livello. Il gioco è abbastanza breve, ma alla fine me lo aspettavo da un gioco 2D. Detto questo voglio dire che non mi aspettavo troppo da questo gioco, eppure sono veramente rimasto colpito. Come ultima cosa voglio consigliarvi di non giocare questo gioco con mouse e tastiera, ma di procurarvi un Controller. 

Voto: 9/10

"Breve ma d'effetto"

review:
Strider es el reboot perfecto para un clasico de este calibre. Es un juego totalmente arcade a la vez que actual. Las mecanicas metroidvania le sientan como anillo al dedo. Y el amor a la saga por los desrrolladores, se ve en cada momento de todo el juego.
No puedo evitar destacar lo gratificante que es moverse con Hiryu por los maravillosos escenarios de kazakh, esa distopica ciudad rusa comunista con una excelente ambientacion cyberpunk. La agilidad del protagonista, sus magnificas animaciones, el ajustadisimo control... todo combierte a este must have en un referente a la altura de otras joyas del genero como Hollow Knight u Ori. Si es cierto que dentro del genero no es el que tiene el backtracking mas elaborado ya que su objetivo es que sea un juego rapido y directo, pero si, ahi esta.
Me hice este juego al cien por cien la primera vez que lo jugue en mi Xbox 360, lo repeti en mi Xbox One, me hice con la edicion fisica japonesa para Ps3 que es la unica que existe y esta en castellano y ahora volvere a repetirlo en Pc.
Es cierto que mi devocion por este juego es muy alta, pero no seria asi si fuera un juego cualquiera, es asi por que es una maravilla.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999558526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6345, 'last_played': 1636680677}
review:
I got the strong impression while playing Strider 2014 that it was made by folks who definitely did their homework on what made Strider NES, Strider Arcade, Strider 2, the manga, Capcom vs. Marvel, etc. so successful in the eyes of the players. 

This game isn't a mere copy of its predecessors. It takes the mechanics, the story, the looks, the tone, the feel of the controls, etc., and lets the player enjoy a game which is impressively reminiscent of what came before it. i.e. You'll get nostalgia if you've enjoyed previous Strider games, but if you've never heard of Strider before, you won't feel like you've been snubbed from the treehouse. 

I was relieved and happy how often this version would have a new take on familiar bits from the older Strider games, and this new version outdid the older versions without ruining the nostalgic meaningfulness of the older games. i.e. I can still enjoy the earlier Strider games even though THIS one is very, very well-done.

My only big complaint is that the protagonist's speaking lines often ruin the mystery of the character's personality. Granted, the voice actor still did a great job. (I was always a fan of the professional, enigmatic, rarely-speaks Hiryu who would save the world without any bravado, yee-hahs, arrogance, or one-liners. The Strider 2014 game's dialogue unfortunately doesn't portray the protagonist in a way which allows the audience to admire the character's sense of mystery.)

All-in-all, I've enjoyed playing this game. Favorite foe: the brainwalkers. :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198847598287', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1369, 'last_played': 1601909898}
review:
最高难度99.2%完成度，主线通关+全收集。还差最后三个成就，其中两个要开新档，懒得做了
通关时间11h左右，主线流程5h左右

说说游戏体验：
莫名其妙的剧情-1
并不合适的音乐-1
糟糕的地图设计-1
[b]最重要的[/b]
nmd没有受伤保护-10086

作为一个类银河恶魔城游戏，受伤后没有无敌时间或者受伤保护，是这游戏最大的败笔
游戏中，在我得到所有能力，所有数值已经满了的情况下，
我还是会轻易的被3个小怪和一个陷阱压起身压到残血甚至当场暴毙
会被射速快的敌人一梭子直接空大半血条
会被带冰冻的敌人连续冰冻，动弹不得
闪避技能跑路？不存在的，直接给你打断，该被打继续被打
6h左右的收集时间，有一半是在赶路、被敌人和陷阱卡住、被打死读档加载地图
要不是敌人会行动，打着打着会换位置，我才有操作空间，不然收集时间怕是要再多一半

刚接触的时候，有很浓的银河战士气息，仿佛把我带回了当初在gba上玩密特罗德的那段时光
这也是我能把它玩通关的动力
但事实证明，这游戏差太远了

唯一的亮点在于流畅的操作感[spoiler]切攻击类型像极了dante切风格0.0[/spoiler]
不推荐游玩，建议只在简单或者普通难度下体验下操作手感

ps:进最终boss图里还出bug了
一个是卡墙里只能读档解决
一个是屏幕一直闪烁也只能读档解决

author: {'steamid': '76561198049799280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1599743644}
review:
Let's all be honest. The only REAL reason any of us are here is because there's been such a void of Metroid and Castlevania content for the last decade (1 game in 11 years for Metroid, and that was a remake, and 12 since a REAL Castlevania, excluding Bloodstained). We're so hungry (and desperate) for anything tagged Metroidvania so we'll grab whatever we can get our mitts on. 
None of us are here because we saw Strider in the list and went "Oh. A new Strider. I remember playing that on the NES. I've got fond memories of that game. I'll give this one a go". No. That game was a buggy mess and there were (technically) only 2 games for a reason. 
At almost 2 hours in I already felt the hot ball of frustration in the pit of my stomach. 

- It's tagged as a Metroidvania, but it's really not. It's a 2D side-scrolling action platformer. It doesn't have any of the bare bones of a Metroidvania. MVs have a heavy emphasis on exploration, FREE exploration, with some enemies and obstacles to fill out the trip. This is just slashing following a linear path with zero alternate or branching paths. It's "Go here. Okay, good. Now go here. And no deviating!". You are really only allowed to freely explore towards the end once you've got all the power-ups. Until then, doors are locked to keep you on the path. Unlike Super Metroid that lets you go in multiple directions, and depending on which way you go, you'll have differing abilities and health/ammo compared to a friend who plays it too. This game, though, you and a friend will have the exact same experience. 

But my biggest gripe: LET ME CUSTOMISE THINGS! Your options menu is useless! 

- Let me use the D-pad! 
Why, oh WHY, do I HAVE to use the analog stick for a side-scroller!? You know, the games where you need precision when jumping around and aiming? You'll be mid-boss and are slashing in the wrong direction, or you'll slide instead of jumping, or will jump up instead of off the wall. Side-scrollers are 2D, so let me use the 2D movement buttons! The movement keys on the keyboard use the arrows. No one uses these anymore. It's WASD for movement! At least I can customise the controller buttons through Steam and emulate the D-pad acting as the left joystick. There are battles fought on floating balls that I believe is the sole reason you use the joystick to move; so it's easier to get your head around. It would have been better that holding left goes anticlockwise, while holding right makes you go clockwise. The final boss was all kinds of confusing. I have no idea how I didn't die because I was all over the place. 

- Let me turn off subtitles! 
Why is it in Japanese action games when there's text on screen it fills up half the goddamn screen? Think Attack on Titan. Anytime you kill a titan, SUBJUGATED appears over the entire screen and blocks your entire view. The same is here. I'm trying to explore, and some Russian a-hole spreading his propaganda over the loudspeaker won't shut his trap. That's fine in itself, but every time he speaks, the text box covers 1/4 of my screen, covering any vents or platforms that are at eye-level, and can't see anything below. Give me an option to remove the text boxes or turn off subtitles, or at least alter the text size. I do heave ears, you know! The battle against Solo was infuriating with his text boxes (which are only full of taunts and nothing useful) covering the bottom 1/4 of my screen, and therefore covering the floor which explosions rise up from. Ugh! Who designed this! Was it even tested? Don't even get me started on the text boxes covering the battle with Meio! 

- What's the point of having a health bar when health packs are literally floating around at every entrance and lining every rooftop? I never felt that I was in danger. I died once, and that was against Solo for the reason stated above. 

PROS

- I mean, it looks good. I guess. 

- Music is cool. I've found myself bobbing my head to some of the faster tracks. 

That's about it, really. If I could use customise the controllers, and not through Steam, and turn off subtitles, I'd have had a much smoother experience. Sorry, Hiryu. As cool as I think you look, and as much as I love you in Marvel vs Capcom, you once again have an average-at-best solo title. 
There are better, ACTUAL Metroidvania games out there. (Hollow Knight, Axiom Verge, Ori and the Blind Forest/Will of the Wisps, Iconoclasts, Bloodstained, Blasphemous, Salt and Sanctuary. Hell, Seasons After Fall was way less frustrating than this, and that's a Metroidvania that's aimed at a younger audience, and it doesn't even have any enemies!) 
I grabbed Strider for 5 bucks, I think. That's all I'd pay considering how often I found myself cursing at the screen, ESPECIALLY the projectile/spitting enemies. 

HOWEVER, after all that, once I had all the power-ups after about 8-8.5 hours and was making my way through all the levels again with free movement, that was fun, which is why ultimately I give it a thumbs up. It took 8 hours for it to be fun, but I got there. 

TO THE DEVELOPERS: You'll find that people who love Metroidvanias also love things like Final Fantasy. Know what these have in common? Adventure. Travelling. Exploration. It's not the combat we love. That's part of it. The main thing is the travelling. Just the player and character alone together taking in the surroundings. That's what we want. Not our hand held telling us we only have one option. If for your next Strider game you had far fewer cannon fodder enemies, more exploration/more choices available for which ways to go, the choice to decide which power-up to go for first, fewer projectile enemies all crammed together, and a few tweaks to the control scheme (especially the 360 combat), that'd be something I'd love to play and would look forward to. 
Also, why not a story-heavy turn-based JRPG? Read the Strider manga. It's got a great setting and story for a JRPG, and the striders' abilities would work in one

author: {'steamid': '76561198008967093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1599445092}
review:
I played the original Strider on the NES. It was a glitchy mess with no story worth remembering, just slashing through enemies. That was excusable in the NES era, but not in a modern game. The update remains rather story-less. There's something about an oppressive sudo-Soviet regime, but it was a thin attempt, at best.

Play control is a bit frustrating. I often found myself slashing in the wrong direction after quick movements. The game presents itself as a Metroidvania, but the world is rather linear. Backtracking is harder than it should be, and seldom worth it.

There are better ninja-themed games (e.g., [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/860950/Mark_of_the_Ninja_Remastered/]Mark of the Ninja[/url]) or Metroidvanias (e.g., [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/367520/Hollow_Knight/]Hollow Knight[/url]) for you to spend your money on.

review:
Recommended.

This was a game that I was eager to play from launch date, but due to life circunstances didn't got it. Years later, here I am.

The Strider series marked my childhood as a very good arcade game from the Genesis System. 

Some years later, it was relaunched on PSX and a sequel, Strider 2, on the same system, after this Strider only appeared as a cameo on the Vs.Capcom Games. I think he would be good friends with Asagi from NIS.

Loved the way this was executed as a Metroidvania-Arcade Style.

The story, gameplay and scenario are very simple, but enjoyable. Very Short though and easy to 100%

Buy it if you enjoy the genre or as a nostalgia factor like me.

Scenario - 3
Sync - 4
Sense - 3

author: {'steamid': '76561197996470324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1597885485}
review:
Strider is a good dose of old Nintendo nostalgia that starts out strong, but then gets lazy with its Metroidvania implementation. It has a stage layout that encourages exploration, but then makes gameplay and major upgrades entirely linear.

All of the old Strider's elements are here: The colorful, future-ninja aesthetic. The wavy red [strike]scarf[/strike]plasma exhaust. Clinging to walls, hanging from ceilings, performing flips, slides, and throwing kunai knives, it's all here. You face off against [strike]Russia[/strike] Eastern European dictatorship with an army of thousands of faceless clone/cyborg soldiers while its citizens try to stay the hell out of the way.

Strider's best encounters ([spoiler]like fighting Ouroboros in the air[/spoiler]) occur in the game's opening act. From there it starts to slide downhill. You'll start to notice that there really isn't any much variety to the enemies outside of the bosses, pallete swaps, and a few weapon changes. 

The most annoying enemies are the shield mooks that carry around riot shields that sometimes glow with plasma energy. To kill them, you have to blow away their shield with a charged shot. While these enemies look like you can attack them at different angles than their shields, allowing for more skillful approaches, this is not possible. Later in the game, you have to match your plasma energy to theirs to take out the shield, which becomes a really annoying game of 'Simon Says' that detracts from a good flow.

The camera sometimes zooms in more than necessary, or shifts and hides vital combat information. While this is annoying, the moments where it truly impacts gameplay are rare. The most irksome time this happened was during the fight against Zero, who has an attack that causes the floor to explode beneath you while hovering in a place at the top of the screen. Yet, when you double-jump up to attack him, the camera shifts to where the explosive floor cannot be seen, making it difficult to determine where you can safely land.

The most glaring flaw in this game is how the world opens up as you gather upgrades. While there are some sections that require upgraded movement types to access, many upgrades are locked behind glowing doors that require certain plasma unlocks to open, of which there are four. It comes off as lazy work at best.

If you are a fan of retro platformers, it's worth a play-thru. 
If you are looking for a really good Metroidvania, look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095217331', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 414, 'playtime_forever': 1129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1129, 'last_played': 1597341105}
review:
10/10 (If you count for the fact that it's a 2D side scroller)

What a game! It's probably the 2nd best game, 2nd only to Castlevania (2D scroller) that I"ve play from my childhood. The joy level was at the highest point throughout. The devs really deserve a huge slap in the back. From watching the videos by the devs talking about the creation of the game, you can tell they had a lot of passion and love for the original. And it shows in-game. 

As I played through it, it had an onslaught of toys to gather and use. Each one with it's own unique use. And the fluidity of movement and the attacks is unlike anything I've played. You really feel free and powerful. The mobs range in difficulty from hard to easy based on how you approach the fight. Using a proper chain of abilites and Cypher attacks will cut through enemies with ease. However if you try to hack them down with button mashing you'll find the game much harder. 

Thank you Double Helix Games for your contribution to gaming history. Please do more games like this :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198034086516', 'num_games_owned': 1040, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1596073358}
review:
Pros:
- Fluid movement mechanics, you really feel like a ninja. Slicing, dicing and jumping all around.
- Nice map. Secrets everywhere. Exploration is rewarding and fun.
- Cool boss battles, specially near the end of the game.
- The right length at just over 4 hours on my first playthrough. It ends when the gameplay loop starts to get stale (from the lack of enemy types, mostly).

Cons:
- Can't remap the controls.
- The grunts are copy pasted through the whole game. There are 4 variations of the same boss. Lacks variety.
- Too easy, even on hard difficulty.
- Subtitles that occupy too much room and can't be disabled.
- The mini-map can ruin the sense of exploration, since it highlights all the important upgrades and it tells you where you need to go at all times.

The cons don't outweigh the pros. The game is definitely fun. 7/10.

review:
At first I was really enjoying this game. I played through most of it but several things started to grind on me. 

So many enemy attacks come from off-screen and it feels janky. The  enemy variety is pretty weak -- you are fighting the same boring soldiers and robots over and over. You repeatedly fight the same bosses over and over as well. It also has a sort of washed out artstyle where it is hard to tell what is in the background and what is a platform. 

I enjoy Metroidvanias but this just felt half-baked and mediocre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104229612', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1594823772}
review:
[h1]반쪽짜리 부활[/h1]

 '스트라이더'는 캡콤의 고전 작품인 '스트라이더 히류' 시리즈의 리부트 작품이다. 스테이지 방식의 횡스크롤 액션 게임이었던 원작과는 다르게 탐색이 주가 되는 '메트로배니아' 스타일의 레벨 디자인을 채택한 게 특징이다. 다만, 필자는 원작 '스트라이더 히류'와 '스트라이더 히류 2'를 플레이하지 못했기 때문에 원작과의 연관성이나 차이점에 대해서는 본 소감에서 이 이상 다루지 않겠다.

 본 작의 가장 큰 특징은 단연코 다양한 무브셋을 통한 빠르고 시원시원한 액션이라고 말할 수 있다. 다른 게임과는 비교를 불허하는 빠른 공격 속도와 슬라이드, 더블 점프, 벽 타기, 찍기, 순간이동 등을 활용한 다양한 액션은 스트라이더의 정체성이자 모든 것이다. 스트라이더를 플레이하다 보면 경쾌한 타격감과 마구 튀는 파티클 이펙트에 손가락에 불이 날 기세로 기본 공격 버튼을 연타할 수밖에 없게 된다. 적을 처치할 때마다 체력과 에너지가 회복되기 때문에 적을 썰어버릴 때마다 쏟아져 나오는 체력과 에너지들은 이런 플레이에 경쾌함을 더해준다.

 능력이 적은 게임 초반엔 사방에서 날아드는 총알에 부조리하다는 생각이 많이들 것이다. 하지만 스트라이더는 게임이 진행될수록 해금되는 능력이 다양하게 존재한다. 히류의 공격에 다양한 효과를 부여하는 4종류의 플라즈마, 에너지를 사용해 사용하는 강력한 능력인 옵션, 그 외 체력과 에너지 업그레이드 등등 스토리가 진행될수록 다양한 업그레이드를 획득하게 된다.

 능력이 해금될수록 주인공 '히류'는 A급 스트라이더에 걸맞은 모습을 보여주며 적들의 포화 세례 속을 손쉽게 지나가게 된다. 특히, 본 작은 매트로배니아 식 레벨 디자인을 채택하고 있어 놓쳤던 수집 요소를 찾기 위해 초반의 맵으로 돌아가 본다면 그동안 히류가 훨씬 강해졌다는 인상을 받을 수 있다.

 경쾌한 액션과 빠른 속도로 스트라이더는 확실히 가볍게 해 볼 만한 작품이다. 생각 없기 가볍게 즐기기엔 썩 나쁘지 않은 작품임에는 틀림이 없다. 하지만 그렇다고 본 작이 완성도 높은 작품이냐고 묻는다면 그건 확실히 아니라 말할 수 있다. 본 작의 가장 치명적인 문제점은 특유의 스피디한 액션을 빼고 나면 나머지 모든 부분이 평이하거나 완성도가 떨어진다는 점이다.

 스트라이더는 한마디로 '촌스럽다'. 개성 없고 기억에 전혀 남지 않는 캐릭터들과 단순 무식한 일차원 스토리까지는 '고전의 계승'이라는 명목 아래에 어느 정도 감안해 줄 수 있는 부분이다. 하지만 아무리 PS3와 함께 개발되었다지만 2014년 작품 치고는 그래픽과 연출이 너무 좋지 못하다. 대화창에 표시되는 일러스트와 모델링 사이의 괴리감이 매우 심하고 배경 그래픽도 아트와 퀄리티 모두 심심하기 그지없다. 심지어 플레이어 캐릭터인 '히류'의 모델링 퀄리티마저 매우 조악해 일러스트와 동일 인물인지 의심이 드는 지경이다. 거기에 자체적인 연출마저 매우 부족해 게임에 어디 하나 '멋있다'라고 생각할만한 구간이 없다.

 플레이 화면의 UI는 밋밋하고 가시성도 그다지 좋지 못하다. 전체 맵 화면은 더욱 가관으로 맵의 어떤 통로가 어느 위치로 이어져 있는지에 대한 기본적인 정보조차 제공해주지 않아 지나친 맵으로 돌아가 수집 요소를 찾는 걸 너무나 힘들게 만든다. 그 흔한 빠른 이동 기능조차 없기 때문에 맵이 몇 개 없고 크기 역시 결코 넓지 않음에도 불구하고 일일이 걸어 다니며 표시해주지 않는 길을 찾고 수집 요소를 얻는 게 당연히 괴로울 수밖에 없다. 이는 매트로배니아 장르를 표방하는 게임으로서 완전히 실격인 부분이다.

 구닥다리 레벨 디자인 역시 매우 거슬린다. 매우 적은 종류의 몬스터를 팔레트 스왑 후 그대로 사용하기 때문에 게임이 전체적으로 단조롭다는 인상이 강하다. 중간중간 차지 공격이나 특정 능력을 강요하는 방패병 몬스터를 배치해 게임의 흐름 자체를 툭 끊어버리는 느낌이 드는 건 덤이다. 그 와중에 스테이지의 난이도는 몬스터의 체력을 크게 높인다든지 반사할 수 없는 총알을 추가하는 등의 짜증 나는 방법으로만 조정되어 있어 게임의 재미를 더 해치고 말았다. 심지어 그렇게 조정한 난이도 역시 변화가 고르지 못해 마지막 스테이지에서는 이때까지와는 비교를 불허할 정도로 난이도가 급격하게 상승한다.

 스테이지 기믹 역시 어디선가 본 작품들의 열화 카피라는 게 아쉽다. 중력이 뒤바뀌는 구간은 맵이 직관적이지 못해 혼란을 불러일으키고, 강풍 속에서 플랫폼 사이를 뛰어다니는 구간은 전혀 신선하지 못하고 귀찮기만 하다.

 그 외에 세이브 슬롯을 단 한 개만 제공하는 점, 어렵게 모으는 코스튬들이 그저 팔레트 스왑이라는 점, 보스전의 난이도 역시 균일하지 못하다는 점등 플레이어에 대한 배려가 매우 부족하다는 느낌을 받는 부분이 너무나 많다. 호쾌한 액션으로 플레이 감각 자체는 나쁘지 않다는 걸 생각하면 나머지 부분을 전혀 다듬지 못했다는 게 정말 아쉬운 작품이라고 할 수 있겠다.

 스트라이더는 분명 재미없는 게임은 아니다. 호쾌하고 경쾌하고 스피디한 액션 활극 매트로배니아 게임으로서 가볍게 플레이하기에는 꽤 괜찮은 선택이 될 수 있다. 하지만 액션만 보고 그냥 지나치기에는 너무나 많은 문제점이 산재해있는 작품이기도 하다. 원작에 대한 정보를 아예 모르는 게이머가 플레이한다면 이런 작품에 매력을 느낄 것인가에 대해서 많은 의문이 든다. 만약 후속작이 만들어진다거나 다시 한번 리부트가 이루어진다면 좀 더 섬세한 감각으로 개발되기를 바랄 뿐이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034303835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 1594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1594, 'last_played': 1457538802}
review:
[i]Strider[/i] est un jeu d'action/plateforme où vous allez incarner Hiryu, un super ninja virevoltant, dans un univers cyberpunk faisant la part belle à l'action.

Ce titre se révèle diablement efficace dans ce qu'il propose : une prise en main facile et rapide du personnage, un gameplay réactif et nerveux mais également exigeant, des combats de boss épiques, une durée de vie satisfaisante (qui peut être considérablement prolongée en collectant les objets/bonus cachés, ce qui sera bien utile pour notre héros). On ne s'ennuie ainsi jamais car il y a continuellement des ennemis à affronter et l'on prend alors un plaisir incroyable à contrôler notre ninja, faisant de [i]Strider[/i] un jeu terriblement addictif.

Concernant les défauts, le jeu peut sembler assez difficile à certains moments (notamment contre les boss) mais il n'y a rien d'impossible si l'on est un peu persévérant, d'autant que la difficulté n'est jamais réellement frustrante. On pourra également regretter un côté un peu répétitif mais cela ne m'a pas du tout gêné pour apprécier ce jeu. Mis à part ces deux petites contrariétés, je ne vois pas grand-chose à lui reprocher car il remplit bien son rôle.

[i]Strider[/i] s'affirme comme un jeu addictif au gameplay nerveux qui procurera un grand plaisir à ceux recherchant une bonne dose d'action et d'adrénaline. C'est pourquoi je vous le recommande fortement, d'autant que son prix est négligeable durant les soldes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013146396', 'num_games_owned': 1655, 'num_reviews': 2126, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1704319429}
review:
БОМБА.

Практически идеальная управляемость (постоянно "магнитится", куда бы закрепить свой крюк - в маленьких закоулках во время боя это будет критично), [b]наиграмотнейший[/b] левел-/геймдиз, шикарный сеттинг.

Из минусов:
- скучный сюжет (как и полагается не-ААА проектам Capcom, хотя...)
- удивительно, но почему-то несбалансировано в целом. Есть боссы, которых попытки с десятой победишь, а есть супер лёгкие. С обычными уровнями плачевнее, вне ключевых сражений 90% времени Страйдер - просто неубиваемая имба, поэтому надо [i]постараться, чтобы погибнуть[/i]. Это не отменяет того, что игра ну очень крутая - просто часто возникает ощущение, что ты не дерёшься с врагами, а попросту их избиваешь.
- несмотря на то, что предметы спрятаны интересно, игра оставила меня без возможности добить коллектаблсы. После финального сражения вылезло непонятное окно с предложением СОХРАНИТЬ ИГРУ... иии после него стала доступна только новая игра. "То ли я дурак, то ли лыжи не едут". Заново, конечно, проходить ради этого уже не буду, больно много насобирал до такой подставы.

Точняк рекомендую. Но хз, как вести себя со сбором всех предметов. Наверное, стоит собрать их ДО входа в финальное здание.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090193860', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1591999045}
review:
A pretty basic Metroidvania.

Combat is really simple, but introduces elements the further into the game that you get into which add a little complexity. Only two of these elements are useful combat-wise, and the most fun of the two is introduced at the end of the game, which is quite disappointing. Overall though, this is a hack and slash through and through because of how simple the bosses are. I blitzed through this game, and got the speedrun achievement on my first and only playthrough, which I found hilarious. This combat system starts showing its weakness when later in the game things start chunking your health and stun locking you. Stun locking is NEVER FUN, especially since the movement is not built for dodging, and stunning projectiles are spammed heavily.

I did really like the platforming in this game. The ability to stick to any wall was cool and they really designed the game around that ability. The map in this game is also superb, as it shows where collectibles are if you've uncovered the nearby area and point you to where the next story segment is. I greatly appreciate this, as I tend to get lost in Metroidvanias.

As or the story, I skipped the cutscenes, as the story is pretty basic. Nothing noteworthy. Voice acting also sucks.

3/5 could have been better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035300713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1592154041}
review:
Let's get the bad out of the way first- the subtitles that block the screen during gameplay (which mind boggingly have NO option to turn off) are a real problem, the voice acting is awful, consisting mostly of borderline offensive stereotypical accents, the character designs and portraits are goofy western comic book style versions of a previously slick anime style, and the way some guns can lock you into repeat knock down animations can get annoying fast. 
That said, the gameplay is what matters most, and this is a great playing metroidvania (outside the previously mentioned issues). Strider's controls are just slick and smooth, and just have a great feel. DH has done a nice job expanding the Strider universe, which is one I've always been curious to know more about because Strider has always had such a unique setting. I would love to see a follow up, but with a return to Capcom's anime style character designs...the budget comic book look of the characters is very unappealing to me. But overall, I enjoyed the game and am glad to see the techno ninja back in action.

Strider in Japan is known as Strider Hiryū  (ストライダー飛竜, Sutoraidā Hiryū)

author: {'steamid': '76561198105785707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 1284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1592410297}
review:
[h1]It really took me a lot of time to decide if I liked this game or not.[/h1]

You see, I'm one of the biggest strider fans alive, ever since its release in 1989. It was really badass and magical, the epic of the mysterious ninja going to war against the robotic soviet army led by an evil alien sorceror. Yeah Strider is a game that relies solely on aesthetic impressions and the story doesn't make sense. Trying to develop that story would have only resulted into incoherent divagations and the developers of this game didn't fall into this trap. 
Back then, arcade machines were miles ahead of home consoles/computers for graphic, animation and sound. this game was a real trip. I had a real fetish for this game and I was eager to be back in the 3d remastered feeric.

Initially the remaster looks very good, as soon as you reach the second level you reconnect with the magic of the huge overbearing city which is one of the game's main character.
The coldness and magnificence of the megalopolis is excellently rendered, with great attention to details, and it made me happy to be back into New Kazakh. The third level is very impressive too, with a huge dam to scale before you reach the military area.
Unfortunately this is where the good things stop.

Making an arcade style gameplay in the 201xs wouldn't make sense on home consoles/computers, that's why they turned the game into a metroidvania. Or more precisely a semi-metroidvania.
This could have been clever, there is the exploration aspect of the metroidvania mixed with some long horizontal or vertical areas where you have to fight your way like in the arcade game.
Unfortunately it doesn't work. In the first couple hours your characters doesn't have enough weapons and mobility options and the constant backtracking through short foxholes and mazes is a bit annoying.
As soon as you power up sufficiently , it becomes less annoying but the enemies are not very varied. Most of the enemies you'll encounter are pallette swap of 3/4 different soldiers.

There are a lot of bosses, most of them being ports of the original arcade bosses and mid-bosses, they're almost all there (except the roided super soldier of the first level for some reason) but the game has a serious lack of difficulty and most of the bosses can be defeated in less than 5 minutes. The main levels are also fairly easy and you'll only lose if you are very carefree. The game doesn't really require any skill and you can zap through it in a few hours if you don't collect all the crap.
Yeah collectibles seem to be one of the main gameplay elements here, if you don't waste your time collecting useless concept art and costumes like the devs intended, you can finish the game in less than ten hours. Even despite the adversity of the floorplans that will force you to come back 3 times through each of the levels, each time you get able to open new color-coded doors.
There are 3 different color-coded weapon types that you have to acquire, but you can feel this gameplay is tacked on and forced. Only the second one is useful against bosses because it does a lot more damage.
All in all I'd say the gameplay is very undeveloped.

As for the universe, and since the metroidvania format demands that all takes place in one huge area, we lose a lot of the diversity of the original game. Here you won't be fighting amazons and dinosaurs in a mushroom infested forest, or wolves in the desolate tundra. Everything takes place in one huge city. Unfortunately, after the dam level, everything becomes metallic militarized corridors till the end of the game. They added an underground black market with an insurgency leader that doesn't do anything interesting, but there is very little graphical difference with the other levels. They also added an "underground temple" which is more of the same, with weird frescos in the background (and unexplainable graphical slow-downs)
Even the flying fortress "Balrog" doesn't make you feel like you're on an airship. It's just more metallic corridors.

The music is the worst part in the game, it's some insipid techno music that vaguely copies some melodic segment from the original music but the whole thing is so mediocre it's barely noticeable.

review:
It's a fairly routine side scrolling action game. Slice your way through enemies with relatively mindless killing punctuated by the occasional boss fight where you need to pay a little bit of attention.

The visuals and sounds are decent, the story is the expected junk from this genre. Overall it's not a bad game, but it did put me to sleep a couple of times as it gets repetitive after a while. It's a serviceable hack & slash action platformer.

Time to complete first time: around 5 to 6 hours. With practice you can get that well under 4. Some replay value for achievements and difficulty options, assuming you don't mind sifting through the same enemies again.

I've waited a long time to play this game due to technical limitations. Now that I'm finally able to I have to say that it does bring a lot of good memories. It is a great revival of a great game. author: {'steamid': '76561198012791773', 'num_games_owned': 735, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1590631148}
review:
Completion time is just under 8 hours. I also haven't played the original game.

Strider is a fun Metroidvania that combines ninjas and cyberpunk, placing you as the Strider Hiryu as he attempts to liberate the people of Kazakh City from the oppressive Emperor Meio, something previous Striders failed to do. The important thing I learned that I want to pass on is that there are 4 different elements or "plasmas", and that your sword (or cypher), kunai (throwing knives), and Plasma Catapult (that launches you a short distance) can all get variants of those plasmas. You also have assistants, called Options that help you through the game and sometimes in combat. There's plenty of zones to explore, and some even have front and back layers to them. At first it seems like you're being pushed along and there's little room to backtrack, but you'll get your chance later in the game once you gain more abilities. There's also collectible concept art, enemy and setting info, and various skins for your character. It's not all that lengthy, but I don't regret buying this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254698382', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1014, 'last_played': 1708813731}
review:
Absolutamente recomendo. 

O jogo não é muito reconhecido, apesar de ser um lançamento da Activision, mas isso é uma grande decepção, já que o jogo é um dos melhores jogos que já joguei na vida. 

A gameplay é veloz e fluida, principalmente mais pro fim do game, quando todas as habilidades estão desbloqueadas. Os gráficos são lindos, considerando que é um jogo de 2014. A história, apesar de conseguir ser facilmente ignorada, é bem complexa e divertida. O jogo, por ser estilo Metroidvania, tem um mapa enorme, e que não é cansativo, então é fácil e até prazeroso voltar para os pontos aonde já passamos, além de que o progresso é mostrado com clareza nos inimigos e mapas. Falando nos inimigos, apesar de que não jogo o jogo desde o começo do ano, estes são muito memoráveis e carismáticos. 

Por fim, o fator rejogabilidade é muito presente, pois já terminei esse jogo diversas vezes, e é o primeiro e único (até o momento) jogo que eu tive o prazer de platinar.

Resumindo, o jogo é incrível. É uma pena que não seja tão famoso quanto outros Metroidvanias, pois ele merece e deveria ter essa visibilidade. Recomendo para todos que verão esta analise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198982600531', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1591070976}
review:
O hack and slash 2D que você passou a sua vida inteira procurando.

Este é o jogo que você quer caso tenha jogado o Strider 2 de PSX e queria algo daquele jeito, mas com dificuldade real e que durasse mais de 30 minutos.

O modo Normal é, na verdade, difícil. Se quiser esse jogo numa versão menos frustrante e mais casual, jogue no Easy - a única coisa que muda é o quanto de dano você leva em cada golpe.

Os elementos metroidvania são sutis - o jogo tem muita coisa a ser coletada e áreas um pouco escondidas. Não espere, no entanto, que os itens coletáveis sejam lá muito relevantes no gameplay; é mais pelo gosto de caçar cada pedacinho do mapa e completar 100%. E pelas roupinhas coloridas. É um jogo com toques soft metroidvania, no máximo, então não espere muito desse aspecto; o foco é a ação rápida e as armadilhas inteligentes. E uma coisa que esse jogo consegue é ser inteligente sem ser excessivamente frustrante. Pra mim, um fator decisivo na diversão.

Mesmo os upgrades que Hiryu ganha ao longo do jogo são lineares e não-customizáveis - no máximo, você pode escolher qual o tipo de plasma mais adequado para usar num determinado momento. Mas nada nível RPG. O sistema de locomoção e teletransporte pelo mapa, usando a águia, é similar aos pontos de transporte de Castlevania. Quando esses pontos começam a aparecer, você percebe que o jogo está te [i]sugerindo[/i] que faça backtracking pra encher a mochila de colecionáveis... Mas em nenhum momento isso é devidamente estimulado ou necessário, e, no caso de um jogador que esteja cagando pra fazer 100%, parece até falha de level design, pois o jogo em si é linear o bastante pra quase nada dessa mobilidade entre mapas ser útil.

Gráficos excelentes e não muito pesados. Controles perfeitos no gamepad, com vibração e tudo. Jogo longo como eu realmente não esperava, especialmente quando se vai pelos 100%. Use um fone, as BGMs são excelentes lv Capcom.

O único jogo desde Marvel vs Capcom que faz jus ao quão cool o Strider Hiryu é.

review:
O jogo é bom mas podia ser melhor. Podia ter menos inimigos repetitivos. A trilha sonora não é memorável mas o jogo joga-se. O jogo sofre um pouco dos slowdowns mas o meu PC é um Intel Core i7 4790 e Geforce GTX NVidia 760 com 16 GB de RAM onde meti o desempenho e a qualidade no meio. Às vezes pode ser da minha placa gráfica ser velha e ter de mudar para uma nova.

A jogabilidade está bem fluída, responde bem aos comandos do teclado e a reacção é muito rápida. Joguei na dificuldade Normal e senti uma enorme diferença comparada com o Strider Hiryu da NES.

7/10 porque o maior destaque está na jogabilidade. Pior destaque está nos inimigos repetitivos e desempenho razoável num PC como este.

review:
I'll start with the bad news—the upgrades are pretty stock for a metroidvania, the plot is vague as hell, and every line of dialogue sounds like it's been translated, retranslated, and transcribed at least twice. I have no idea where I'm supposed to be or what exactly is going on, and I'm three hours in; but that brings me to the good things. For a stock metroidvania, this game plays really well. I don't know that I'm enjoying it as much as the original Strider; but it's a lot of fun and I'm determined to finish it. Definitely worth a look.

It also runs reasonably well on Proton at this point, aside from some missing textures here and there. I imagine it will be at 100% within the next few releases. The game had some Proton trouble in the past with missing audio, or other strange issues; but runs almost perfectly now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198828458456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1488, 'last_played': 1585795735}
review: Discret et inattendu,  voilà que 15 ans après la sortie du second et dernier opus de la série Strider, apparait un remake du jeu éponyme sortie en 1989. Développer par le modeste studio Double Helix Games (qui s'était occuper 1 an auparavant du reboot de Killer instinct, et d'un Silent Hill, l'épisode Homecoming). Respectueux, le titre reprend avec originalité l'univers du jeu originel. Ainsi, on retrouve le Strider, partie pour sauver le monde du joug du monstrueux Meio. Penser tel un metroidvania (jeu qui se définit par plusieurs niveaux différents plus ou moins long selon le jeu dans lesquelles on effectue des allers-retours après avoir débloqué des passages grâce à l'acquisition d'objets..), le jeu se libère des contraintes de son ainé pour s'offrir un vent de fraicheur. Les niveaux se voient élargit, ouverts, le jeu offre de la souplesse à sa linéarité. On attaque en mashant la même touche, le strider s'occupant de trancher à tout va. Plus tard, on débloque des évolutions permettant au strider d'avoir un pouvoir de feu, puis de glace. Tous les atouts sont utiles et vous servirons ( à l'exception des kunai qui ne sont la que pour la progression du jeu) dans plusieurs occasions retords. Le rythme est effrêné, et même si on peut avoir envie de chasser les collectibles (power up, up d'énergie, skin, croquis..) on est rarement freiner par le level design. Car s'il est ouvert, les niveaux sont petits et peu labyrinthique. L'ost est vraiment cool, mêlant des remix de l'époque et des riffs de guitars à l'image de la nervosité du jeu. Cependant, le jeu manque cruellement de personnalité et d'identité. Les niveaux sont certes parsemés d'items, mais sont génériques, peu intéressants à parcourir et peu jolie (pourtant le jeu reste agréable à l'oeil et 2-3 niveaux ressortent, comme Kazakh City). Les ennemis sont variés, mais génériques et il vous faudra apprécier l'univers robotique et industriel, car vous ne combattrez presque que ça (et des zombies). Les niveaux sont, comme tout bons jeu d'action plateforme, conclut par des combats de boss. Si quelqu'uns (Solo; le gorille du premier Strider, les dragons) sont cools et tactiques, nécessitant d'être précis. Les autres sont plutôt moches et manque d'intérêt. Tout comme la narration et l'histoire, brumeuse et kitsch, vous prendrez plaisir à défourailler à tout va, mais pas à parcourir le jeu pour éteindre les ambitions du méchant Meio, tant c'est assez ridicule et peu reluisant en termes d'immersions. Le gameplay est cool, le jeu est relativement court (2h pour une première run, 10h pour le platiné), le gameplay est classique et grisant, mais tout le reste manque d'impact et d'enjeux. Un petit jeu sympa, qui aurait gagné à offrir une petite aventure un poil plus ambitieuse que l'ambiance globale générique et impersonnel qu'il nous offre. Il fera l'affaire d'une petite journée, les intentions là et c'est louable.

review:
Changed my positive review to negative, I was gifted this game by a friend over 3 years ago. The game itself is fantastic and I was able to complete all achievements in time said 3 years ago and wrote a review in 2020. But why is the review negative now?

Guess what, ever since Crapcom took notice on the modding scene as 'cheating', they have recently hired a scuffed Russian company that's very unknown and started installing a bunch of their old games with Enigma Protection DRM, to prevent it from being modified. Oh and it's full of virus. You will have to play this on consoles or some other method really. I got this as a gift so I'm not too pissed.

Oh and this is one of the affected games so, don't even buy it for cheap. Crapcom has tarnished their name permanently. And funnily enough, December of 2023, they fixed the multi-core issue that if you had more than 4-cores, you couldn't play it.

Avoid it altogether.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086129776', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2221, 'last_played': 1626720281}
review:
การกลับมาของฮิริวหลังจากห่างหายไปนานถึง 15 ปี
มาครั้งนี้พร้อมดีไซน์ใหม่และการเปลี่ยนแปลงหลายอย่าง

• หากใครเคยเล่นภาคเก่าที่เป็น Platformer ลุยเป็นด่าน ขอให้ลืมมันไปซะ
เพราะภาคนี้มาเป็น Metroidvania ที่จะได้ลุยในเมืองคาซัค (Kazakh) แบบเต็ม ๆ
• ถึงแม้จะมีการแยกส่วนกันเหมือนเป็นด่าน แต่ทุกส่วนมีเส้นทางเชื่อมกันหมด นอกจากนี้บางสถานที่ยังแบ่งเลเยอร์เป็นส่วนหน้าส่วนหลังได้อีกด้วย
• แต่ถ้าใครกลัวว่า Metroidvania ในเกมนี้มันซับซ้อน ก็ไม่เชิงซะทีเดียว
ถ้าเป็นทางเท้าวิ่งปกติถือว่าจำทางได้ง่าย ไปแต่ละส่วนในเมืองได้สบาย แต่ถ้าหวังพึ่งเส้นทางลัดอย่างการใช้ Option-B (เสือ) หรือ Option-C (อินทรีย์) ก็ต้องหวังพึ่งความจำกันหน่อย

• ด้านกราฟฟิค อาจจะดูธรรมดาไปนิด และถ้าเป็นตอนนี้ในปี 2020 ก็คงเบ้ปากหน่อย ๆ ละสำหรับเกมที่มาจากค่ายใหญ่ (ถึงเป็นปี 2014 ที่เกมออกก็ดูธรรมดาอยู่ดี) 
• เพลงประกอบที่มาจากภาคเก่า ๆ แล้วนำมาทำเรียบเรียงใหม่นี่คือสุดแล้ว หลายคนที่เป็นแฟนเก่าซีรี่ย์นี้น่าจะชอบกัน (และอาจเป็นหนึ่งในส่วนที่ชอบที่สุดของเกมนี้ด้วย)
• งานศิลป์ออกแบบเกม ถ้าไม่นับกราฟฟิคที่พาดรอปหรือรู้สึกเหมือนกราฟฟิคพาไปไม่ถึง ก็นับว่าสวยงามมากจนรู้สึกแอบเสียดายดีไซน์ที่ออกแบบมาแต่กราฟฟิคพาไปไม่ถึง (ส่วนตัวชอบเขตเมืองเก่าและวิหารใต้ดินสุด) 

• ในส่วนของเกมเพลย์ ใครที่เล่น Easy อาจจะไม่รู้สึกรู้สาเท่าไหร่ แต่มันจะชัดเจนตอนเล่น Hard ที่ต้องขนวิธีการเลือกไซเฟอร์ (Cypher) คุไน (Kunai) หรือแม้แต่ Option ทั้ง 3 แบบมาประยุกต์ใช้ ความรู้สึกคล้ายวิธีเลือกใช้อาวุธพิเศษใน Rockman ยังไงยังงั้น แต่ถ้าถามว่าดีไซน์ออกมาดีไหม บอกตรง ๆ เลยว่าชอบมากและกำลังพอดี ไม่มากไปหรือน้อยไป (เอาตรง ๆ เลยว่าพึ่งพาความสามารถของไซเฟอร์แต่ละแบบมากกว่าพึ่งพาอาวุธพิเศษใน Rockman อีก)

• สเกลความยากของเกมนี้ ถ้าเล่นแบบไม่รู้ไม่มีอะไรในหัวเลย แล้วไปเล่น Hard ดับอนาถตามระเบียบ แต่ถ้าสามารถเรียนรู้หรือประยุกต์ใช้ไซเฟอร์และสกิล ต่อให้ยากแค่ไหนเกมก็จะเหมือนอยู่ในระดับที่คนทั่วไปรับได้อยู่ดี ไม่มีความรู้สึกว่าความยากแกว่งเกินไป

• ส่วนเรื่องความยาวของเกมนั้น บอกเลยว่าไม่ต่างจาก Rockman ยุคเก่าสักเท่าไหร่เลย ถ้าคุณทำ Speed Run ต่อให้ไม่คิดวางแผนล่วงหน้า เดินไปตามทาง เก็บอัพเกรดไปเรื่อย ๆ ก็สามารถจบเกมโดยใช้ Playtime แค่ 3 ชั่วโมงกว่าได้ต่อให้คุณเล่น Hard ก็ตาม (ถ้าวางแผนการวิ่งก็สามารถจบได้เร็วกว่านั้นอีก) ถ้าจะมีข้อเสียสักข้อก็เรื่องนี้แหละ

เพราะฉะนั้น สรุป
► ถ้าใครหา Metroidvania ที่ไม่หนักเกินไป อยากหาเกมเปิดสำหรับหัดเล่นแนวนี้ [เกมนี้เหมาะ]
► ถ้าใครเป็นแฟน Strider เล่นมาตั้งแต่ภาคแรก [เกมนี้เหมาะ]
► แต่ถ้าคุณ Hardcore Metroidvania จัด ๆ ละก็ ผ่านเกมนี้ก็ได้นะเพราะมันอาจจะไม่ตอบโจทย์คุณเหมือนเกมอื่น

[ข้อดี]
งานดีไซน์เกมทุกอย่างลงตัวหมด สำหรับผมจัดว่าชอบเลย และไม่หนักเกินไปด้วย

[ข้อเสีย...]
ว่าจะไม่พูดแล้วนะ... เพราะเราไม่ได้รู้สึกมีปัญหากับตัวเกม... (นอกจากเกมมันสั้นเหมือนภาคเก่าสมัยก่อน)
แต่มีปัญหากับบั๊คของเกมหนักมาก! โดยเฉพาะ Crash!
เป็นบั๊กเดียวที่เจอ และเหมือนมันจะสุ่มเกิดขึ้นแล้วแต่จุดหรือโอกาสทำให้หลุดจากเกม
เป็นอะไรที่อนาถใจมากที่สุดแล้ว เพราะเคยเล่น Easy ไปเมื่อหลายปีก่อน กลับมาอีกทีเล่น Hard เพื่อจะเก็บ Achievements ให้ครบ
ปรากฏว่า Crash! ในบริเวณเดิมหลายครั้งจนถึงขั้นเล่นต่อไม่ได้
ในบอร์ดของสตีมเองหลายคนก็หาสาเหตุอยู่แต่เหมือนจะไม่พบวิธีแก้ไขที่ใช้ได้จริงเลย
ถ้าจะหักคะแนนจริง ๆ ก็ต้องหักกันตรงนี้แหละ

[Score]
8/10 (กรณีที่ไม่มีปัญหาเรื่องบั๊ค)
แต่ถ้าคุณเจอบั๊คแบบผมละก็... 5/10 ก็พอ

อนึ่ง หากคุณเล่นแล้วไม่มีปัญหาเรื่องบั๊ค เราก็แนะนำให้ลองเล่นดู

author: {'steamid': '76561198389229511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1587340457}
review: Казалось бы, чего еще нужно в "метроидвании"? Обычно, примитивная графика и сюжет и огромные лабиринты в каких-нибудь подземельях. Здесь же красивая графика, с 3d модельками и задниками, и сюжет, который для галочки, вызывающий скуку, и не запоминающаяся музыка. В других играх типа "Hollow Knight" интересно играть.. ..но в Strider чего-то не хватает, а чего?  - Сюжета? Музыки? Может, нормальной боевой системы? Шмоток?. В игре можно использовать способности огня, льда, но половина способностей тут нужны больше для того, чтобы можно было попасть в недоступные места, а в боях их не хочется использовать. Тут можно переодеваться в костюмы, но напрашивается вопрос "ЗАЧЕМ!?", если костюм отличается лишь цветом и больше ни на что не влияет. Через два-три часа начинается скучно лупить по одному и тому же алгоритму. Последнюю половину игры я пробежал скрипя зубами. Вроде бы, разработчики старались нам выдать красивую картинку, описали историю о локациях, но увы все это уныло и скучно. Хотел вначале поставить хорошую оценку, но понял, что отрицательное перевешивает положительные стороны. Увы, не рекомендую тратить время на это.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188000433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1587357926}
review:
The movement is slick but lacks a sense of polish.  If you hold a direction you can grab walls or climb ceilings.  While usually fine it can cause moments of frustration, when you do that by accident.  

The boss fights are fairly lackluster, even without collecting all the upgrades the majority of bosses felt like button mash your way to victory.  And honestly the majority of the game you can either button mash your way through enemies or run by everyone.  

I can't critique the plot because I personally didn't care I just wanted a fun game to control, and the voice acting turned me away from the plot instantly.  

My general thoughts is that this game is incredibly shallow, quite boring and extremely easy on normal.  However I can see this being a fun game to run for speed runners, because the movement is slick.  If I had to give it a rating 6/10 may as well give it a chance if you can get it on sale and you're out of platformers.   

I'm also not sure how they measure time, the game says it took me 3 and a half hours but steam clocks me in around 5 and I didn't leave it running.

review:
약간 오래된 느낌이지만 스피디한 액션 게임.

review:
这个游戏有中文汉化补丁，补丁不影响解锁成就。
我比较偏爱这种类型，可以找到以前红白机的感觉。这款游戏比较慢热，流程也很长。它不像鬼泣那样有很多花俏的动作，整体而言就是砍砍砍，放技能，闪闪闪，砍砍砍。这个游戏让我爽的一点就是，他有很多boss，看攻略是18个，打完大多数boss之后会获得新的技能或者加强伤害，慢慢的你的攻击手段会变多，比如弹反，手里剑。总之就是慢热，越到后面越爽。

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198023055657', 'num_games_owned': 2842, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1587323161}
review:
I think this game is fine.  I remember enjoying it more when I played it back when it came out, but going back  and playing it now just feels...shallow, I think?  Not that this game does anything bad; the movement feels good, there are nooks and crannies to explore, you get powerups to unlock other areas.  I think it just feels very...samey.

I'd still recommend it though if you're a fan of metroidvania games.  It just might be an easier play than other ones that are currently available.  Good for turning your brain off to!

author: {'steamid': '76561198114131710', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1586486572}
review:
Fantastic borderline metroidvania. Game is fun, fast paced action and a fantastic new(ish) addition to the Strider series.

Controls are fantastic and game handles well.

The slight difficulty curve is mainly just "get gud". 

Game is worth the $15 on Steam and took me approximately 10 hours to go through the campaign (with collecting some extras).

Might as well be a hack n' slash with Hiryu's sword Cypher slicing practically as fast as you can mash the button (or key).

The mechanics are solid (like the hit meter) and the "options" are a fun way to add extra damage into the fray.

The game could've used a warp system like the Castlevania games (Dawn of Sorrow specifically) which a lack there of makes backtracking for extras/upgrades a pain in the ass. Also the ability to cancel your momentum out of the plasma catapult circles would be nice as it would've saved me another playthrough of the prison gauntlet.

Overall 8.5/10. Pick this up for a slightly short but fun and engaging experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339545040', 'num_games_owned': 8404, 'num_reviews': 480, 'playtime_forever': 1158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1158, 'last_played': 1586102791}
review: STRIDER™ / ストライダー飛竜® – неплохая платформерная метроидвания, пропитанная духом экшенов из 90-х годов, с незамысловатым сюжетом, словно сошедшим с кадров примитивных боевиков – есть наш герой, есть суперзлодей и его многочисленные прихвостни, на этом собсна всё. Читал, что это приставочный ремейк старой игры, о которой я никогда не слышал доселе. Геймплей был бы динамичным, если бы игра не начинала постоянно замедляться как будто в слоу-мо, и непонятно, то ли это фишка игры, то ли её недостаток, но скорее второе, а именно – кривой порт с приставок. Управление адское для клавиатуры, прошёл игру на ней, но никому не советую, кнопки не переназначить, вы реально не сможете полностью использовать весь потенциал героя на клавиатуре, лучше запастись геймпадом. Проходил на средней сложности – довольно легко, умирал очень редко, большинство боссов проходились с 1-го раза. Вывод: если вы ностальгируете по концептуально пожилым боевичкам прямиком из прошлого века, игра вам понравится. Отличная игра для одного прохождения, но возвращаться к ней не очень хочется.

author: {'steamid': '76561198427760435', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1585881643}
review:
Este juego me vino en un humble bundle y me sonaba mucho el personaje ya que era el tipico del pasado de los videojuegos, clasico de Capcom e invitado en varios juegos de peleas, (de tanto verle en varias partes se te queda). Le eche un vistazo por curiosidad y OJO, me lleve una gran sorpresa

Juego hack and slash en 2D muy vistoso, con estetica ninja y cibernetico, lleno de accion, agilidad, muy muy frenetico y con toque plataformero. Iremos desbloqueando habilidades, exploraremos para conseguir mejoras y atuendos, peleas con muchos bosses... y encima Strider es un ❤❤❤❤❤❤ boss

Su apartado visual y artistico es de lo mejor del juego, la historia como esta contada deja de desear ya que son las tipicas escenas con dialogos de x personaje hablando con x pero sin movimiento, y sin casi nada de interaccion, no nos revelan gran cosa, es una lastima porque me hubiese gustado saber mas del lore ya que este juego es un reinicio

Para terminar la dificultad no es muy complicada, pero si nos pillan y no somos lo suficientemente rapidos nos derrotaran bastante easy. A medida que pasa el juego y con la combinacion de habilidades, el progreso se hara muy satisfactorio para el jugador pero a su vez ira aumentando la dificultad de los enemigos apareciendo nuevos, o con modificaciones... etc

En resumen, mucha accion y puro gameplay, Strider es John Wick modo ninja

author: {'steamid': '76561198254688557', 'num_games_owned': 1512, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1585643281}
review:
Really cool game if you like platformer/hack and slash games. bosses were all pretty fun and unique. Difficulty jumps up near the end of the game (hated the grand ascension, pretty annoying part of the game.) 

I do wish there was something else to do after you finish the game like go back and collect all collectables but eh doesn't bother me too much.

Very nice art design in this game too, would like to see a sequel in future with improvements to the combat system and some more replay-ability.

overall I'd probably give it a 7.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045714657', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1585069685}
review:
Un buen juego de plataformas y Hack & Slash. Muy arcade lo demás lo dejan un poco de lado, lo que te quieren dar es un juego muy rápido y entretenido, el principio se puede hacer algo pesado incluso repetitivo, pero conforme avanza el juego y vas consiguiendo mejoras el juego se vuelve muy interesante y mola bastante hacer movimientos con nuestro Strider favorito con una jugabilidad baastante buena. Un buen remake de aquel juegazo de ps1, no tan impresionante pero si divertido. Tiene exploración, secretos, desbloqueables, modos de juego y un temazo de música. A un precio bajo es buena compra.
Los puntos negativos que le veo son: Los diseños tanto de enemigos como el mapa es un poco monótono, los bosses no son nada complicados y que al principio puede hacerse algo pesado, pero mola.
