author: {'steamid': '76561198027973295', 'num_games_owned': 1820, 'num_reviews': 1844, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1654985738}
review:
У меня есть хобби коллекционировать цифровые версии разных игр, до которых по разным причинам руки на момент выхода не дошли.

Я давно приглядывался к Strider, но так и не мог убедить себя купить первую по старшинству игру от Capcom, которая отсутствует в моей библиотеке. Спасибо Humble Bundle, что сделали выгодное предложение.

Strider до покупки казалась мне шаблонным платформером про ниндзя. В общем-то так оно и есть, но у игры достаточно бодрый темп, который она выдерживает с первого уровня. Так что если ищете, во что бы поиграть из старенького — почему нет.

Игру сделала Double Helix, которая также ответственна за Silent Hill: Homecoming и первый сезон Killer Instinct. С 2014 ребята стали частью Amazon Game Studios, где они делают приложения для Android.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029904609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 320, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1583206115}
review:
So, the game seems to run at whatever speed it thinks your hardware can handle. Play this on an old potato computer, and you'll be in perfectly controllable, slow-matrix-dodge-mode the whole time you're playing.

Oh, except for your attacks. Those you can spam out at inhuman speeds, trivializing bosses and really all difficulty.

Because I'm running this on a potato comp, I'm not getting the intended feel of the game---which is more as an action platformer than as a metroidvania, because all the running feels good and all the climbing feels terrible---but there aren't options I've been able to find that can downscale things to a level where the game runs at the correct speed.

Now, this is a decent indie game, and I think it would have flourished during the early days of xbox live indie games. It has nearly non-existant plot, and it's not difficult by any measure, but sometimes you just want to turn your brain off, and that's what that market is for.

As-is, played in unwanted slow-mo, it's tedious and vacant. I don't hate it (except for the basically nonfunctional wall-grabbing when you're jumping at the corner of an object, which a few platforming sections force you to do), but I can't recommend it over anything else in the genre.

I think on heavy sale, if you're *not* looking for a metroidvania, this is worth checking out. Otherwise, youtube some playthrough footage to make a decision before you decide to buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289119777', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1582534656}
review:
《出击飞龙HD》，卡普空经典老IP重制，保留系列传统爽快斩杀内核的同时，也整了一些向现代游戏靠拢的新活。新活整的不咋地，但还是很好玩，属实又爱又恨。总体感受是“一流的动作游戏，二流的游戏体验。”

一流的动作体验使游戏开篇体验美妙无比，你卡普空还是你卡普空。未来忍者从天而降，用高科技冷兵器无情斩杀反乌托邦的邪恶领袖，很俗，但是贼浪漫，还是90年代Arcade游戏内味儿。人物动作设计精准有力，衔接流畅无比，仿佛一朵盛开的杀戮机器，绽放在敌兵之中。

二流的游戏体验使我刚开始喷张的热血立马降了温，说实话通关后看到普通难度成就只有8%的人拿到我一点儿不奇怪，况且流程满打满算只有五小时。通关率如此之低的主要原因我觉得还是后期战斗体验过于单调，敌人数量不少但种类没几个，不同区域杂兵换个颜色加点血量接着干。加之普通难度下敌兵伤害很低，包括最终Boss在内，游戏所有的战斗硬扛着血都可以轻松应对，紧迫感=0。游戏中的回复道具还多到令人发指，想死一次都难，卡普空你是有多看不起我？！有着这么好的动作设计却没有好的对手来练练手，属实遗憾，购买的玩家可能大都是因为战斗重复弃的游（说不定困难难度下的战斗令人血脉喷张呢，但我可不想再打一遍了)。

战斗体验不行，地图探索也不太愉快（不过场景设计是真牛逼）。游戏险恶利用银河城开放地图的设计来解锁一切的方式尤其让我不爽。主角升级解锁没一点问题，但为什么要把原画设计、敌人介绍、故事背景、人物皮肤，甚至额外模式全都塞到地图的犄角旮旯来解锁？探了一大片图只拿到了张原画真的让人超级不爽啊！

我想说的槽点还有不少，但游戏优秀的地方是真优秀，至少冲着这业界首屈一指的动作手感也绝对值得一玩，总体上是个好游戏，适合找点乐子。

author: {'steamid': '76561198260626526', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1582472945}
review:
在HB买卡普空的包的时候里面的游戏之一。
是现在看来很罕见的横版2D动作游戏，剧情近乎于无，反正就是超牛逼的日本忍者飞龙一路过关斩将打败邪恶的城市统治者明王的故事。游戏打击很爽快，用手柄的话手感还不错。一开始会让人很愉快，但是在打了五六个BOSS以后我就觉得自己在受虐了，问题就在于里面的checkpoint都在奇奇怪怪的地方，很多时候BOSS战并没有checkpoint，要是不幸败在了BOSS手下，就只能先回到离BOSS有一段距离的checkpoint，然后一路打败很多小兵再回来，真的很烦。
升级也是让人头大，升级点很多都在很隐蔽的地方，可能你好不容易拿到一个升级，接着就败在小兵手下，然后奇怪的checkpoint会让你前面拿升级的努力付诸东流，所以我打了五六个BOSS之后，除了主剧情提供给我的升级之外，我居然只拿到了一个提升生命值的升级，这又导致我在后面的BOSS战中处于极端的劣势，但是这时候想回头去找升级几乎成了不可能的任务，因为这个游戏的传送点少得令人发指，而一路打过去实在是耗时耗力，所以一开始要是没注意升级的话后面简直就是令人头大的恶性循环。
读档存档都很慢，花掉的时间都快和3A大作差不多了，这是为什么？
鉴于这是慈善包里的东西，那就还行，要是让我在steam上买（哪怕是打折买），我可能都不会买。而且这已经是重置版本了，卡普空就不能改改这些地方吗？

author: {'steamid': '76561198035452267', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 381, 'playtime_forever': 1390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1582237987}
review:
Tener una vez strider en mi pantalla está siendo una delicia. Este juego tiene tanto del antiguo, pero actualizado y mejorado que sólo puedo pensar que fue un acierto que lo volvieran a sacar. El de 1989 fue una inspiración y un clásico  para grandes titulos de los noventa, la historia está llena de detalles y esa estética rusa manga le da algo que lo hace despuntar.

Jugando al juego de 2014 vuelvo a sentir la emoción y sensación unica del strider, pero los gráficos y en el entorno de 2.5 D le dan un aspecto absorbente. 

Si no habeis jugado al antiguo título no dejeis de jugar a este ya que no es algo diseñado para nostálgicos, sino un juegazo que todavia ahora en 2020 se mantiene fresco.

El juego tiene un montón de mejoras y coleccionables. Al principio tiene dos botones, pero vas progresando al igual que la dificultad del juego y esto hace un aprendizaje muy divertido e intuitivo del juego. Normalmente tendrás que usar la ultima mejora para derrotar a la siguiente gran amenaza.

El juego tiene más coleccionables como láminas, diseños gráficos preliminares y fichas de los enemigos que te permitirá rotar y observar el gráfico del enemigo tranquilamente.

En definitiva un titulo cargado de historia de los juegos de ordenador, muy divertido.

Sólo voy a dejar un consejo por aqui, desde el principio buscad las mejoras, no os limiteis a avanzar y ya está, pues ir mejorando el personaje será algo decisivo más adelante.

review: If you like Metroidvania games, you'll probably like Strider. Game is faithful to the original Strider while offering enough new material to make for a fun experience. The story is pretty shit and a half dozen random 7th graders could of written more interesting dialogue. Enemy variety is a bit lacking, but those things aside I would still recommend the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979795898', 'num_games_owned': 656, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1577235275}
review: A mediocre metrovania with very little enemy variety, which is especially disappointing with the "Strider" name attached. The original Strider 1 and 2 and Strider NES were all about constant, fluid movement (a'la Sonic), TONS of crazy enemies, and boss fights every few feet, whereas this game has terrible flow with lots of backtracking and crawling into nooks and crannies for fiddly collectibles, while fighting hundreds of identical robots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157201361', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 793, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1580547394}
review:
it was ok but there are a few things if you are a casual gamer going into this game

my story was that I first played it on medium and was just running through the game until I got stuck where a boss was too hard (basically could 1 shot me) was basically a bullet sponge and I was locked in the area so I couldn't go and find more powerups to progress so there went at least 2 hours down the drain

I tried from the beginning and did easy mode and actually looked for powerups and it made it doable basically the only difference I felt going from normal to easy is bosses have like 30% less hp other than that the 2 modes felt identical and bosses already took 100+ hits on easy so for most people easy will be the best mode

the good
movement
snappyness

bad
-going into a new area BLARES the door sound and im not talking x2 im talking about 10 times the normal volume enough that I kept taking off my headphones going into a new area and finally just went into the options and turned down the sfx volume to half to make it at least tolerable
- you can soft lock yourself where you are not powerful enough to progress but not be allowed to backtrack to become stronger

review: Reimagined classic, old, yet up to modern standards. Strider Hiryu is back and my God, he can slice. Movement is fluid, animation smooth, voice acting as cheesy as needed. Graphics is pretty nice, 3d models are okay, it's a metroidvania after all minus rpg elements. Hiryu can slash enemies in 8 directions, use kunais with their own targeting on right analog stick and generally be a badass with Options that often can change the tide of battle and  are throwback to previous games (pods, panther, eagle). Plenty collectibles to be found - art, new outfit colors and intel.  Difficulty may be an issue for some, but after beating the game on Hard and then going for Speed Demon achievement on Normal I have to say it's pretty well balanced on Normal, Hard can be frustrating so be warned. Recommended, it's aging pretty good :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198049750980', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1580288823}
review:
Strider's a solid Metroidvania. It's pretty action heavy, with a lot of focus on combat, platforming, and boss battles. Speaking of boss battles, there are a lot of them and they're pretty good. There were a couple that felt superfluous, but most of them felt unique and challenging. 
Strider has a lot of collectables and power ups, but most of the ones that make it easier to win (e.g. extra health and energy) are placed close to the critical path so you don't have to go far out of your way to find them. As far as difficulty goes, I felt like normal was just challenging enough without being too frustrating, but I've played a lot of platformers so YMMV. There are a few screens that frustrated me because of how they were designed, but overall the level design was good and I feel like picking on the one or two screens that bugged me would be too nit-picky, so I won't go into further detail. Overall, it's a good game, I recommend it if you're looking for a fast paced metroidvania.

review: Great game.  Has the feel and charm of the original.  Fast paced hack n slash action.  Paper thin plot and characters with almost no real story to speak of.  Just shoots you from one area to the next getting powerups and upgrades.  Rinse and repeat until finished.  Some of the bosses are really cool and well designed with fun fight mechanics.  Sadly some of them are recycled a few times throughout.  Still a solid play for being such a cheap game.  If you like fast paced aracdey hack n slashy futuristic ninja fun....this game is for you. 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197960545910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6952, 'last_played': 1697488473}
review:
So much like the original, and yet SO MUCH BETTER!

...and a pain in the ASS!!!

Imagine if the original got the reworking that Super Castlevania 4 got, but then crank the speed factor up to 11 and throw in a somewhat open-world mechanic and then keep the Nintendo Hard seasoning. That's this game, and it's a mixture that is both insanely satisfying as it is frustrating!  :)  Re-used sfx and remixed music done in the most cohesive way it could've been done, fast and frenetic gameplay that's both really responsive and really demanding of precision when playing at higher difficulties, and an open world that allows for both exploration and expansion of Strider's abilities...  WOW! I love this game! It's almost perfect!

Almost.

In regards to the Nintendo Hard aspect, the baddies will attack you off-screen and have all kinds of dick moves that'll either hit you like a crazy-good grenade toss worthy of a youtube clip, or they'll stunlock the crap out of you for a (near) fatal combo if you're playing at the hardest difficulty. HOWEVER, that's only in the higher difficulty settings; easier settings are way more forgiving. Some of the out-of-the-way areas have the simplest aspects, but get so annoying that you'll have one of two reactions: either it's so stupid-yet-so-hard you'll throw your controller into the wall (like the one where all you gotta do is double-jump but once you complete it getting back across will drive you insane), or you'll realize it's meant to be that way and relax into a sorta Zen state and just keep doing it until you nail it. But THAT'S THE THING! YOU'RE A NINJA DOING NINJA THINGS! It has that aspect of performing those jumps/moves that demand a razor edge precision that you NEED to pull it off perfectly or you're just not worthy of being called a Strider!

Boss battles are definitely challenging the first time but because the game doesn't punish you by sending you back half the level you can quickly and easily learn from your mistakes and try again almost immediately. Yeah, the first time you get wrecked you're pretty annoyed, but you can go right back less than a minute later with your newfound knowledge and say, 'Yeah, gonna tear you up this time!', and you typically can, until you get to the higher difficulty settings, then it humbles you a couple dozen more times until you either pass or rage quit and head to Gamestop to buy another controller. That's exactly how Strider should be.

But it's not without its flaws, tho maybe it's by design.

While the game is simple in graphical design, allowing it to run silky smooth even on the most mediocre of systems, it's also framerate locked, i.e. it's specifically designed to run at 60fps, which is both good AND bad. If you want the game to actually run SLOWER, make sure the vertical refresh is locked, then reduce your monitors refresh rate to 30hz and, BOOM, now the game runs at half speed! Want an insane speed challenge that pushes your very reflexive limits? Up the refresh rate if your monitor allows. I haven't seen this since the days when games were locked to the clock speed of a CPU in the old DOS days and pressing the 'turbo' button could slow it down in an instant, but hey, it is what it is. Either speed it up for a challenge, slow it down so you don't get wrecked, or lock it at 60fps. At least you have choice.

Downside: The game only allows for a single contiguous save, meaning you can't have multiple save files. Start a new game and you start a new save, and you play that save until it either ends or you start a new one. Kinda ruins having that one perfect save with 100% completion while having the other saves to challenge yourself, but that's likely to keep within the arcade ideal of 'You put in your quarters and you get this one play-thru, so you do what you do and either win or go home!' aspect. I get it, and yet I don't like it entirely. Still, that's the only complaint I have.

Oh, and one other. I played the original, and it had you killing actual people in it. This one replaces nearly all of them with robots in order to stay politically correct. Doesn't take away from the fun, but it takes away some of the brutality of the original. You're supposed to be a ninja wrecking the 80's era communist empire, so the slaughter of countless nameless, faceless nobodies should be par for the course! Oh well, it doesn't take away from the fun.

Unless you're they type who doesn't care for TRUE arcade-style super reflexive twitchy platformers with lots of action, then GET! THIS! GAME! It's an old school arcade remix dream come true! I can only pray that the old arcade game 720 gets the same treatment someday!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046807512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1578263837}
review:
Avevo giocato e finito l'originale su Mega Drive.
Questo remake è ottimo sotto molti punti di vista, offre un bel tasso di sfida.
La mappa è grande, purtroppo le varie zone si somigliano e il level design non brilla per varietà, anche perchè costringe a tornare sui propri passi: ci saranno tante porte chiuse che potremo attraversare solo dopo acquisito l'abilità dedicata.
Buone le boss-fight e il sistema di progressione del personaggio.

Aspetti positivi:
- Buon livello di sfida
- Sistema di combattimento ben riuscito
- Frenetico quanto basta

Aspetti negativi:
- Backtracking e poca varietà negli ambienti
- Alla lunga ripetitivo
- Colonna sonora poco ispirata
- Sistema dei checkpoint rivedibile

Alla fine ho perso interesse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169750906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 1738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1653662369}
review:
[h1]Easily the Greatest 90's Game Never Made[/h1]
This game is like a love letter to my childhood. It reminds of Shinobi III on the Sega Genesis, among many other sidescrolling games of the day. Then, it injects the kind of graphics we could scarcely dream of, and midgame saves/checkpoints so you actually have a chance of beating it. 

[b]Unapologetically For Gamers[/b]
No wasting time teaching little Timmy how to walk, attack and jump. Within seconds of starting the game, you're playing the actual game. Incredible today. Standard for the days where story and cutscenes would've taken up too much space on a cartridge.

The difficulty [b]is[/b] more forgiving-- you can take more than five hits without dying-- but I suspect things will ramp up later on. (And I wouldn't be surprised to learn there was a way manually make things more punishing.)

[b]Light on World-Building[/b]
Might be early to make this assessment, but dialogue and story are very limited. Most dialogue is background noise; bosses are introduced with little fanfare or explanation as to why you're fighting them; and even the architecture bares only a passing resemblance to real world concepts. 

Again, it is unapologetically a [b]game[/b]. The "reason you're fighting" is the same reason you bought the game. Because it's fun. And so far, Capcom seems to have done a damn fine job of accomplishing that goal.

review:
This game was awesome a few years ago. It has been tweaked and is frustrating as f&*k now.
Controls are super frustrating, with both keyboard and controller.
Don't like the key bindings, then you have to manually edit a file to change them around. How hard is it to add that capability to the interface? Luckily people on Steam have written a forum post on how to do that.
The game is super dark and it's often impossible to figure out what you can climb/walk on.
Getting hit mid-air results in you plummeting to the ground instead of just taking damage and continuing on your way. Usually it happens in sewers where you then slide down a water flow and hit spinning spikes. So rad.
Get Dead Cells instead of this. They did controlling right in that game. This just has too much stuff and too many key combinations for doing shit that mid battle you are basically fighting yourself trying to remember what button to hit to bring up one of the "options"

review:
This game really brought out the inner-kid in me. I had a huge grin on my face for most of the time while playing this game. It's simply very fun to play as an over-powered ninja :D

To be clear, I am not having fun just because the story says "Strider" is an over-powered ninja. Pretty much any game tells you what the character is supposed to be, but what's really difficult to achieve is to convince the player through GAMEPLAY. Whoever designed the player character should be given all the credit in the world. Pretty much everything about this character screams that he's a ninja.  First of all, you can attack as fast as you can mash the attack button. I don't think I've ever seen this before in other games that I've played, but after playing this game I wish other games did this as well. It was so much fun spamming the attack button in an enemy's face. You're a ninja. You SHOULD be able to cut enemies up really fast :D. Also, the 1st attack in a chain, Strider will yell "HA", which feels cool. Second of all, all of Strider's moves are very stylized. The way he attacks, runs, STANDS, etc. Everything he does just oozes style and it's so fun to watch him in action.

Ok, so you're playing as a cool as hell ninja. While that's nice, if the gameplay is not engaging, then you're quickly going to get bored. That ALMOST happened in the 1st hour or so. That's because you're mostly just running straight, jumping every so often, and spamming the attack button whenever you're close to an enemy. However, the game steadily introduces new mechanics to keep the gameplay from getting stale.

1st, the game introduces charge attacks (i.e. hold down the attack button for a stronger attack). These attacks are needed against enemies who have shields, because if you regularly attack an enemy with a shield, Strider will get stunned and you'll be open to taking damage. Simple but effective way to force the player to use a new mechanic.

2nd, the game introduces kunais. These effectively grant Strider a way to attack enemies at range. Because this gives you a whole new way to take down enemies (i.e. at range), you will always have to decide whether it's best to take down certain enemies by melee or ranged (ranged is not always the best option because it takes energy that recharges slowly). Furthermore, kunais effectively are a damage boost to melee since you can spam the attack button AND spam kunais right in an enemy's face :D

3rd, the game introduces "special plasma" attacks. These are basically special attributes you can apply to your attacks. There are 4 special attributes: reflect, fire, freeze, magnetic. The reflect plasma makes combat more tactical, because with the ability to reflect attacks, you have a new way to take down enemies (and is better than kunais since reflecting an attack doesn't cost energy). Fire plasma is very useful because it adds damage to your attacks. Freeze and magnetic plasma are……. Just sorta there :P. I didn't really use them much. They look cool though.

Finally, the game introduces "Option" attacks. Options are basically special moves, of which you have 3 of. You can use an eagle that damage enemies in an arc, a droid that gives you a shield and attacks enemies whenever you attack, and a panther that runs along the ground attacking any enemies in the way. Once you get these Options, that's when the "over-powered" of "over-powered ninja" starts kicking in. There's pretty much no cool down on these Options AND you can use them AT THE SAME TIME. So you can spam attack while throwing kunais while an eagle, droid, and panther wreck all of the enemies' shit :D :D :D. Options made the game a lot of fun. It was so satisfying to kill like 3-4 enemies with a well-timed eagle or panther attack, or killing a big enemy that took a minute to kill in the past to now be dead in like a few seconds.

Because the game keeps introducing new mechanics at a steady pace, the game never became boring. It just got more and more fun. There's not a lot of enemy variety (I think 6 enemies), but the enemies that are there are distinct from each other and require different approaches to take them down. The platforming is also fairly challenging. The progression system is simple, yet effective. You can get health ups, energy ups, kunai # increases, kunai range increases, and energy recharge ups. 

My main gripe with the game is with the bosses. Because you're an over-powered ninja, nothing is really a challenge for you. While I can accept that with regular enemies, I think at least bosses should provide some challenge. But they really didn't. I died at most once at some bosses. Their attacks are fairly easy to dodge and even when they do hit, they don't do much damage. While it's fun to be an over-powered ninja, SOME adversity would be nice.

The story is another missed opportunity. Everyone apart from Strider is a fucking cartoon. And not a fun cartoon. It also doesn't help that all of their voices are annoying and what they say is cheesy as hell. There are GENIUS lines such as "progress, technology, and SCIENCE are against you" and  "you cannot win. I have gun" -_-. There's no real story here. Everyone is just a cartoon villain that Strider has to take down. No character development, reason for why anything is happening, or whatever. The only reason there's a "story" is so that we know what the bosses look like ahead of time :P.

Overall, I had a real fun time with this game. Normally, a game this easy wouldn't entertain me this much. But this game just hit all the right buttons. I had a great time and would highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080662814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1572663536}
review:
This game is as bad as the original NES game, and yet another reason to never buy titles from Japanese publishers who are not Nintendo.  
The physics are awful, the play control is stuck in the 90s metroidvania model.  And like Bloodstained ritual of the night, playing this game is a real test of patience as the character movement is absolutely klunky.  Essentially this is an homage to those sort of Metroidvania games, but it shows how most of the Castlevania series games have aged rather poorly.  And rather than adapting to more modern play control standards, it just sits mired in antiquity.  
The bosses are a joke.  The enemies have little variety, and pathetic AI.  The dialog might as well be in a foreign language as it serves little purpose to propel the "story".
I get that this may be a cultural or aesthetic kitch thing.  I simply do not care.  This is not a good game.
 3 / 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973052125', 'num_games_owned': 4462, 'num_reviews': 643, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1572294470}
review:
There are only two problems I have with this game: 1) the story is pretty weak, and 2) the map is broken up into too many pieces.

The lack of a compelling story is made up for with compelling gameplay, but the breaking up of the map into completely isolated sections was annoying enough I didn't 100% the game ... and I kind of wanted to.  But not being able to see the map holistically to plan things out just made it too annoying.

For all that, I still had a lot of fun with the game, and it does a great job both of providing the metroidvania unlock thrills and of just a pretty engaging side-scrolling ninja game.  Definitely worth the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263316031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 462, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1571616688}
review:
Es un metroidvania pasable,  si te dejas llevar lo disfrutas, pero si te resistes e insistes en descubrirlo todo, es un tanto molesto.
El combate es tan simple que no puede fallar, conforme avanzas adquieres barridos, parrys, proyectiles, magias y un dash, ademas de 4 tipos de "elemento" para el sable, los proyectiles y el dash, que terminan dando una buena variedad.
El juego es facilito, creo que lo jugue en dificil pero al ser tan facil ya no estoy tan seguro, en cualquier caso recomiendo jugarlo en una dificultad elevada que si no es un paseo.
Los problemas mas grandes los encuentro en el backtracking, el mapa no esta mal es un tanto grande y enrevesado pero apenas y tiene atajos, no hay viajes rapidos y despues de algunos bosses hay caminos sin salida, se vuelve molesto tratar de ir por un objeto y darte cuenta que esta del otro lado de un callejon sin salida y tener que volver todo el camino de regreso.
De la historia no me enterado de nada y tampoco me importa.
En resumen: lo recomiendo, no es nada del otro mundo pero es disfrutable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014930293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1785, 'last_played': 1569970398}
review:
[h1] Great Ninja Platforming Action! [/h1]

Starting out I wasn't sure if I'd like this game. When I first started on Hard, I felt VERY weak (my fault I know, can't help myself, I play everything on Hard first if I don't think I'm going to run through it again). But this was alleviated fairly quickly. As I obtained upgrades and traversed the world, I enjoyed the game more and more. I will say that you have to hunt for the various collectibles and upgrades, and I had some VERY frustrating moments backtracking and getting lost. I found the map to work very well once I was in the right area, but found it to be difficult to figure out which way I needed to go to travel to an area after I had already passed it. But by the end of my Hard mode run, having obtained every collectible and upgrade, I felt plenty powerful and beating the final boss felt very rewarding! The game readily introduces new mechanics and enemy types and manages to give you a sense of freedom in what is really a linear experience. I'd recommend this to anyone who enjoys games that fall under the Metroidvania category or someone who likes challenging action games or platformers in general. 

P.S. Don't feel pressured to grab everything if you don't care about costumes, artwork, challenge modes, or even all of the upgrades! You can beat the game without them on the lower difficulties. I ended up running through the game again on Normal (to beat it under 4 hours) and had maybe 3/5 of the upgrades.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007088230', 'num_games_owned': 1036, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1601440343}
review:
Hey there! Do you like metroidvanias? Do you like the fluid feeling of running around as an unstoppable ninja, dodging and reflecting gunfire as you hack dystopian androids to shreds? Do you want to see an example of how to masterfully reboot a classic arcade franchise right? If you answered yes to any of this, then Strider is just the game for you!

Even if you've never played a Strider game before, don't worry, this is a reboot. it's essentially a re-imagining of the original arcade game as a metroidvania. You play as this high-tech ninja-like assassin who's mission is to fight through a Soviet-esque futuristic dystopian city and assassinate the mysterious tyrant known only as The Grandmaster. Along the way, you fight his various minions and machines that are sent your way.

The mechanics are all well designs and each of your the powers you get feel as fun to use as they are useful. Enemies are introduced in a way so that you learn the game's mechanics and learn how to take down enemies with the tools at your disposal. Don't think the path to victory will be won thru spamming your standard sword, because you will need to use your charge attack to break thru defenses, your options to hit far away enemies, your reflecting plasma to throw enemy shots back at em, and your myriad mobility techniques to dodge your foes' attacks. Overall, combat feels fluid and the controls feel evolved from past games.

My only complaint is that the music doesn't feel nearly as memorable as what was in Strider 1 and Strider 2 and the character animations in cutscenes feel stiff, but outside that, this is a beautiful metroidvania and an excellent reboot of a capcom property. I hope one day Capcom could make a sequel, but then again, the name "Strider 2" has been taken twice by now, they'd have to come up with a new name, lol

review: As many have stated, this is great metroid-vania side-scrolling action!  Really enjoy getting my ninja-fix with Strider as well, the bosses are pretty tough but not impossible, save maybe the last one perhaps!  The attention to detail is awesome, the camera follow Hiryu well and the pseudo 2/3d engine is beautiful to look at as it is to play in, even in 2019.  Give Hiryu a run as the original Strider badass, you'll spend hours trying to get all the extra stuff and revisiting levels to do so, lots of replay value.  GET IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064426221', 'num_games_owned': 869, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2074, 'last_played': 1566597459}
review:
Slick, well put together metroidvania with a play feel that tends more like a more linear action platformer. Difficulty can veer a bit too much on the easy side, but still enough of a challenge to be satisfying.

Context on when I made the review: currently I'm at ~30 hours, almost finished the game on hard. I restarted from a previous playthrough where I had also almost beaten the game, then just put it down. I'm trying to 100% it & I'm slow, so bear in mind my hours spent are probably inflated.

Production quality: top notch, graphics are gorgeous, soundtrack is kicken, runs like a dream. I have noticed a few issues on my recent playthrough with clipping bugs (eg. hit an enemy wrong, got stuck in a ceiling), but we're talking something on the order of once every 5 hours or so.

How Metroidvania is it?: It keeps to the basic formula of gated doors, and platforms out of reach until you get various enhancer abilities. Game progression is highly linear, but cleverly hidden with occasional backtracking, to roughly the same degree as Super Metroid. In terms of sheer amounts of stuff to find & hunt down, it's actually pretty good, with a 100+. That includes the actual progression abilities, upgrades to health/energy, large heal pickups, and unlockable concept art, story lore, costumes, and mini-game modes. Excepting the large heal pickups, they nicely avoid the trap some other metroidvanias get into where most pickups just give you in-game money. Basically very by-the-numbers implementation of the formula, no bait-&-switch by people who think the genre name is whatever the fuck they want it to be. 

Challenge: I jumped right in on Hard, haven't had too much of a problem, which might indicate it is on the easy side. Game definitely does tend to spike in difficulty on certain bosses and for certain sections. Overall I would call it satisfying but not ultra-hard bragging rights worthy.

Length: Core game is a bit on the short & sweet side, like the linearity comparisons to Super Metroid are apt. Of note, some of the unlockables are for either Beacon Run & Survival mini-games you play directly from the main menu, which can be seen as a supplement to the main game.

Negative stuff:
Enemy variety is the big weak point, they could have definitely improved in this area. A few core types that they then provide variations on. One note I want to make here... while the game does indeed use color coded enemies, the corresponding weapons actually have different enough characteristics that switching up does have some tactical implications. Fire cypher does the best damage, so that's my main, but I'm sacrificing the defensive benefit of the reflect cypher and the range of the magnet cypher. Magnet cypher is a long range weapon, but unlike the other 3 weapons it's hit rate is capped.The end result is you have to do some tactical thinking about what enemy to take out in what order, and switching fluidly to the right weapon for the job, which is a good thing. Basically the color coding isn't the problem here so much as it is there are not enough core enemy types with color coded variations.

Other negative thing that stood out to me were the large health canister collectibles, they're just very boring and don't even really give that much benefit. Basically a one-time heal, that doesn't even really heal that much. Very disappointing, in particular when juxtaposed with the other types of collectibles.

Other things of note:
The game has some deliberately tricky platforming sections, and this is a focus of the experience. Mileage varies of course whether you think that is a good or bad thing.

I absolutely do not agree with some of the other reviews saying there was not enough variety between areas. Each area is very distinct, with a consistent theme and distinct game play challenges. Each area is set in a future-marxist-hell-city, so obviously there is some similarities in style, but the claim they lack variety is influenced more by those reviewers not liking the game in general vs. being factual. It's kind of like bitching that Metroid levels are all a bunch of cave like corridors, or Symphony of the Night levels are all in a castle TBH.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029910586', 'num_games_owned': 1084, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1563248875}
review:
[h1]Брать стоит не больше чем за 2$ [/h1] 
 Данная игра является прямым ремейком Strider (Arcade) 1989г от Capcom. Игра выходила на куче платформах вплоть до NES и SEGA genesis. Причем на Genesis она получила награду «Видеоигра 1990 года » и «Лучшая графика в видеоигре» и даже была включена в книгу 
«1001 видеоигры, в которые вы должны сыграть, прежде чем умереть». 

Оценить эту "потрясающую" графику вы можете по видео.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dYfs6_CeQzA
 Надо отдать должное, геймплей для 90 года и правда очень крутой. Зато теперь ясно откуда они брали такую ужасную камеру.

 К сожалению поиграть в оригинал мне не удалось.

[h1]  Я даже не знаю рекомендовать ли ее или нет. Она и хороша и плоха одинаково. Но как аркада и тем более метроидвания, она очень слабовата. [/h1] 

Зато теперь ясно почему игра отдает такой халтурой. Это ремейк первой части и рассчитана она на фанатов.
Strider может предложить только неплохой и динамичный геймплей. 
Но в целом игре совершенно нечем удивить. Однообразный геймплей и только 2 нормальных босса. Остальные повторяются раз 5.

 [b] Сценарий[/b] тут ужасен. Анимешный бред. Причем не тот как обычно, а что-то запредельно тупое. Я даже не пытался вникнуть, тут явно никакого смысла нет. Видимо чтоб что-то понять, необходимо читать Мангу "Strider Hiryu".

- Графика вроде бы неплохая, но и ничего особенного. Больше похоже на черновик из 3D балванок.

В игре есть 4 вида энергии и видимо они рассчитывали, что игрок должен переключаться на ходу. Но во первых переключение срабатывает очень , очень хреново. А во вторых это совершенно неудобно делать на геймпаде.

 
[h1]Лично для меня, игру убил  последний уровень[/h1]
Я мирился с однообразием, тупым управлением и скукой.
Когда ты понимаешь, что уровень или босса не пройти, оказывается что эти идиоты не сделали кнопку загрузки чекпоинта. Тут бывает что босс в самом начале тебе сносит 80% жизней и становиться бессмысленно продолжать бой.
Но в конце игры ты понимаешь насколько плохо сделана механика. 
 Если вся игра проходится очень легко, то в конце тебя тупо спамят противниками ,а потом сталкивают с ужасно тяжелым боссом. 
 На тебя могут лететь несколько ракет, пуль и самонаводящихся патронов, а доджа они не предусмотрели. Ладно доджа нет, но эти идиоты сделали кнокбек от ударов. На тебя летит несколько ракет и если попадет одна, пока ты обездвижен в тебя попадут и пули и ракеты и ногами запинают и в печень бабочкой пыранут.
В общем поиграть прикольно, но видно что разработчики не сильно старались.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201192295', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1562352455}
review:
[h1]Cool[/h1]

- Yeni bir ırk yaratmak isteyen bir manyağın işini bitirmek üzere bölgeye iniş yapıyoruz. Gerisi ""ciuv ciuv ciuv"

-  Oyunun grafikleri göründüğünden daha iyi, müzikleri aksiyona uygun ve sesleri harika. Özellikle kılıcın özel yeteneği dolduğu zaman ki çıkan ses vuruş hissini coşturuyor.

- Geniş bir haritası ve içinde birçok toplanabilir eşya var. Bunlardan bazıları bizi geliştirirken bazıları da tasarım resimleri, kostüm, challenge haritaları gibi şeyleri açıyor. Toplanabilirleri hep sevmişimdir ama kocaman haritada yerleri belli olmayan itemleri bulmak çok uğraştırıcı. Oyunun eksi yönlerinden biri.

- Fast travelın olmaması ayrı bir sıkıntı. Belli noktaları atlayabildiğiniz yerler var ama çok az ve uzak yerlerde. Haritalar arası seyahat işkence olabiliyor. Neyse ki görevleri takip ederseniz haritanın çoğu bölümünü açıyorsunuz.

- Çeşitli düşman tipleri ve onların farklı varyasyonları var. Özellikle kalkanlı düşmanlar gerçekten baş belası çünkü renk renk yapmışlar. 4 farklı gücümüz var. Kırmızı-Saldırıları yansıtan, Mavi-buz, Sarı-patlama, Mor-Manyetik. Kalkanları kırmak, kapıları geçmek, bossların bazı saldırılarını engellemek için bunların arasında geçiş yapmak gerekiyor.

- Dövüş sistemi oldukça zevkli. Karşınıza çok fazla düşman gelse de kılıcınızla parçalayarak gidebiliyorsunuz. Çeşit çeşit platformlar ve mekanikte ki boss dövüşleri de güzel. Oyun zorluğu olarak başta normal seviyede ama son bölümde ortalık karışabilir.

- Strider Hiryu, bir elinde kancası bir elinde kılıcı ve kunaileri olan oldukça havalı bir ninja. Hareketleri ve dövüş stili de göz dolduruyor. Doğru ellerde tam bir ölüm makinesi. Oynarken sıkılacağınızı sanmıyorum. Sonuç olarak tavsiye edeceğim güzel bir metroidvania oyunu. İyi eğlenceler dilerim.

review:
Il primo strider uscì in sala giochi nel 1989,capcom riuscì a partorire un capolavoro di grafica,level design e gameplay.
Il nuovo capitolo risulta un po' più anonimo dell'originale,ma regge bene la prova del tempo sotto tutti i punti di vista.
Ad oggi può risultare un po' ripetitivo e le location un po' troppo simili una dall'altra,ma rimane sempre un grande classico nonostante  i suoi difetti!

Достойное возвращение, хоть и не без огрехов. Жаль что страйдера Хиея не вернули как босса - было бы классно снова сразиться с этим ренегатом...

author: {'steamid': '76561198025812458', 'num_games_owned': 1977, 'num_reviews': 445, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1561366772}
review:
I'd been meaning to play Strider since its release in 2014. I'm glad I finally got around to it. Strider is a great game. 

Strider is a game designed to emulate what made classic action/metroidvania games so good. And I think it succeeds in most aspects. The gameplay is great. Platforming and combat are fun. It feels good to play because of the tight controls and variety of mechanics that you're given. I really enjoyed the majority of the boss fights. Some were a bit too easy but a fair few of them were genuinely challenging and well designed, at least on normal difficulty.

Exploring in Strider is fun but I will say that a lot of the areas are fairly underwhelming and lacklustre. Enemy types are also fairly repetitive but I felt like they did enough with them to keep that interesting at least. Unfortunately the areas not being that interesting made backtracking and finding all the upgrades and secrets kind of unappealing to me. So if you're looking for a noteworthy metroidvania, Strider may not be the game for you. However on all other fronts, I think Strider is a great action platformer and a refreshing reboot reminiscent of classic titles. 

Definitely worth picking up on sale if you don't have it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044908259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1560756041}
review:
As someone who owned the genesis original {terrible box art and all) I was surprised by how good this reboot was. I have been putting off playing it (2019 for a 2014 game) cause I heard it was a metroidvania . 
I was excited at first. One my first games as a kid, on my first console, was getting a new game. Considering how relatively unknown Strider is; but I sighed when I heard it was metroidvania in a market saturated with them. Ori, Dust, Guacamelee, Axiom verge ect. I  didn't think Strider a side scrolling action platformer would need the additions of upgrades and branching paths.
Thankfully they did make it work all while reinvigorating a lot of what made 16 bit strider (never played the ps1 sequel) awesome. I especially love how the type: a,b, and c drones were remade especially b who is only usable 3 times in the original. Boss and enemy redesigns are good world and level designs are good. Although I was a little disappointed there was no jungle area with dinosaurs or ice mountain with wolves like the original. There was also no updated fight for the one dragon boss from the original. These complaints don't hinder the game  in general I know why these elements weren't included; just a fanboy picking at the tiniest of nits. 
Gameplay wise everything clicks  Double Helix games should be commended for getting Striders movement down pat. I jumped right in and it was like slipping on an old glove; Strider still handles exactly like I remember, From sword swings to jumping and climbing everything felt so familiar. Impressive considering I was playing a new game with a new controller.  If I have to be critical the only controls I would change is instead of the the left button or LB ( I used an xbox one controller) for accessing the the bot upgrade menu I would have made it the left trigger it just didn't feel right.
I had a blast playing this. It brought back so many memories for me and as a fan I cannot recommend it enough. Its a reboot that done right keeping what made the original great while bringing a lot of new content that compliments and improves the game. If you are a fan of: metroidvanias, platformers, and ninjas this is a game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996616949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1558996907}
review:
[i]nope![/i]

Wow did this one get boring and tedious fast!
The original is pretty fun and the often forgotten Playstation sequel is quite underrated, but outside of the Marvel vs. Capcom series Strider Hiryu hasn't been the most visible videogame hero, which is a shame. So at last we finally get the glorious return of this 16bit icon!

Or rather not. The moves and basic gameplay are nicely appropriated but everything from the lackluster visuals, the completely unnoticeable music, to the unimaginative level design lacks flair and creativity. There are games I don't like but I can see someone's vision in there, someone's ideas, even if it's just in the set dressing. Here? I don't get anything out of this on any level. If you have never played the original there's nothing in here to remind you of its qualities. 
Add to that the constant technical issues and saddening framerate I've encountered in my brief self-flagellation session.

This game is not even terrible, it's just "game". I'm not going to waste any adjectives or more time on it.

review:
Strider un juego de una saga clásica con el toque metroidvania que poco que te guste este genero deberías darle una oportunidad.

Pros

*Mantiene la esencia de la entrega original
*Revive el género, mediante un gran arcade metroidvania
*El apartado técnico es bueno sin grandes alardes muy buena dirección de arte
*Muchos guiños para los fanáticos de la primera entrega

Contras
*Historia muy poco relevante que prácticamente pasaremos por alto
*Si eres veterano de los arcades, puede que no se te haga tan difícil, con excepción de los jefes que siempre son un reto

review:
Looks and plays like Shadow Complex with a sword instead of a gun.

The visual are nice but feels like there is zero skill required to play. Just spam the attack button to win.

Would of been good if it had some kind of combo mechanic to chain attacks.

Not entirely sure why this is so highly rated. One of the easiest hack'n'slash side scrollers I've played in my entire life, and I grew up in the 80's with arcade games designed to eat my coins, and honestly they were more fun.

I got this in a bundle ages ago. So no loss, but yeah for the $22.95aud it currently is I'd have been disappointed.
Take my advice, get Shadow Complex instead. It's just so much better in every way.
This game honestly feels like a mod for that game and takes more than flash visuals and nostalgia feels to grab me.

Heck I think I'd rather play the original Strider.

review:
横版闯关类好游戏，不要错过哦~特别是喜欢动作游戏和曾经在黑白电视机上躲着大人打游戏的小伙伴们。

画面精致，剧情简单。武器四种附魔，反弹、冰冻、火焰、魔法（远程）跟鬼泣但丁的一样的设定（指键位和切换方式）。后期血量上去了扛得住攻击，所以即使手残也能玩的开心，不是那么地硬核。

缺点就是地图挺大却没有传送，还有没中文，我虽然通关了，但总感觉还错过了什么内容，貌似有些技能也没有用到。

review:
This game is so dope. The mechanics and items are a lot of fun, making exploring a bit more entertaining. The look and feel of Strider is fantastic! If you love Castlevania or Metroid, this game is a solid buy, especially while it's on sale.

I'd recommend the Hard difficulty for experienced players of Metroidvanias, though! I beat it on Normal in under ten hours and had found all the upgrades. I'm replaying it on the highest difficulty now, trying to find the little things, and in general enjoying another play through as the coolest ninja ever.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198021422660', 'num_games_owned': 3620, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1587554509}
review:
[h1] Стандартный метроид экшен платформер с постоянным респауном второстепенных врагов и отсутствием русского перевода на фоне русских табличек в казах-сити [/h1]

Воистину голова не знает, что делает правая рука... При переведённых надписях неперведённая игра выглядит просто смешно. Да и сама игра не то, чтобы затягивает. Даже метроид-игра по бетмену поинтереснее, которую почему-то почти все занизили... Наверное Логвинова посмотрели.

Притом респаун здесь реально жёсткий... при возвращении на пройденные локации нужно опять расстреливать тех же врагов в тех же позициях. Уйдёшь за экран и опять все враги на своих местах ходят как ни в чем не бывало. 

Сама же игра напоминает движком A.R.E.S. Там тоже был похожий респаун и нудноватый игровой процесс. Тоже можно было прокачивать оружие и мочить боссов. Даже по графике игры примерно схожи...

author: {'steamid': '76561197967911536', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1556363856}
review:
Eigentlich ein schönes Spiel; es sind nur die folgenden Dinge missraten:

- Steuerung ist teilweise "flutschig", man kann nur den Analogstick benutzen, obwohl es ein 2D-Spiel ist
- Gegnergestaltung, -varianz und -vorkommen. IMMER die gleichen Roboter, die ALLE schießen können, obwohl man selbst Brotmesser dabei hat
- Level- und Artdesign ist hässlich, generisch, unübersichtlich, unerotisch und langweilig
- Story ist völliger Bullshit und man wird - während man von Unmengen der gleichen Gegner bombardiert wird - ständig noch In-Game zugelabert mit Textboxen, die den halben Bildschirm bedecken
- Musik und Sound sind ÄTZEND
- Grafik ist schlecht. Einfach nur schlecht.

Und: Es macht einfach keinen Spaß.
Eines der schlechtesten Metroidvanias, das ich je gesehen habe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067359292', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1553024976}
review:
Great metroidvania game with a focus on speed. Basically once you know the game (when you already explored it at your pace once) there is no real reward in killing enemies that are not needed in order to advance, which gives this feeling of speedy exploration. I only needed to play it once on normal to then later do a nice speed run of it in hardcore mode (once I learned how to quickly dispatch each boss and each problematic enemy type).

Its very satisfying and its focus is to be quick and action packed, though quite easy to complete compared to other titles of the same genre. If you haven't tried it I very much recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336608168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 1491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1250, 'last_played': 1624402377}
review:
En el episodio de hoy de Manqueando... "Strider"

Aun recuerdo una MicroMania en la que mencionaban una recreativa de aspecto increible, y me preguntaba si alguna vez llegaria a verla. Tiempo despues, un amigo me llamó y me dijo que la habia visto en un bar. Y allá que nos fuimos, como siempre, en busca de un nuevo vicio. Dicha recreativa era Strider, y desde ese entonces, ha sido uno de mis arcades favoritos.

Una pila de años despues, aparece este que nos ocupa, que conserva toda la movilidad genial que ya tenia el original, y la lleva aun más allá. ¿Y que ocurre cuando uno de mis arcades favoritos se convierte en un metroid? Pues que si la cosa está bien hecha (como es el caso), llevas una franquicia (que estaba muerta) a un genero que me encanta. Ya lo jugué en Ps3 (con su correspondiente platino) y ahora lo he vuelto a tocar.

Pero como todo tiene sus fallitos, y aunque no són muchos, ahi van:

-Poca variedad en los escenarios. Este es el aspecto más flojo sin duda (para mi, al menos). La mayoria se parecen demasiado entre sí. Si, són diferentes, pero al final no te queda esa sensacion de otros metroids de saber donde estás, porque no sé si este era el laboratorio o los cuarteles.

-La navegación por el mapa. Hay puntos de viaje rápido (o algo parecido), pero están muy mal repartidos (o eso me ha parecido), y no sabes a donde te llevarán. De hecho, más que viaje rápido (el típico que te deja elegir destino), es un atajo fijo a otras zonas, y como no sabes a donde van... lo mismo te das una pateada para nada.

Al margen de esto... el control es excelente, el juego es rápido, la música está directamente sacada del arcade en algunos momentos... y nos puede durar unas 8/10 horas, dependiendo de lo concienzudo que seas. Aunque si vas directo al grano se puede hacer en menos de 4.

Por no alargar más, le casco un 8'5 y desde luego, lo recomiendo. No es el mejor del genero, ni el más original (ni falta le hace), pero es una muy buena opción, especialmente si te gusta el genero y como a mí, te encantó el arcade.

Y en el próximo Manqueando... "Steamworld Dig 2" (cava, cava, cava!!!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995919019', 'num_games_owned': 1542, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1551454079}
review:
Recent installment in Strider series is rather a metroidvania than simple platformer. And it's a damn good one. Level design is nice, varying from quazi-Soviet Kazakh city to military bases and distopian mad scientist lab. Bosses are well designed and require some effort, at least on normal difficulty, though final boss could be a bit more harder. Music is nice and adds 
 a lot to the atmosphere(probably it's only me, but I've heard some homage to NES Strider). Graphics is cute, but you have to take your time to adjust to it and not miss Hiryu during fights.Story is also a tribute to earlier games to the series, with couple of really nice touches. 

Overall it's a really nice metroidvania, which take about 6 hours to simply complete on normal, and much more if you aim for 100% completion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198814177588', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1268, 'last_played': 1551262628}
review:
九几年一系列老IP的重置品HD，近期所购慈善包里感觉最超值的一款游戏，延续着卡普空动作天王的美誉。剧情世界观颇有合金装备崛起的风范（日厂的口味），讲述猪脚潜入根据地依次打倒冥王的手下拯救银河系的故事。操作很是流畅爽快，所需键位较少，技能释放随意，ACT苦手也可轻松应对（BOSS很多，喜爱BOSS战玩家的福利）。全收集成就较为麻烦，物品分散各地，多次跑图会产生视觉疲劳，初期属性低时难度较高，偶有卡位BUG，不过都不影响酣畅淋漓的动作体验。最终BOSS看到总会联想到贝姐，总之能从中看到各大经典动作IP的缩影。
全成就需要二周目完成，一周目选择最高难度加全收集，二周目选择简单，最后总结时间时惊讶看到我竟然花了2个钟多点完成了速通成就，应该得意于一周目的历练了....
另外看惯了猪脚感觉挺酷的.....好评推荐

author: {'steamid': '76561198009664950', 'num_games_owned': 2860, 'num_reviews': 344, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1550469868}
review: The movement in this game is as engaging as it always was, even more so with the addition of new movement upgrades over the course, and the transition from the classic arcade style to the Metroidvania arrangement is surprisingly natural. My only issue is that combat often feels more awkward than it needs to, and more often than I remembered. Controlling Hiryu is never difficult in exploration, but in combat if he's not being stunlocked he's sticking to some surface you didn't want him to. I wouldn't consider this a hard game, but I can't think of a single boss I actually enjoyed. Overall, it's an interesting interpretation of an old series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176675135', 'num_games_owned': 3320, 'num_reviews': 2824, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1470925229}
review:
[h1]向日葵游戏评分：7分（1-10）[/h1]
这是一款硬核横版动作游戏，作为卡普空的经典IP曾经风靡多个平台，本次的回归依旧保持了系列的优秀手感和硬核风格。主角虽为忍者，却没有花哨的无敌技，因此操作颇有难度。
游戏的剧情虽然不痛不痒，画面和音乐也一般，但关卡丰富，收集元素多，十分耐玩。最后不得不提游戏的攻击方式十分特殊：攻击没有冷却时间，这就意味着如果你有一个带连发功能的手柄，BOSS将会好打的多。

author: {'steamid': '76561198302591233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1549812415}
review:
NOPE. NOPE. NOPE.

Played on Easy, with controller. Breached through the game. You jump over regular enemies, keep spamming the attack button and the bosses... well, at least on Easy there's no strategy required. You just mash buttons. Doesn't matter, most bosses are horribly designed anyway. So, 4 (!!) hours later, I reached the final elevator.

Only to die like 10 times to BULLSHIT ice rockets. F C K this SHIT, I'm out.

UPDATE:

Came back a day later, salt removed from my system. Turns out I got stuck right before the final boss. Somehow managed to beat the part where I died over and over again... on my first attempt. I don't get it.

On to the final boss. Died only once to each boss form ("this isn't even my final form"-cliche), beat the game on Easy with a final ingame time of 3 hrs, 27 minutes and 42% completion rate. So you get what, maybe 5-6 hours of content out of this game?

Proof: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1651468097

I have no idea how anyone can play this game for more than 10 hours.

- The controls are HORRENDOUS. Your ninja dude just sticks to whatever walls he feels like. Good luck on the anti-gravity and upside-down rooms. These have no place in this game. They only fuck up the controls even more.

- Instead of looking at the game, I often completely navigated via the map. Just follow the arrow, jump over everything, dash straight through everything. You can literally play huge parts of this game by mostly looking at the map in the top right corner. 10/10 game design.

- The music is forgettable, the graphics are straight outta 2008.

- There is no power up in the game that feels like it actually means progress. All 4 power ups are just glorified keys to open some fancy new doors you couldn't open before. I used the fire power up for most of my playthrough. Only switched to Ice or Magnet when I absolutely had to. The red plasma... well, what does it exactly do? Reflect bullets? Awesome. NEXT.

- 2 of the 4 power ups are worthless. The red plasma does nothing that matters what the yellow (fire) can't do, the purple one (magnet) is completely useless in combat because it replaces your sword with some sort of projectile... that needs to come back to you before you can slash again. So you often press the attack button and nothing happens. Great. So, yeah, only ice and fire are worth a damn, and ice often just freezes enemies in place, so you have to jump over them instead of just rushing & slashing through them.

- Useless secrets. Concept Art? "Enemy intel"? Who needs that crap? Give me stuff that MATTERS.

- Uninteresting enemies. Most enemies are just color-swapped enemies you met before. Even the bosses get recycled. Why? There are 3 ninja ladies... you first fight #1, then you #1 and #2 at the same time, and then you fight #1, #2 and #3 at the same time. Yeah, really interesting. Only girl #4 was actually a threat.

- The story... well... what story? There is no story. You go here, go there, meet some dudes, talk 2 sentences with each dude and that's it. The main evil guy that appears all the time... well, you kill him like 60% through the story. Wtf? But wait, there's more. There's a bigger baddie! So the real evil main guy shows himself for the first time... only right before the end. Why? And he's not even interesting. It's just some generic undead wizard guy or something. The whole story can be summed up by "good Ninja fights evil wizard". Sure. Never seen that before. Totally unique. Good job.

- My thumb hurts from spamming the attack button.

This game is probably good if you're dedicated enough to speedrun this SHIT, but as a casual gamer... stay away. There's just nothing in this game that's new or innovative in any way. It's a generic game with a generic hero, generic enemies and generic power ups.

PS: I also checked speedrun.com for this game now - they run the game on Easy because Normal & Hard for the most part only make bosses tankier. So if even those few people that have put the most hours into this game are not interested in higher difficulties, I certainly won't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044218218', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1549742714}
review: Jogo leve, porém bonito. Mais um jogo no estilo Metroidvania que vale a compra. O melhor de tudo em Strider com certeza é a precisão dos controles. O personagem reage incrivelmente rápido a todos os seus comandos. É muito gostoso e divertido fatiar os inimigos. Conforme você vai avançando no jogo, vai ganhando novas habilidades e poderes, para assim conseguir acessar áreas que não eram possíveis sem os upgrades. Terminei o jogo em pouco menos de 4 horas, mas fiz somente 40%. Pra quem gosta de explorar, tem muito o que fazer. A história não é muito interessante, e o final (já deixo avisado) é muito ruim. Mas mesmo assim recomendo pela ótima jogabilidade e diversão que o jogo proporciona.

review:
This game is a horrible slow muddy trend chasing metroid wanna be pile of trash. strider is slow in his movements. the controls feel like your moving through playdoh. The music is lame and uninspired. what little music there is, is monotonous and boring. the exploration instead of being fun is drab and boring basically process of elemination. There's no real logic to stages just big stupid area's randomly slapped togeather. 

If you remember the old school Strider from the Arcades or even the playstation remake by capcom do yourself a favor and let it remain a classic in your memories. This pile of trash is not worth any of your time. If this game was made in 2019 instead of 2014 you can darn well believe the developers would have made it a battle royal fortnite ripoff because this is some of the worst trash I've played in a while. Verdict. That's a bloody uninstall.

Techinally it's playable. that's all I have to say positively about this hot garbage. You can tell the devs made this solely for a paycheck instead of caring at all about the original strider. 

Cashgrab.

review:
[h1]장점 [/h1]
+ 고전 아케이드 액션 게임의 느낌을 잘 살림
+ 진행하면 착실하게 성장하는 캐릭터 

[h1]단점 [/h1]
- 피격 모션이 부실함
- 초반이 조금 쉬움

[h1]평점 [/h1]
6/10

게임성 6/10
스토리 5/10
영상미 6/10 

[h1]화려하게 돌아온 비룡 [/h1]
 
스트라이더 히류는 80년대 후반 전성기를 구사하던 닌자용검전, 시노비 시리즈와 함께 닌자가 주인공인 횡스크롤 플랫폼 게임 중 하나입니다. 닮은 것 같지만 세 가지 게임은 모두 차이점을 가지고 있는데 닌자용검전은 점프의 거리와 맵 구성을 외우는 것이 중요한 전형적인 플랫폼 장르의 특징을 가지고 있고 시노비는 칼보다는 수리검이나 총같은 원거리 액션에 조금 더 중점을 가지고 있습니다.

스트라이더 히류 시리즈의 공통적인 특징은 바로 독특한 세계관과 액션입니다.  인간과 싸우게 되는 다른 두 가지 시리즈와 다르게 스트라이더 히류 시리즈의 공통 된 적은 안드로이드입니다. 물론 보스급 악당들은 인간인 경우가 많지만 대부분이라고 할 정도의 거의 모든 적들은 기계로 된 안드로이드 병사들이고 이러한 부분들이 게임 안에서 연출 효과로 잘 표현하고 있는데  플레이어의 칼질에 적이 잘려나가는 모습들이 자칫 잔인하게 느껴 질 수 있지만 적이 안드로이드 기계다 보니 그러한 거부감은 적은 편입니다.

스토리는 매우 단순한 편인데 근 미래를 배경으로 그랜드 마스터라는 독재자가 안드로이드 병사들을 이용해 세계를 지배하고 있다는 설정입니다. 주인공인 히류는 스트라이더즈라는 특수 암살 집단의 일원으로서 그랜드 마스터를 제거하기 위해 혈혈단신으로 적진에 뛰어들며 게임이 시작됩니다.

게임의 방식은 전형적인 횡스크롤 플랫폼 장르의 특성을 띄고 있지만 원작처럼 특수 점프를 하거나 지붕에 갈고리를 이용해 매달려서 종방향으로 이동하는 것도 가능합니다. 적들의 공격 패턴이나 적의 종류가 다양하거나 까다로운 편은 아니고 공격력 또한 높은 편이 아니라서 죽으며 다시하는 방식으로 패턴을 외우면서 하는 높은 난이도의 게임은 아닙니다.

조작감이나 게임의 진행 방법이 간단한 게임이지만 게임을 진행할수록 무기나 아이템이 추가되고 적들 또한 조금씩 조작감을 추가해주는 것도 좋고 다양한 배경과 장소를 이동하며 연출을 신경 쓰는 부분도 훌륭해서 지루해질 부분을 해결해주는 점도 좋았습니다.

다만 플레이타임이 짧은 편이며 한글화를 지원하지 않고 게임 패드가 아니라 키보드로 한다면 어려울 수도 있다는 점은 아쉽습니다. 그렇지만 전체적으로 게임 자체의 재미는 나쁘지 않으니 크게 스토리에 신경을 쓰지 않고 액션 게임을 즐기고 싶다면 추천하는 작품입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025151422', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 1522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1693259070}
review:
I thought I had reviewed this one... Huh... Well, what should I say...

For starters, if you are familiar with the Strider series, you might want to rethink for a moment... Unless you are REALLY familiar, and by that I mean "being aware the NES version exists". Why this? Because this version of Strider plays closer to that of the NES, in that you explore the places and find items required to progress, the main difference being this is full-on exploration with upgrades to find on the way, as well as costumes of previous Striders, artwork and enemy information. Like in most Strider games, you can simply mash attack to deal with some enemies on the way, while others requires a different approach, including the use of Options, changing the Cypher's element, charging the attack, sliding, slamming, etc.

Another aspect is the difficulty of the game don't expect an easy trip through Normal, early enemies won't be much a threat, but if you don't know where nor how to regain health you will find yourself dying... A lot. By endgame you WILL want to be at full power. The pacing may feel a bit slow, but thankfully there's a lot to explore, coupled with minimal loading times and a large map per loading sections, so your adventure won't be hindered in manners that would be annoying.

The effects and details are of high quality for the time, with minimal negative impact (or at times NO negative impact) on overall performance. If you are a fan of Strider, you might want to give this one a chance. If you like hack and slash or "metroidvanias", be SURE to give this one a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072545540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1547161078}
review:
Gran homenaje al cásico Strider con apariciones estelares de sus enemigos más carismáticos.

Con un control muy rápido y directo y una acción desbocada, deberemos atravesar diferentes zonas para enfrentarnos al malote Meio. De estilo metroidvania, aunque los diseños y animaciones son buenos, acaba haciéndose repetitivo hasta la saciedad. Regresar a zonas anteriores a recoger objetos antes inaccesibles es un suplício por la falta de interés de las mejoras y lo parecido de los entornos. De la música se puede decir lo mismo, ambienta bien y tiene algunos momentos memorables pero carece de temas suuficientes como para no acabar cayendo en la monotonia.

Pese a todo, un buen juego de acción y digno sucesor del original, aunque quizás, hoy en día no es suficiente solo con esto. Ni siquiera cuando salió.

review: Wow, very impressed! Being a fan of the arcade version of Strider, and remembering the unique music, artwork, and gameplay, I had low expectations when I purchased this game. More than just a side scroller, its a real in-depth look into the world of Strider Hiryu. Sadly I purchased this game a few years back and just never installed and played it. It was such a pleasant surprise to get into the game and realize the kept to the formula of the series. Great job Capcom on this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040152113', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1546365667}
review:
Recently I've been really itching to play an excellent and challening Metroidvania. Which is what ultimately lead me to give Strider a shot. Strider is a really good game with combat and movement mechanics that encourage a fast paced style of play but doesnt have much in the way of challenge.
   
First off I would just like to say that if you were looking primarily for a challenging Metroidvania Platformer Strider is not it. Strider is best described as a 2.5D action side-scroller with some Metroidvania elements and simple platforming. The majority of the game is spent moving forward with most of the backtracking and exploration left up to the player. New abilities that are necessary to open the path ahead are typically found along the way. If you wish unlock secret costumes, concept art, most of the health/energy upgrades which are all optional you need to back track to find areas where you previously could not get into.  The platforming is quite forgiving and its usually obvious what you have do. The game will not challenge you in this aspect. 
    
Strider starts you off with one primary attack and a simple jump but doesnt take long before you are given other attack and movement options. Strider Hiryu's primary attack is a slash that can be executed in eight different directions and can literally be performed as quickly as the player can press the button. This means the faster the attack button is pressed the more attacks that can be performed within a certain amount of time leading to enemies dying faster. However not all enemies can be felled with the basic slash which is where the special abilites and elemental weapon upgrades come in. These are gained simply by progressing through the game. Some of the speacial abilities include a bird of prey and panther which can be summoned and unleashed upon your enemies at any point (after they have been unlocked) so long as you have the required energy. Energy recharges on its own and is displayed as a red bar under your health bar. Elemental upgrades are applied to both your sword and kunai. There are four total Elements that can be equipped including the default one you start out with. My favorite was the fire upgrade as it not only sets enemies aflame but also does the most damage.
   
The combat in Strider is quite simple but its effectiveness as well enjoyability are dependant on how quick the player is not only able to execute his abilities but also knowing which abilities should be used in what order. Playing as Strider can really make you feel like you are an unstoppable speed demon of death. Running into room and killing a group of foot soliders before they are even able to react because you are swinging your blade at blinding speeds. Without missing a beat you switch to your ice blade freezing the flying enemies above with each strike. These frozen enemies can now be used as platforms so you can jump on them and deflect those pesky lazer turrets projectiles right back at them with your blade and killing all the airborne baddies before you even hit the floor. Everything I described can be done fluidly without interruption at a fast pace. The controls are very tight and responsive. The visual feedback is quite satisfying with sparks flying whenever strider deflects projectiles or attacks an enemy. Enemies also explode upon death typically after being halved by your blade.
   
The game is easy on normal which is an issue because the combat really starts to shine when it demands the most out of you. The bosses are fun to fight but some are so easy that it felt like I beat them in under a minute. The most difficult part of the final boss was just dodging a particularly damaging projectile attack (not difficult) besides that I just spammed attack when possible and he died in 3 tries. The only reason I even died twice was because I wasnt taking him seriously to begin with. I have not played the game on hard but I have heard that hard mode is significantly more difficult than normal. The bosses are supposed to be a real bitch on hard.
   
Strider's main selling point is its fun fast paced fluid combat and the biggest downside is the difficulty. The game is worth the $15 asking price and is a must buy at the sale price of $4.50. The game will take you about 4-5hrs if you rush through the game, 7-8hrs if you complete most of the game (about 65%-75%), and about 9-10hrs if you do a completionist run. It took me 7hrs to complete 70% of it.

    On a scale between 1-10 with 5 being average this is a 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970472710', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1542278621}
review:
A great reimagining of the Strider series with a few terrible design issues. The graphics, sound, and gameplay are great. Unfortunately, a few enemies with stun-lock attacks ruin the fast-paced action toward the later part of the game. I also quit on the final boss because the camera was ridiculously wonky and the boss' (unnecessary) trash-talking covers a quarter of the screen in the form of subtitles that you cannot see through to navigate around the room causing you to lose track of your character. Both of these issues make the final boss not even worth the trouble.

Thankfully, this one is all about the journey, not the destination. If you want a NES throwback that's been beautifully modernized, I would highly recommend this one with the few caveat mentioned above.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961908404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1410067198}
review:
I meant to review this game a while back, however, better late than never.

I played the original NES title and the Playstation version as well.

I'll keep it simple.  If you enjoy Metroidvania, Contra, or Mega Man games, then there isn't any reason for you not to own/play this title.  It has a little bit of all of those series' in this game.  The gameplay, action, sound, etc. is all on point and pays homage to the older title with the soundtrack.   It isn't difficult to get into and there is plenty to do to warrant the price.  I played through the game a couple times and it doesn't ever feel like a chore or overbearing.  That is when you know a game is worth being in your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009059089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1504, 'last_played': 1541472455}
review:
Do you like MetroidVanias? 
do you like jumping around a lot?
do you like climbing walls?
do you like ninja? ('ninja' is plural)
do you like swords?
do you like sci-fi? 
...do you like scarfs?

If you answered 'yes' to at least six of the previous questions then... you are a very positive person. Good for you, mate.
Also, since this game is a solid action-packed MetroidVania in which you jump around a lot, you climb walls and you are a futuristic sword-wielding shinobi wearing a scarf, you're in luck. 

- Graphics: pretty cool even for today's standards.
- Music: I particularly loved it since it's a modernized version of old Strider soundtracks (duh, right? Well, I'm just saying it's not all new melodies. So nostalgia could be triggered if you're a fan... although if you are, you're not reading this because you bought the game years ago, when it came out), and it was very exciting for me to listen to the melodies I remember from my days playing Strider on the NES (yes, I was a Nintendo kid).
- Gameplay: is not as fun as it was on Strider 2 on PSX, but it is VERY close. Hiryu is fast, precise and responsive. It is just a pleasure to jump around while delivering death and destruction to those who dare stand in the way of your blade, even if every now and then you stick to a ceiling or wall you didn't intend to.

Exploration is kinda limited by the minimap always telling you where to go and stuff (maybe there is a way to turn that off) but always encouraged (and rewarding) if you're one of those humans who get obsessed over getting every single collectible.

The difficulty is fair as long as you know what you're doing. Not everything is solved just by slicing your way through (damned shields!), so as long as you pay attention to the enemies and such you're not gonna have any problems.

The game is not long. You could probably clear it in less than 6 hours while getting everything and without being in a rush... I haven't done that, so I cannot tell for sure, but I'm pretty sure it wouldn't be a problem.

What else?... bosses? they are fun. Story?... it's ok, I guess... don't expect big thrills in that department. 
Mmmh... I dunno... I like this game. I played it four years ago and cleared it. Came back yesterday for the 'Speed Demon' achievement and had fun with it. Now I wanna get all the achievements too, so I guess if it is a game worth coming back to after four years, it is already way better than most.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030589833', 'num_games_owned': 673, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1540573842}
review:
I had a lot of fun with Strider. 

At first I was not impressed. The platforming controls felt imprecise and beating the early batch of enemies involved pure button mashing. The art style was unique but not mindblowing, and the music was par for the course for this sort of game. Meh.

BUT, I gave it it chance, and I'm glad I did, because as progress was made: the environments became more expansive, inviting exploration; a host of powers and upgrades become available, making combat more varied; and the enemies and platforming amped up in difficulty, which made the whole thing far more interesting. In short, I had to scratch beneath the surface to get to the good stuff. 

Good stuff it is, but not mindblowingly good. It does what it sets out to do nonetheless; it's  a great platformer that's pretty addictive, challenging in places, but always forgiving in the number of tries you can have. Also, the japanese anime and arcade sensibilities are well executed too if you like that sort of thing.  

Give it a whirl. I never played the original Strider so can't compare, but this game stands strong in it's own right.

review: Those who remember the original Strider will recall a fast-paced action arcade game- Strider 2014, however, is not an arcade-style game at all. Rather, it takes the foundational combat of Strider- running swiftly, making acrobatic jumps, and slashing enemies with your sword id rapid succession- and rebuilds that into the concept of a Metroidvania. You'll be exploring Kazakh City, acquiring new abilities, collection health and energy upgrades, and everything else you'd expect from the genre. Strider 2014 doesn't really do anything new- but then again, it doesn't need to. It's a fine game that has what you'd expect from a Metroidvania- nothing more, nothing less. Lots of hidden upgrades to collect, great boss fights, and all with  fair bit of style to it. I give this game a solid 8/10.
